description:
What a fantastic find! 

Me and fiancé love Istanbul as it was the first country we travelled to together and because of how much we love Turkish food! We'd been missing it recently and stumbled upon this absolute gem. If you are looking for authentic Mediterranean food in the Bay Area at a reasonable price, this is your place! 

Tuba is tucked away on a quiet street corner in the Mission District and possesses a fantastic staff that demonstrates extreme attention to detail and is generous with their bread! The hummus is fresh and tasted fantastic next to the bread. The Kuzu Sis was perfectly cooked and the Musakka was extremely wholesome. 

Overall, a fantastic restaurant with great food and great service. Well worth the visit!
author: Taimur A.

description:
Super solid dinner spot, but man is this place tiny! Our large group was packed in with a ton of other large groups. The place was pretty loud and you definitely felt like you had to head out and get a breath of fresh air once you were done eating. I will say the service was pretty solid for how packed the place was and the menu had a ton of tasty options.

Not surprising the appetizer menu here is hard to narrow down. So much deliciousness! While the grape leaves weren't my favorite I did enjoy many of the other dishes the table ordered like the hummus and falafel. Our table was pretty split in ordering the lamb or the salmon. I opted for the salmon and was super happy with my choice. The fish was cooked and seasoned perfectly. The creamed spinach that came along with it-- I could just eat a quart of it easily. It was really delicious. 

Overall a great place for dinner, but maybe not so much for a large group.
author: Holly K.

description:
The wait was worth it. The restaurant has a nice homey feel, coincidentally 2 birthday serenades took place tonight that made the place feel warm and welcoming! We ordered three entrees: Sarma beyti kebab (beef wrapped in bread with tomato and yogurt garlic sauce), karniyarik (eggplant with ground beef), and the manti (hidden menu item of beef dumplings and yogurt garlic sauce).

The manti was delicious, handmade garlic and beef dumplings with enough sauce to dip our complimentary fresh baked bread.  The sarma beyti kebab was filling and perfectly edible with each bite size gently wrapped in a type of bread that absorbed the tomato and yogurt - it had a very slight spicy kick. The karniyarik eggplant + beef dish was reminiscent of a Mediterranean take on chilli. The rice pudding dessert was a perfect finisher.  The best way to describe it would be a more hearty Indian Kheer with a cinnamon punch!
author: Josel S.

description:
We made our reservation for early dinner last Sunday. The restaurant was nice and quiet when we walked in (I'm not a fan of loud restaurants).

Our food was EXCELLENT!

We ordered;
Hummus (5/5) It's so creamy

Hunkar Begendi (4.5/5) Leg of lamb chunks are very tender but it can get a little dry out if you take too long to eat it. 

Kofte (10/5) one word... Bomb! This might be the best beef patties I've ever had! 

Musakka (5/5) we ordered it to-go for my mother in-law. It's one of her favorite foods. She really liked it even tho she didn't eat it until the next day. If she's happy, we're all happy. Lol..

The service was top notch. Very attentive. Never have to ask for anything. We'll probably be back here again (too many other restaurants to try). 

Until then...
author: Tawan G.

description:
I was so excited to try a new (to me) restaurant that was so highly rated while in San Francisco with my team last week! Tuba did not disappoint. My friend and I were the first to arrive, and we were deciding between the two rosés on the menu, when our server offered us a taste of each - very nice! We opted for the drier of the two, which was served in chilled glasses which I thought was an awesome touch. Nothing better than a super cold glass of rosé, in my opinion. 

When the rest of our group arrived, we ordered a selection of appetizers. Hummus, falafel, and a baked shrimp and feta dish were just some of the dishes among many we shared. This was a great start to the meal and everything I tasted was delicious.

The chicken dish I had my eye on wasn't available that night, so I opted for the baked salmon with creamed spinach. My other thought was to go for the off-menu dumplings in Greek yogurt sauce, but I will have to try those next time. The salmon proved to be a great choice - a nice mix of healthy and rich/savory on one plate. 

Everyone was stuffed after their meals and we skipped dessert. It's worth noting that service was excellent and the staff worked together so you could make eye contact with any of the servers and they would be right over to help (usually just for another glass of wine since they were so on top of everything else, including water refills). I would happily return for another meal.
author: Michelle C.

description:
A completely unplanned visit in the vicinity bought my husband and I to Tuba Turkish Restaurant. It was a Saturday night and we showed up without a reservation. There were a couple names ahead of us in the waiting list and we reached during peak dinner hours so our wait was quite long (around 40 mins).

But as soon as we got a table, the service was quick and we got our order pretty soon. One bite of the FALAFEL and we realized that our 40 minute was completely worth it. It was the perfect flavor-packed fritter with a crisp cover. The bed of Hummus on the side was also delicious.

We also got the SIGARA BOREGI which was basically fillo dough stuffed with potatoes, feta cheese, parsley. It was a slightly on the blander side for me but my husband loved it.

And since my husband is a vegetarian, we got the MUSAKKA to share. It was unlike any of the Musakkas I've had so far. Eggplant stuffed with the holy trinity of potatoes, zucchini, and mozzarella cheese and topped with béchamel sauce - this dish was a showstopper! The rice and salad served on the side went perfectly well with the eggplant.

Not to forget, the complimentary BREAD PLATE served in the beginning is really good too!

I am definitely going back to sample more dishes from their menu. Highly recommend for some amazing Turkish food!
author: Ishani S.

description: This place is very good! Very tasty! Loved everything about it. The people that serve and host are mostly very nice. You get a little bit of so so customer service and not so accommodating body language from one of the hosts but in general the others are very nice. The food is really good here even though the restaurant is small the ambiance again is very nice and inviting. I really liked the food here. My wife had the kebab and I had the salmon which I wanted more of haha. All in all great experience, would highly recommend them and come back again!
author: Mac C.

description:
This was my second time at Tuba. Great vegetarian dishes and everything we ordered was delicious. The mezze sampler is large with a nice variety. It's a great starter to share.  

The red lentil soup was light, not heavy and thick like other lentil soups I've had. Nice seasoning. Great service and food came out quickly. Highly recommend.
author: Carol H.

description:
Arriving right on time for our dinner reservation. We got a nice corner window seat to people watch as we dine. It was great!

What was even better was the damn food. Everything we ordered was amazing. From their signature meze to falafel salad (a little too much sauce) and Adana kebab which included a mixed of beef and lamb meat with special seasoning. It was quite filling that we ended up boxing some of the food home.

Overall, we enjoyed the casual ambiance at Tuba and the attentive staff. I hope you give this place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description:
I wish this place were better... Judging from the past reviews and the pictures, I could not wait to try out tuba. The appetizers were phenomenal actually! For appetizers we had baba ghanouj, kibbe (ball shaped ground meat), and their complimentary bread. Who doesn't love free bread? And I was pleased with the Kibbe which came on a bed of labneh! 
However, the main course was a huge disappointment. It was a skewer of lamb, and came with very little veggies... rice... very paltry! For an entree that was $24+, I was hoping for an extra skewer, or something. So, no, I will not be going back again because it's just too expensive for the value! And if I want good middle eastern food, I could really find another place. The place is also really loud so it's not good for a date either! So the ambiance was mediocre, at best, and the food was yummy, but the price did not match.
author: Katherine L.

description:
I was so looking forward to dining at Tuba.  Well, it's not at all what I thought it was going to be.  Located in a somewhat residential part of Mission district, next to a couple of other restaurants, it's small, nice and dark, and basically non-descript.  It could be a steakhouse or a Z Gallerie exhibit, it didn't ring anything resembling Turkish.  Bottomline, it didn't transport me (and that's what I liked most in ethnic dining).  No music, no dancing, and no special décor.  So food, service, vibe, and energy is what's left to enjoy, and judge further.

Service
=======
...is a high-point.  Our waitress (didn't catch her name, and it wasn't listed on the receipt) was pleasant, helpful, and very nice...despite how over time, the restaurant became more and more busy.  She didn't change negatively or rushed at all.  She took her time to answer questions, and recommend.  My party of 4 were talkative, and asked many things over the evening.

The food
========
Smallish menu, but more than a tough decision to choose from all categories:

1.  We elected to try the Sampler Plate ("Tuba Meze Tabağı"), an 8 item cold meza plate.  Expensive, but it went very fast with 4 hangry folks.  All was good, but my favorite was the Cevizli Ezme, mainly a mixture of walnuts and red pepper paste.  [$25, 4.0 stars]

2.  I vacillated between 3 entrees, so the waitress was nice enough to recommend the Adana Kebab.  Wrong choice!  One kebab, well done, tougher than wood.  Seasoned nice and slightly spicy, I liked the rice
and charbroiled assortment of vegetables.  But was too pricy for one kebab, and really not good.  [$22, 2.5 stars]

Vibe & Energy
============
Both good.  Every seat in the place was taken, loud with big talkers.  Music could be more present.  Overall, I liked.

Conclusion
==========
The food wasn't that impressive on this night [~3.25 stars], rounded up because it's far from average on all other categories.
author: Randy B.

description:
We had a lovely meal at Tuba tonight. The host greeted us warmly and made us feel welcome right away. All of the servers were warm, kind and attentive without being intrusive. The atmosphere was comfortable with pleasant music in the background at a low volume. 

We started with the mezze combo that seemed expensive at $25. But it was worth every penny. I loved the tzatziki and an eggplant dip. My wife really enjoyed the spinach dip. There was also a tomato walnut spread, another vegetable one with zucchini, beans and salad, hummus and dolmas. A dish of flatbread arrived with a delicious butter, a few olives and a little feta. After we polished that off we were both almost full. Then the entrees came. I had the mousaaka which my wife adored. I've been eating low dairy and it was a bit rich for me. She had the eggplant stuffed with meat and enjoyed it but liked mine better. Both entrees came with wonderful well cooked rice that had some surprise garbanzos in it as well as a generous pile of mixed green salad. 

The meal was a little pricey but portions were large and we have big appetites - next time I'd get the mezze sampler again and split an entree. As it was we both took Home sizeable leftovers.
author: Marco M.

description:
First time at Tuba to celebrate my wife's birthday, and we really enjoyed the meal. We were immediately welcomed and felt at home. The appetizers all looked great, so rather than making a decision we ordered the Tuba Meze Tabağı, which included all the cold appetizers. We enjoyed sampling everything, with our favorite being the Patlıcan Salatası (pureed eggplant, very much like Baba Ganoush with a smokey flavor). This was way too much for the two of us so about half of it ended up in a to-go box.

For the main course I ordered the Tavuk Şiş, a tender chicken skewered chicken. I'm always worried when I order a dish with small chunks of meat that are broiled that the meat will be dried out. That definitely wasn't the case here, with the chicken being juicy and flavorful.

My wife ordered the Karnıyarık, an eggplant stuffed with ground beef. It was also really tasty.

We ended up taking a lot of our food home to enjoy the next evening (between the huge appetizer plate and our generous portions).

We opted not to have dessert, but were happily surprised when the entire staff encircled our table and sang happy birthday to my wife, delivering a wonderful chocolate mouse surrounded by a hard chocolate shell (I don't know the name of the dish, I don't see it on their menu). See photo... really special.

Service was very good, but we had several people serving us, so a few times communications were crossed.

We'll definitely return. It was a very special night, made better by the great food and helpful staff.
author: David F.

description:
There was something about this food that was just really nuanced. 

From the dolmades (or whatever the turkish word is for dolmades) which were a lighter filling, 100 percent house made (***most greek places don't make their own cause it's too much of a pain in the neck***), and slightly sweet filling; they were quite delicious. 

Peynirli Karides: 
Prawns sautéed with tomatoes and garlic in pepperoncini sauce and topped with feta cheese

This prawn dish was quite delicious. I can't express how much of the leftover broth I soaked up with any given carb that was within arm's reach.

There are a few things you notice if you read through the entirety of the menu. I'll start off with the odd one: there is mozzarella used in a number of dishes. One of those dishes we decided to order: 

HünkarBeğendi
Pureed eggplant with mozzarella cheese and garlic, topped with leg of lamb chunks in red sauce. 

This was NOT a mistake by any means. The pureed eggplant had just such a beautifully punchy taste that didn't lack for a second of eggplant flavor and/essence. Eggplant was the star of that puree. For me, mozzarella and Turkish didn't really compute. But when the dish came to the table and I got to taste it... the likeness worked it's math like a mathematician at a trigonometry convention. 

I also got to try the 3 day marinated legs of lamb. Flippin delicious.

These were the stand out dishes. 

I also did get to try the 

Icli Kofte
The Falafel
Shrimp Entree

These were less standouts than the aforementioned dishes. Fried items like the falafel and Icli Kofte tended to be a bit drier than I'd have hoped. 

The Shrimp entree was good (Shrimp were cooked very well), but in comparison to the lamb chops or eggplant dish, which were so incredibly strong, paled peripherally. 

Wouldn't hesitate to make my way back. I'd love to try the Lamb Kebab, Moussaka, Cevizli Ezme (which several Yelpers are referring to as their signature appetizer).
author: Mike B.

description: My husband and I love trying new places and this was one of the places we decided to try in the city. We had made reservations and we were accommodated on time. I loved the place right away, I usually like cosy little places and this place was adorable for a date night. The service, food and ambiance was excellent. We will definitely return again. If you're thinking of a date night this is the place to go.
author: Konstancia M.

description:
Amazing food. Really top notch. Every thing on the menu is incredible. 

The carnyinik is incredible. Eggplant and lamb in an incredible slow cook medley sauce. Holy sheep!, it's amazing. 


Any eggplant dish is so perfectly done.
author: Matt L.

description:
Teeny tiny spot packed with a ton of flavor! I'm definitely a fan of Tuba's authentic, flavorful menu. I was there with a relatively large group, so we ordered a bunch of appetizers to start with: stuffed grape leaves, hummus, falafel (served flattened rather than in balls, which was interesting -- still good!), a shrimp dish, and a fried ball with meat inside... I can't remember the name. All was very tasty -- I liked that the grape leaves had a touch of sweetness, and while it's relatively difficult to mess up hummus, Tuba's is smooth and creamy and tahini-y and scrumptious.

For my main, I had trouble choosing between the salmon and the lamb chops, but ended up getting the latter and was very happy with my choice. It was excellent -- they didn't actually ask how I'd like the meat cooked, but it came out as a perfect medium/medium-rare which I was very happy with. Super flavorful -- I was literally sucking the bones to get as much meat off as I could. It was served with a handful of roasted veggies and some rice on the side, which tasted good but I thought could have been a little more robust in portion and presentation.

Overall, an excellent experience at Tuba! It's clearly the place to be, I even ran into someone I know from back home in Northern VA -- totally randomly! -- while there. I would happily return for more deliciousness upon a future trip, especially to try the salmon (which some of my coworkers ordered, and it did look fab!)
author: Gretchen F.

description:
Came here for a team dinner with a bunch of co-workers and immediately knew I was going to be impressed. The staff was extremely accommodating of our group even though it was a little bigger and made sure we were all seated and comfortable. This place isn't the biggest so keep that in mind if you come with a bigger than usual party size, luckily we had a reservation.

Our group ordered a plate of most of the main dishes and a bunch of starters as well to try out. We also ordered a few bottles of wine which were all pretty great, I'm a Pinot Noir guy myself and enjoyed what they had. Everything was delicious but the Lamb sticks out to me as one of the things I really loved. I also liked the Eggplant dish that they had on the menu!
author: Isaiah W.

description:
Really chill ambiance and excellent service. They were super attentive to our large group and were able to answer any questions we had. We ordered a handful of apps. I absolutely love grape leaves, but always find them to be too mushy. Very few and far between places have an excellent one. This place fell in the mushy category. I was bummed.

But my main order, lamb chops, were cooked perfectly. They were juicy and tender, with a good portion. I thought the side of veggies and rice fell a little flat. The veggies really didn't taste like anything at all. The rose I ordered was a perfect pairing for this type of food though, and I'd strongly suggest the drier one if that's what you're into. 

I would totally be into stopping by again and seeing if some of the other main dishes are a win.
author: Rachel C.

description:
This is my first authentic Turkish restaurant ever, I went with couple of friends who were also vegetarians. We were really bummed looking at the menu, the only option for vegetarians was eggplant.  So we decided to order one entree with 2 hot mezes.  

Musakka was amazing. One of the best non Indian eggplant dish I have had. Mezes came with sides of salad, and were filling .

baklava and rice pudding were awesome . I highly recommend trying the rice pudding here.

Although a bit pricey, it's a very nice place with friendly staff and amazing food. Must try
author: Darshan R.

description: My friend had the Musakka and I ate the Kofte! Both we so good. Generous portions. When you arrive the give you a nice bread platter with some olives, feta, and a traditional dip. This place is small so recommend a reservation. My friend and I didn't not but they were able to seat us at the bar, which is literally big enough for two people. I lived in Turkey for two years and the food here made me feel like I was back in Ankara. I will be back soon!
author: Julianne O.

description:
I had the opportunity to grace this place twice. 

First time, we were a group and came without reservations. Even though there were quite a few empty tables when asked upon being seated at the end of the tables that the front ones were left for reservations-didn't see anyone till the end of our prolonged dinner when we decided to splurge some more for dessert. I found this sketchy-judgemental maybe?
On the second visit, I came after a friend already scored a table near the front without any reservations. Very big eyebrows raised here.

First time, ordered a lot of food. Had the combo mezze which was delicious! The hummus not necessarily as flavorful as the rest. Dolmas were more on the sweeter side due to spices and ingredients used.
Lamb chops were well marinated and tasty. Meal portions and presentation was on point during both visits so a score here!
The eggplant with ground meat was good too although a little too much on the tomatoey side.
The kefta kabob I barely tasted as I wasn't sure if it contained bulgur-that small bite wasn't tasty for me.

The hot tea was a presentation on its own by the way it's served.  do this!

The Turkish coffee was tried by a companion and it also seemed lavish with its own small plate of sweets.

I didn't enjoy the kunafe as much bc I think I confused it with the sweet cream wardat (which I absolutely loved and enjoyed in Istanbul)

Second time I went I kept it basic. Had the lentil soup which was nice. The falafel and hummus plate wasn't as satisfying. My friend didn't like her dish either (meatballs with yogurt)-she thought it also didn't have much taste.

I might return in the future but I think I've tried a lot of their dishes. Service is otherwise friendly but I didn't like the discerning seating choices based off of dress. Hello, this is freakin SF.
author: Summer S.

description:
Came here for dinner on a Sunday night and fell in love with the food.

the turkish lentil soup is unique and flavorful, i would go here just to eat it with some bread.
author: Sourabh B.

description:
I love Turkish food because I have great memories from Istanbul!

This place has a great food and great service. Food was so so delicious and real Turkish food. Please please don't forget to get the kenafeh for desert! It is the most delicious desert in the world!
author: Sara S.

description:
This is definitely my favorite turkish place in the Bay Area. Food is phenomenal and so is service. We were fasting today and had an amazing time breaking our fast there. Staff was very kind, they brought us food nice and warm right on Iftar time. Me and my husband asked them if they'd be able to give us half size of cold meza sampler and they did it for. We ended up on getting cold meza sampler (perfect for 4 people), fish (today's special) and Serma Beyti kebab that's basically kebab wrapped in lavish and tomato sauce on it. Everything was absolutely delicious. I loved every bite in my mouth. 
Last time we came here and tried something different and I remember I loved everything and today I had the same experience both taste wise and service wise. The best thing about this place is that Menu is small so you don't have to think a lot. And everything tastes as good. 
I personally loved their cold meza platters and kebabs and would highly recommend it. 
In the last we had their specialty desert. It was sooo good that it melted in my mouth. It literally melt (because it had cheese in it haha) 

Food taste: 5/5
Food quality: 5/5
Service: 5/5 
Ambiance: 5/5
author: Sumbal A.

description:
Being Turkish and having spent my entire life eating my mom's home cooked Turkish food .. I might come across as a bit biased here but I was not a fan of Tuba. My boyfriend and I have recently moved to San Francisco from NYC and decided that we wanted to get our Turkish fix on so we did what we do best - start reading Yelp reviews. It seemed that Tuba was the best rated out of a handful of places.

We made a reservation and although we had a reservation we had to wait a little bit to get seated - which is ok. The place was packed and we thought 'This must be a great sign!'

We were super underwhelmed with the food. My boyfriend ordered a Beyti and I got an Adana Kebab alongside the meze sampler. The meat just did not have any flavor, the rice was bland and mushy, and the mezes did not resemble the Turkish flavors at all. Overall we felt like we were eating anything but Turkish food.

We decided to not give up on the place and order dessert - Kunefe. A big nope once again. It wasn't crispy and overall just mushy.

The bread was ok and we loved that we can get some Efes which is why I'm going with 2 stars here.
author: Inci A.

description: I've traveled to Turkey 3 times and the food is sub-par compared to what they serve here. We always have to accommodate our daughter who is vegan and we found this place that has vegan options. The place is popular so make a reservation in advance. The service and the many dishes we picked were very delicious, kind of pricy but good for a group outing.
author: Franklin M.

description: Amazing turkish food, the bread that comes out is fresh soft and delicious, chicken was tender and kefta was so good. We had knafe and turkish coffee it was really good, overall i would definitely recommend this place.
author: Yasmine K.

description:
Easy to make reservations on Yelp, yummy food, and a cozy atmosphere. Come here for Mezes and Kebabs for 2-4 people. I like this better than Troya.

Tuba Meze Tabağı: Since we could not decide on which meze appetizer to get, we opted for the sampler. Wow this was filling and yummy. Everything was amazing to eat and frankly it filled us up so much we could not finish our entrees. Probably better to share amongst 4 people rather than 2.

Sarma Beyti Kebab: Presentation is just on point. This is a wonderful dish to look at and eat. The garlic yogurt sauce complements the tomato sauce on the adana kebab. Just gorgeous. 

Adana Keba: The standard ground beef kebab mixed with bell peppers and accompanying sides. Very tasty! 

Coffee with Turkish Delight: Wonderful way to finish the dinner. The waiter will swing the coffee pot around and serve - always makes us smile.

Why is this 4 and not 5 stars? We came here on a hot September day with Yelp reservations and were lucky to be seated outside where it was a lovely 75 F outside. Everybody on the inside kept shooting us jealous looks, as the inside of the restaurant felt like 90 F - you could literally feel the heat emanating from the restaurant to the outside. However there were only two tables outside which could seat 2 per table, so any party over 2 automatically sat inside. It got so hot that a large party of 6 asked to relocate themselves to the outside so as to feel more comfortable, resulting in chairs and tables spilling over onto the adjacent storefront and sidewalk. I think it might be worth investing in A/C for those hot days.
author: Myles L.

description:
So, I know very little about Turkish food - it's a lot like Greek - which is a good thing.

The cold appetizer sampler is the way to go. It was really quite good sized - and here is where they made their keep - they bring you as much bread as you want to go with it. :) The dip with tomato in it and the spinach one were my favorite, but they were all good. My husband liked the baba ganoush the best. For three of us it went a long way.

I got the baked eggplant with the ground beef in it (I can't remember any of the names of things - I couldn't pronounce any of them at the restaurant either). The meet was very flavorful. I couldn't really taste the eggplant at all though. Plenty of it - had to take some home.

My brother go the lamb on the pureed eggplant, that was also good - nicely flavored lamb.

It wasn't a cheap meal, but the portions were healthy and the quality off food was good, so no complaints. 

One thing that was a little funny: None of the servers seemed to speak awesome English? Which wasn't a problem, and I suppose is authentic, but it was a little strange. 

Quite a few people there on a Tuesday night - but we were still able to bet a table. But it's relatively intimate.
author: Sarah C.

description: Fantastic food! Every dish is full of flavors. Cevizli Ezme is a must try. The lamb chops are so moist and tasty, so is the Adana Kabab. I also love the eggplant signature entries. Be sure to save some room for the amazing fried cheese dessert Kunefe.
author: Tingting L.

description:
Wow! Blown away by this delicious meal. We we're pleasantly surprised how delicious the food was from start to finish, and the impeccable service (harder to come by!) myself and my boyfriend dined here on a Saturday night and it was packed! I would make a reservation. 

The complimentary bread is delicious it comes with a few small sides (olives, feta, oil) delicious to use for your appetizers too. We ordered the red pepper cold meze it's true signature dish. We found it to be delicious! Very different and unique flavor and veggie friendly. Can easily be shared among 2-4 ppl. We also ordered the stuffed beef shells, which were also delicious! Cake with 2 and they can easily be halved and shared. The flavors were scrumptious. 

For or main we shared the Adnana beef kabob. It was absolutely delicious! It's perfect to share given all the appetizers, bread and shareable food. I'm sure this could be eaten solo but with two of us sharing so many items this made sense. The kabob was juicy and flavorful! Highly recommend.

We were so full we passed on dessert but did order the Turkish tea. We have an awesome Turkish server, she was so friendly and kind she actually brought over a baclava and ice cream. It was ever so sweet and perfect amount to share. We were blown away by her service and we rarely see this sort of service at all so all in all we found this to be w highlight.

Definitely come here it's amazing and affordable with options for everyone! Also great for small groups!
author: Priya S.

description: I don't think I have ever been to an authentic Turkish restaurant ever in America so this was my first time. I don't quite recall the name of the appetizer I had ordered but it was a tomato paste mixed with a ton of other ingredients and it was delicious. They do serve complimentary bread with little sides which was also really tasty. My fiancé ordered the kabob which was ground beef and I ordered the lamb kabob and it comes with rice, taztiki sauce, grilled veggies, and pickles.  For dessert, I ordered the kunefe with Turkish tea and it was very delicious. The quality and taste of the food was good. Great customer service and quality of place is great!!! Do try this place out!!!!
author: Neloffer E.

description:
Food was amazing! It was easy to make reservations and the ambiance was
quite nice. We had the moussaka, zucchini fritters, and Cevizli Ezme. 
and all were excellent!
Must try kunefe. 
Service was also excellent. Would definitely come back.
author: Daphne S.

description: Maybe one of the best Turkish meals I've had. Started with the cold mezze sampler platter, and the dolmas were maybe the best that I've had- filled with little hints of beans and nuts, definitely not from out of the can like at other restaurants. I had the vegan eggplant entree, and it was so delicious. Will definitely be going back!
author: Sophia C.

description: We were here with my family. All of us gave 5 stars for  service and meals. I highly recommend Tuba to my friends.
author: Erhan A.

description:
Nice traditional Turkish food options with authentic taste! Portions are large so if you order appetizer the entree might be best to share.. their famous dessert Kunefe is the great and if you order turkish coffee on the side there is no better end to the meal! 
Why not 5 stars- its a bit overpriced if you do 3course meal & drinks.
author: Merve C.

description:
I made a reservation here at 6pm on a Sunday through Yelp (which by the way is super convenient). That probably wasn't so necessary as the restaurant was still quite empty at 6 and there were plenty of two-person tables. The place did become quite filled by the time we left around 7pm. It was muggy outside and the heat carried into the restaurant which unsurprisingly does not have AC. SF is not equipped for this kind of weather. It thankfully cooled down as the sun set. 

The flavors of the dishes we had were all delicious but the amount of food felt incredibly small. Portion control, I guess. The service was excellent. The complimentary flatbread they bring out was yummy and perfect for eating with the accompanying seasoned butter, olives, and feta as well as the cold mezes. We also used the bread to pick up the oils from the mezes. The waitress brought us another basket presumably after seeing us wolf down the first plate of bread.     

KIZARTMA (Cold Meze)
This appetizer came in two mounds of pan-fried eggplant, bell peppers, and zucchini topped with tomato sauce. (Both mezes came in twos actually.) I loved the natural sweetness of the vegetables (technically fruits but you know what I mean). And they were chopped and cooked to perfection. The small scoops left me craving more. 

CEVIZLI EZME (Cold Meze)
A mix of walnuts, Turkish red pepper paste, tomato paste, fresh garlic, olive oil, and cumin, this  signature meze had incredibly deep flavor. It was a wonderful blend of sweet and savory. The walnuts added a nice, nutty texture. I was surprised by how much I enjoyed this combination of ingredients. I also appreciated the bed of spinach.  

ADANA KEBAB
A succulent kebab of spicy ground beef with lamb mixed with green and red bell peppers. The meat was very tender and easy to chew. I didn't think it was spicy at all. The portion was extremely small and probably not worth the price. It did come with rice and grilled and pickled vegetables which took up most of the plate.  

KARNIYARIK (Signature Entree)
My favorite out of the two entrees. Even though there was half of a whole eggplant, I wished there was more of it. The baked eggplant was wonderfully tender, but its subtle flavor was overpowered by the ground beef, tomatoes, onions, and chopped parsley stuffing which was exceptionally seasoned. The flavor was very rich and deep. I could see it pairing quite well with pasta. Although I appreciate leafy greens, the salad was a bit boring. 

All in all, I had a very enjoyable and hearty meal here. Everything was so flavorful and aromatic. 
I noticed that prices have gone up by $2 for the Cold Mezes and $3 for the Signature Entrees based on the menu posted in 2014 which is somewhat more reasonable than another place I went to that started raising their prices within a month. If you checkin with Yelp, you can get $5 off your tab! This restaurant also partners with Delta and every dollar spent earns you Skymiles!
author: Lauren H.

description:
FAN-freakin-TASTIC!  

I got there a little early but thankfully it was not so packed at the time. The ambience was wonderful, very calm I must say. We were greeted immediately so that was a change of pace. We got the appetizer from the "cold meze" menu and it was the Haydari and later got two entrees.  Those entrees were MASSIVE!  Completely filling and the dessert didn't do ya wrong either.  We got Kunefe which consisted of sweet cheese, ice cream, pretty much the better and softer version of baklava.  

Definitely a must go!
author: Me V.

description:
I had a pretty lackluster, disappointing experience at Tuba last night. It's been on my list of places to try for quite some time now, so my friend and I decided to check it out. Looking at the menu beforehand, I was excited to try new Turkish dishes in an authentic atmosphere. However, when I walked in, the vibe felt a bit stale and generic. We were sat at a very wobbly table, which our sever fixed after we pointed it out. Less than five minutes after we got sat, our server asked us what we wanted to order. Our menus hadn't even been opened! 

We asked for a few minutes, and then decided to share: 
- Haydari: Cucumbers, mint and dill with creamy thick garlic yogurt. This was by far my favorite dish that we ordered. Creamy, refreshing, with a ton of flavor. They also brought over some really good bread.

- Peynirli Karides: Prawns sautéed with tomatoes and garlic in pepperoncini sauce and topped with feta cheese. Very disappointing dish. A few very small shrimp in a watery tomato "sauce". Had little to no flavor and maybe five small pieces of feta.

- Falafel Salatası: Falafel stuffed with goat cheese, served with mix greens, cilantro, basil, red onions and orange vinaigrette. Big bowl of mixed greens with three small falafel. Tomatoes and cucumbers were nice, but otherwise just a basic house salad. No added herbs or flavors.

All in all, the food did not seem authentic. No spices, no heat, just very basic stuff. Service was basically nonexistent and we had to ask multiple times for extra bread for our first dish. Prices reasonable for SF but steep for what you get.
author: Regina L.

description: Good food, warm decor, and friendly people. We plan to skip the entree and go for the mezes and desserts next time.
author: Yoshikage K.

description:
Awesome food and service! 

Falafel Salatası: The Falafel are stuffed with goat cheese. Very good. Served with a bunch off mix greens, cilantro, basil, red onions, cucumbers and cherry tomatoes. The Orange Limon Mint Vinaigrette was really good

The Marinated lamb chop dish was one of the best I've had.  It's served rice with garbanzo and grilled veggies,  pickles, grilled yellow pepper and mint yogurt sauce. 

Sarma Beyti Kebab is awesome! It is Adana kebab wrapped in lavaş bread, sliced up and served with really good tomato sauce on top and then a yogurt sauce in the middle. It is garnish with a grilled yellow pepper, which gives the right amount of heat if you eat a little with each bite. Good stuff!
 
The complementarity bread is also really good,  love the butter mixture they serve with it. Wish they served more. The black sesame seeds add a nice touch

Great place, can't wait to come back and try more
author: Douglas M.

description: We went there with friends visiting SF and they loved it. Second time there! Food was amazing, lamb Kebab and an two different eggplant dish. Although I am not happy with the service. It seemed they were in rush( we had reservation @7:45 which is not too late for dinner). But the food is delicious.
author: Zeinab A.

description: This more of a $$$ place but so worth it. It was our first time tonight and the service was great. Amazing for gluten free people. We will be back for sure.
author: Anne S.

description: Excellent, generous portion of lamb kabobs. My friend had a huge vegetarian moussaka and loved it,  I visited about 5 years ago and was equally impressed.  I regret not returning sooner. Service was gracious and the room felt very comfortable. I would highly recommend Tuba.
author: Richard D.

description:
This is, I think, the best Turkish restaurant on the West Coast. We've got the mezza plate which one shouldn't miss. It's pretty big mind you enough for 4. The lovely waitress warned us about the portion sizes being very generous and she was right.
We also tried 'beyti' kabob, also very good. 
At the end we got their signature dessert kunefe (served with vanilla ice cream) I believe was the best ever.
This Turkish restaurant beats every other we've tried and we will be back.
author: Michelle O.

description:
The food was absolutely delicious, and the staff was very friendly!

If you want authentic Turkish cuisine, can't go wrong!
author: Art K.

description: Had a good Vegetarian Mussaka in the city. Good wines and great food but certainly not my fav restaurant.
author: Ankita J.

description: Such a great experience.  The food is authentic and tasty.  Servers are genuine and sort of hover around to make sure your needs are met, but not in an overbearing kind of way.  They give suggestions and are helpful.  Food is not cheap, but completely worth it.  We got the lamb chops medium and they were tender and seasoned perfectly.  Sweet cheese dessert was amazing.  Definitely coming back!  Establishments in SF don't have to be great to get business or to be busy and you get sort of used to being an unappreciated customer, but not so here.  All of the staff we encountered were kind and genuine, food and atmosphere on point; this is what makes a great restaurant.
author: Michelle F.

description: Amazing food, great customer service, variety of selections, neat interior decoration ! Definitely one of best Turkish Restaurant in the Bay
author: Almas B.

description:
Serhat was the man of the hour! He's the POC and the co-owner of this successful restaurant. Even though it was my friend Mindy's birthday!

Ordered: 
Appetizers 
* Tuba Meze Tabagi x 2
* İçli Köfte (Spicy ground beef) x 2

Entrees
* Samon x 2
* Sea Bream x 1
* Karides Tava x 2

Special Entrees
* Kuzu Lamb Chops / Pirzola x 2
* Sarma Beyti Kebab x 2
* Adana Kebab x 2

Dessert
* Kunefe x 3

Tina's Travel and Tabloid
- Dinner total was $503 with tax and 20% tip as we were a big group
- Exceptional service and attention to detail with really quick and fast at delivering 
- Super accommodating as we upped our reservation number by 2 from 15 to 17, which makes a difference when your restaurant is limited on spacing! 
- Friend and I made up the menu before we came minus the desserts. I had a little pow wow with Serhat before I put in the order with suggestions of quantities and what we should order. We even go a pyramid noisette chocolate hazelnut along with a birthday song on the house for this celebration.
- The workers and Serhat was so nice - taking pictures for us, coming to check on our table, and most importantly served a fantastic meal throughout the night. 
- We got some entertainment along with the meal of Turkish candy aka Turkish delight (rahat lokum) and Turkish coffee! The coffee swung the thing around like it wasn't going to fall off that platter.
- I wouldn't have it any other way. We celebrated the night away! Thank you Serhat and staff for making it memorable.
author: Tina N.

description: Great spot with super friendly staff. The menu is a bit pricey but worth the splurge. I highly recommend the hummus, kibbe, and tavuk sote.
author: Andrew W.

description: Service was excellent, but food was mediocre. Falafel was very dry. Beyti was good and not as heavy I thought it would be.
author: Carolyn B.

description:
On Saturday night six of us dined at Tuba in the Mission district of San Francisco.  Located near the corner of Guerrero St. and 22nd St. , Tuba is an upscale Turkish restaurant. Nice ethnic Turkish decor. The restaurant is very busy and probably best to have reservations as I saw some walk in customers get turned away. The menu has the popular Turkish items and that night had a special lamb shank, which was the best dish of the night. It was fall of the bone tender and full of flavor. Our table had the Adana Kabob, Musukka, Lamb Chops, and Karnyark as our entrees all were good. We wanted to order the fish that was in the pictures but they were out of that. The appetizers of dolmas and the pureed eggplant were meh. Service was excellent and attentive.  The minuses are the menu is very pricey for what you get with entrees starting at $24 . A minor observation was the plating of each dish was almost like a cafeteria tray without the dividers.  I am not sure if that's the Turkish style of food plating but it was odd. 

Parking is hard in the Mission but I was able to find a spot a block away. The food was good and the service was excellent.
author: George F.

description:
NOT WORTH YOUR TIME or $$$!!! For folks traveling or thinking this is amazing food based on other Yelp reviews, go read the negative ones first. Either I'm very fortunate to have had AMAZING middle eastern food or other folks haven't been exposed to real authentic food and service. Trust me, there's way better food out there. I really wish I hadn't come to this place. 

Food: Portions are amazingly small, rice tasted bland with no color or flavor (other places I've tried have "jeweled rice" or at least it's flavorful). Their Chicken dishes were burnt, bland, and dry. The very few vegetables I got on my plate looked more like decorations rather than part of my meal. Hummus was okay, but their bread came out cold. We tried Baklava for dessert...disappointing to say the least so we didn't finish it. I've had much better and authentic in the Bay Area. 

Service: Restaurant is overwhelmingly understaffed and they don't know how to manage the restaurant. Don't expect the multiple hosts to tell you the truth about wait times. The night we went had no host so different servers had to fill in. That's crazy for a busy weekend. SEVERAL parties outside (in the cold) had "reservations," yet no tables were available for even a small party. They kept telling all of us waiting that the people inside were "taking too long to finish." The restaurant needs to honor reservations or else state it's walk-ins only. 

Ambience: WAY too SMALL space, crowded, too loud of music, and worst of all, table set up is horrendous!! I know SF is tight in space, but man this was disappointing based on the pictures. The restaurant staff was assembling tables like a jigsaw puzzle to make people fit into unimaginable spaces. No one could walk comfortably, much less get out if needed for an emergency. At some point the middle walkway was blocked! This was just an uncomfortable situation. How embarrassing to call this authentic Turkish restaurant. Nowhere can this be authentic in Turkey! 

I'm sorry to say this, but I would be embarrassed to call this place my restaurant.
author: D W.

description: While the food was very good, the service was so rushed that it was unpleasant.  Plates were cleared away before we were done eating and the check arrived with desserts.  Given that we had appetizers, main courses and dessert along with two bottles of wine we shouldn't have been pushed out.  We won't go back.
author: Gisela S.

description:
This place hit it out of the park on all fronts:
- service 
- atmosphere 
-prices 
And of course, food! Everything we ordered was great. We will be back.
author: Evan S.

description:
4.5 stars

Tuba is an absolute gem!  It was the perfect answer to my craving lately for Mediterranean food.   This is a really good restaurant for regular dinner, a celebration, or a family meal.  The restaurant offers a selection of hot and cold mezes, soups and salads, entrees and desserts.  Let's not forget the specials of the day (these are specials you really want to pay attention to). 
 Many of of the items are vegetarian and/or gluten free.  They serve wine and beer, but no cocktails.  The restaurant itself is on the small size but it never felt crowded.

The food is simply prepared but with really fresh ingredients.  I thought the dishes we ordered were incredibly healthy and tasty.  Make sure to ask about the specials (did I already say that?).  On the night of my visit the specials were lamb shank and sea bream.  The fish was really fresh.

We started our meal with an order of their signature meze, the Cevizli Ezme, which is a dip made of walnuts, red pepper paste, tomatoes and various spices.  It was thick and creamy and the perfect start to the meal when spread on bread.

For the entrees we shared the Adana kebab and the roasted sea bream.  The single kebab was described as spicy but I didn't find that to be the case.  However, it was flavorful and moist.  The dish came with some vegetables, pickles, a yogurt sauce and rice.  The fish was delicious, fresh and perfectly cooked.  They offered to debone it for us but still presented it as if it were whole.  The sea bream came with a salad, vegetables and pickles.  

Cups of turkish tea and a plate of Kunefe, sweet cheese coated in shredded phyllo soaked in syrup and nuts rounded out the meal.  The dessert wasn't too sweet or too rich and paired well with the earthiness of the tea.

The portions sizes were just right and I felt the prices were fair for the quality of the meal.  Service was friendly and efficient.  The restaurant was full the entire time of our visit and service never lapsed.

The restaurant is located in what I regard as the quieter section of the Mission such that parking was fairly easy (okay, I really lucked out).   I would regard this as a neighborhood spot I would gladly cross the city to visit.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Came here for dinner and didn't expect this place to be as busy or romantic as it was!

We only had to wait briefly for a table for two, and I was a bit taken aback by the abrupt way we were greeted: "do you have a reservation" followed by "please wait outside." That was the only rough patch of the night. Once we were seated, service was fantastic, courteous, and food was beautifully plated and flavored.

I've never had Turkish food before, so I was completely in love with the meze plate (cold platter of all the dips and an endless bread basket of their deliciously soft sesame bread. I could live off of that stuff forever! We got the fish special (not on the menu) and found out it was BREAM! Haven't had that before...but it was cooked to perfection, and we chose to dine with the bone in--best option. We also shared the large "light" Turkish beer. We wanted the dark one, but they ran out of it, and surprisingly the light was something I'd totally order again! I don't like lagers or pilsners, but this lager had a hint of honey and was so floral, I loved it.

Service was top-notch. They clear your dirty plates and smile/hold eye contact with you to the point before you start feeling uncomfortable. Hah, but I'd totally go back again. Surprisingly it was not as expensive as I thought it would be with the lofty decor and old-school vibes, which is great for a fancier night out without the pomp and circumstance!

Hats off to Tuba, so glad we came here.
author: Jodi H.

description: I'm not generous with the 5stars, but Tuba is-Delicious, Cozy and Comfortable....  Buddy and I shared the mezze platter- it's all the cold appetizers.  So good!  everything: olives, babganoush, salad, humus, dolmas, tomatoes,etc-  simple yum!  Followed by lamb kabob- savory perfect with grilled veggies and tastyrice.
author: R G.

description: Pricey place, the food is ok and service is good. The baklava was a bit stale and not fresh. Just an average place.
author: Kiran A.

description: Got the meze platter and chicken shis for 2 people. Delicious! The portions were large and food flavorful. Good ambiance for a date or small gathering. Kind of small for large groups. Service was good as well. Would highly recommend.
author: Claudia A.

description:
Service was very attentive and they had great lamb chops! We also got the platter with all the cold appetizers and I especially liked the one with walnuts - really yummy!

Overall, nice ambiance, different food, and attentive stuff - I will be back!
author: Luba Y.

description:
Visiting from DC and came here to visit my brother and his friends. He told me this family own Turkish restaurant that was very good, and it was absolutely deserves its ratings! Definitely deserves the Michelin star! 

Roof was packed! We made a reservation, thank god! The staff was so very nice, so accommodating, would come and ask us how everything was, and would answer our questions regarding the menu. 

Appetizers:
Cevizli Ezme Walnuts, this red paste walnut dish :p sooo goooood! 
İçli Köfte Bulgur- a ball of spicy ground beef on top of a garlic yogurt :P Yummy! 

The bread was so good, eating it with the appetizers. We all even ordered the Yogurt drink, so creamy and delicious! 

Entree's:
Tavuk Şiş, chicken skewers 
Köfte, Miniature beef patties
Karnıyarık Eggplant and ground beef dish! 
The special -Lamb chops. it was so tender!

Dessert: 
turkish tea 
turkish coffee 
Ice cream covered with this semolina wheat concoction and pine nut! Great with coffee and tea! 

As a group we all shared the dishes and it was worth it trying all of them! I am DEFINITELY COMING BACK TO THIS PLACE when I visit again! Great staff, great atmosphere and amazing food!
author: Samira B.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday dinner last weekend and had a great time! It's a small restaurant, but cozy and fun.
Food was very good. I haven't ever had Turkish food and was a bit worried. But it was very accessible and delicious. Nice wine options too. Service was great. We had a blast!
If you like Turkish/Mediterranean food, this is a great option.
author: Karen N.

description:
I'm trying to second time. Firstly I want to say atmosphere of restaurant great , music list is good. Server looks professional, they are really focus to customer.  
I ate fist cupra fish  today levrwk better then seabass 
I will keep come
author: Serkan K.

description: Completely deserves 5 stars! Outstanding service, friendly staff, a-ma-zing food!!! Adana Kebap was phenomenal. Definetly a standout restaurant in SF. OK, I am out of adjectives...We will be back for sure!
author: Bedia Begüm K.

description:
The dishes I had were FANTASTIC 

I had the Cold Mezza Platter from this restaurant which had various cold mezze dishes. I picked it up to go. 

All the dishes in this platter were extremely flavorful.  I do not know what exactly that red dish was - but it was the best (It tasted a bit like Muhammara. I think it is called Cevizli Ezme in this restaurant's menu. Probably different name in Turkish?).

I will be back here again and again and again.
author: Chet M.

description:
The food is good, but the service can use some improvement. I give them a 4 in food, and 1 in service, averaging about a 2.5 stars here. 

Someone screwed up our reservation, and after a long battle they did eventually fix it. My friend eventually had to call in and they did straighten out the reservation for us, but it was an exhausting process. Since they kindly ask me to change my review in the end, I will change it to reflect a more accurate experience. 

Some suggestions to the lady at the front desk

First, when you screwed up the reservation, instead of telling me we don't have your reservation repeatedly, maybe you can see if you can do something about it and find out what is the root cause, especially after I supply all the information. 

Second, don't make the customer wait forever and pondering what's going on

Third, if you are not the manager, don't pretend you are and give me a lecture on why I shouldn't complain. It's quite funny to being talked to as if I am in the wrong here. And if you are the manager, then I am wondering why there is another manager later asking nicely if I can change my review to reflect the fact that you did eventually fix the reservation screw up.
author: Chilann C.

description:
Rating: 4.5! 

Great little spot with some very great tasting food! 

Came here on Friday evening with a group of 6 and we were immediately seated, as we had a reservation for 7:00pm. 
When we arrived, the restaurant wasn't full, but over time it filled up quickly. As soon as we ordered the appetizer platter, it was out in less than 10 minutes. We decided that we were trying the Tuba Meze Tabağı, which was a combination of all the cold appetizers. We definitely didn't go wrong with this choice, because each item on the platter was incredible and absolutely delicious. 

For the entrees we each ordered our own. Some of the items that we tried were the Karidesli Salata, Karides Tava, Tavuk Şiş, Adana Kebab, HünkarBeğendi. Each item had its own peculiar taste and was exceptional. For the chicken and ground beef and lamb kebobs I expected their to be at least two skewers, so the portions were pretty small. The eggplant entree was absolutely mouthwatering and the lamb chunks were super tender. Overall it was a great experience. 

One minor thing that was slightly annoying was that it felt like we were being rushed the entire evening.  Every time that we sat back and conversed amongst the table, the host/hostess assumed we were finished eating and would come up and start clearing our table. Other than that, the service was great!
author: Julia K.

description: Loved the flavors and my favorite was the bakhlava. I'm excited to go back again and try a couple of different things.
author: Sneha P.

description:
I've eaten here a half-dozen times, and always think it's great, and the people are lovely.  (I think managers have changed, but quality hasn't)

I can't stop having the mixed cold appetizers plate, almost a meal with two people eating, which goes to prove that anything in this world tastes better if it has some olive oil and some lemon juice added.

I'll keep going to Tuba!
author: Sydney C.

description: Great food and great customer services, the waitresses are smart and they know how to handle customers, the kabob was excellent
author: Aziz A.

description: Good authentic Turkish food! One minor concern is that the place is too tight. Great service
author: Parth P.

description: This place is a good one! Visiting from out of town and local friend pick this place.  Ambiance is relaxed and comfortable. It was a bit dark in there and more noticed because it was such a beautiful  sunny day today. The food was 100% delicious and they had some authentic stuff I have never had before plus the Falafel and cold Mezza sampler were so good! Only beer and wine. Service was pretty good and prices were fair to moderate depending on what you order. We found street parking pretty easily. Definitely will be back when we visit next.
author: Georgie K.

description: Pretty good but nothing special in our opinion. Salmon was good but the sauce was a bit too creamy. The Kabob we got was good but the amount of cream on the plate was crazy. I wouldn't seek this place out but if you're in the area and want this type of cuisine you won't be disappointed.
author: Kartik S.

description:
I am from Turkey and having lived in a few different countries I know how hard it is to find a restaurant that can make Turkish food that tastes and looks like you are eating back in Turkey. 

The team at Tuba were very friendly, managed to sort a table for a very large group I was with with less than a week's notice and they were very attentive and quick when we were in the restaurant. 

Most items on the menu are authentic. Falafel and humus are the two items that I would say are more middle eastern in general rather than really Turkish, but that depends a little where in Turkey you are from. 

The dishes we ordered tastes all really good even though some deviated a little from how I know the dishes in Turkey.

I only wish that they had some more options on their menu (I appreciate that this isn't that easy unless you have a much larger restaurant & kitchen). I would also recommend them skipping some items like the peynirli karides which I never order in Turkey either as it really isn't the tastiest dish (especially if you are dealing with a crowd in SF that can get great shrimp dishes with king/tiger shrimp in other places). 

Another thing I missed is Raki. I know it's a licensing issue but would really love to have seen this on the menu. The availability of the Turkish wines (made from Turkish grape varieties) definitely made up for the lack of raki though.

One of the best Turkish meals I had outside of Turkey and can really recommend highly for those that want to taste Turkish food for the first time or those missing the food from back home.
author: Larry S.

description: Tuba serves a one-two combo, with both great food and superb service! We've been here twice and both times, we've been more than satisfied with our meals. The food is really fresh, flavourful, and filling! The bread and condiments, starters (appetisers), main courses, and desserts/coffee are all of amazing quality and taste. (I'm glad I found this spot, even though my partner thinks she found it.)
author: Kay J.

description:
The best lamb shank I've ever had in my life. So tender juicy and perfectly cooked. The place is perfect for weekend dinners with your date. 
Parking wasn't much of a problem, plenty of spots vacant on the street. 
The yogurt based drink was pretty good as well, although it will make you feel sleepy!! :)
author: Varun S.

description:
The best authentic Turkish food in San Francisco area. It's a fine dinning place. The ingredients come from Turkey and that's what make their dishes amazingly tasty.  Make sure to have a reservation before you go. The service is really good and the servers are very friendly and helpful to help you choose if you are not familiar with Turkish food and don't know what to order.
Highly recommend this place
author: Sherry B.

description:
This. Place. Is. Delicious. 

The wines are amazing, you can't go wrong with any of their mezzes, and that 3-day marinated lamb is not kidding around. The only problem with this place is that we always end up eating way too much.
author: Emma E.

description:
Çok güzel. I highly recommend the meze platters, they taste just like my grandmother makes them. I was disappointed that they didn't have İskender kebap and the karnıyarık (lamb-stuffed eggplant) was a bit heavy on the meat and tomato which made it hard to taste the eggplant. The ayran(salty yogurt drink) tastes like İstanbul in the summer.

Tuba is a great taste of Turkey in San Francisco.
author: Zeki S.

description: A friend and I were headed to the airport. We looked up restaurants that were near our route and met vegetarian dietary restrictions. This restaurant appeared and recommended reservations. We used the Yelp application to make a reservation for 15 minutes from when we wanted to arrive and it worked. Reservations are nearly a must here. The restaurant is packed and bustling with activity. The food was authentic Mediterranean and prepared fresh. This restaurant is pricy but deservedly so.
author: PJ D.

description:
It was my first time trying out Turkish cuisine. 
There appetizers were scrumptious. We were 8 ppl so we tried different variety and all of them were tasty. However, the main course wasn't as assorted. Overall it was a good food but seatings got bit tight and stuffy for group of 8.
author: Noni P.

description: Excellent Turkish food!  We stopped by on a Sunday night to eat dinner.  WE had an amazing plate of mixed appetizers -- creamy spinach, eggplant with red peppers, fantastic paste of red pepper and walnuts and tomato -- all atop a white bean salad.  Delicious!  Then our main courses included a terrific skewered spicy ground beef with lamb hot and bursting with juices, prawns and asparagus in a lemon sauce, and tomato lamb with eggplant puree.  A terrific meal with great service.
author: Charles L.

description: I have never been here. But I checked the menu online. You do not call yourself vegetarian place if you have ZERO vegetarian options on the signature entrees and two options in entrees out of a dozen of meat options.
author: Valentyn S.

description: One of the last places I ate before moving from the bay, but it became one of my favorite restaurants. A hidden gem, truly delicious. I got the jebab, and my wife got the pork chops. Both to die for
author: Michael B.

description:
Our love for Tuba never ends! 
This place is amazing.. great food, quality with fabulous service. What's not to love? 
I've tried most of their appetizers here and my favorites are haydari ( which is the yogurt with dill) 
Icli kofta (on the hot mezzas) and their signature mezza( it's a mix of crushed walnuts, 
As for the entrees, we usually get the Adana kebab. It's spicy but very tasty. 
Their lamb shank is also wonderful. It comes with 4 large pieces of lamb shank, side rice, veggies, yogurt and pickles. These are the same sides for the Adana kabab. 
They bring their home made bread as well along with a bit of butter, olive oil and feta cheese. It's so good! 
They have highlighted their gluten free items on their menu. ( that's an added bonus for us) 
If you order a couple of their appetizers, you can easily share one of their entrees unless u are very hungry! Their portions are on the large side. 
And to finish your meal off, order the incredible Turkish coffee!
author: Ghazal P.

description: Fantastic middle eastern food and great service.  This place smelled so good from the moment I walked in.  We had the prawns appetizer, excellent, garlicy, served with amazing warm bread that was amazing to dip in the sauce.  I had the ground beef/ lamb kabob which was also amazing.  So many good things on the menu I will need to return.
author: Steven B.

description:
Warm, comforting atmosphere, with delightful Turkish cuisine

If you're looking for a different dining experience in San Francisco's Mission District, you won't find a better place than Tuba. Like the name implies, the restaurant serves authentic Turkish cuisine and it is outstanding! I went there with some friends for dinner last night and we couldn't have been more pleased. The lamb chops are delicious; some of the best I have ever tasted. My wife ordered Adana Kabab (spicy ground meat) which also was wonderful.

The service is friendly and efficient; the ambience low key and very welcoming. Prices are moderate. The only downside I might say is the wine list. A bottle of Turkish wine is priced at $59, which in my opinion is rather high. You might be better off to forget about authenticity stick with a basic California white or red.

But, what really makes Tuba such a pleasant place to have dinner are the servers. The entire staff is wonderful!
author: Jim B.

description: This is an excellent Turkish restaurant. Nice and cozy inside, service is great. We had beyti kebab and lamb chops were delicious. Must try Turkish cabernet. Highly recommended. We can't wait to go back. Thank you!
author: Bahar S.

description: Seriously authentic Turkish food. The staff is Turkish and the menu is very legit. We celebrated my boyfriends birthday there the other day and loved the experience
author: Maggie M.

description: It was our first time having Turkish food. Omg was it delicious. I will be coming here next time I'm in SF. A must try for sure!
author: Evelyn A.

description: I ordered the baby lamb chops. It was arranged very nicely on the plate and was also very delicious. Came with rice and vegetable sides. I had turkish red wine which was also very good. Service was nice. I'd recommend.
author: Marie D.

description: Consistently excellent food and great servers went on my birthday two years ago and the owner was nice enough to give me a gift voucher for next time and been going every couple of month ever sense they are always excellent and it's a great place to have a meal and a conversation it's not too loud even though u feel the tables are close to each other but it actually makes cozy and warm and inviting
author: Hashem K.

description:
This place is incredible. Hands down the best Turkish food I've had, and I've been a diehard fan of Mediterranean/Turkish food for a decade, with plenty of travel to taste traditional dishes. Wines are also good -- try especially the Kočabag (red). 

Beyond the food it's clear that the place is deeply cared for, the waiters enjoy their work and provide great service, and a lot of love is put into the food and setting. 

It's not a fancy spot like Kokkari -- nothing pretentious about it, just good ambient light, good vibe, grounded energy. Perfect for friends and family time and relaxed date nights (and lots of great venues nearby to keep things going after).

Make reservations ahead of time to get a good table!
author: Anna F.

description: Felt like the menu was a bit limited and the restaurant itself was a bit claustrophobic but great service and delicious dessert!
author: Aman K.

description:
We were trying to get into Kokkari, but couldn't get a reservation and ended up here instead. So glad we did! 

Food: Overall the food was delicious. We're vegetarians, and there was more than enough food to leave us stuffed and with leftovers for the next day. We ordered the cold mezze platter, falafel, siguri, and moussaka. The siguri was the only thing that was skippable in this. Otherwise the food was amazing. We also tried the Turkish rose and white wines, which were quite good if you like more dry wines. 

Service: The service was friendly and good. However, it would've been nice if the staff had more knowledge of the wines. All we got was dry, light/medium-bodied, and fruity. They struggled to describe beyond that. That being said, we did like the wines they recommended. 

We will definitely go back.
author: Kavita P.

description: First time eating Turkish food and it opened me up to a new world. The lamb melted in my mouth while the hummus and shrimp dishes made excellent complementary dishes. We were able to bring a couple of bottles of wine which they uncorked for us. The coffees were served in authentic Turkish cups and served with Turkish delights. The waitress and waiters made our dining experience memorable.
author: Nicholas C.

description:
I was lucky enough to be introduced to Tuba by a good friend.  Decided to go back the other day and wasn't disappointed!

We ended up getting wine and dessert which put us in the $$$ category per person, but we knew what we were getting into.

The cold platter was an excellent way to start the meal and something that I will continue to get each time I come here.  It is the perfect starter for three, but could be overwhelming for two.

From there we got the braised lamb shank, which fell off the bone.  The one we usually get on the menu, is the marinated lamb chops, which is equally fantastic.  Baklava with turkish tea for me to round off the meal was a great finish.
author: Kent W.

description:
In between $$-$$$ place. The complimentary appetizer is pretty good but I didn't enjoy my entree and other appetizer as much. But this review is specifically towards he service I received this night, extremely unprofessional. I arrived at 10pm and I WELL understand the restaurant closes at 11pm. I was keeping an eye on the clock making sure I leave before 11pm to not be rude, as I understand the servers want to go home too. But they constantly rushed me asking if I wanted a to go box when I wasn't yet finished with my meal at 10:30 and on top of that, I didn't even finish my appetizer HALF WAY and they didn't pack it to go, they threw it away. (At least ask right?). Also, the waitress asked if I wanted to see the dessert menu and didn't give me time to look it over. I asked to just give me 1 more QUICK minute and she replies that the kitchen was supposed to close 10 minutes ago trying to make me feel bad?! Also, 20 minutes into my meal they forgot my iced tea and didn't even apologize. They also dropped the check before we were even ready to leave. LASTLY on the way out, they said thank you so much to the person in front of us but didn't say thank you at all for our business. Btw: this whole experience I stayed nice to them and didn't do anything to tick them off or deserve bad service. 

EXTREMELY UNPROFESSIONAL AND RUDE !!!
author: Kaylee V.

description: The service is horrible. Not friendly. Food is ok. Definitely not a place to try for the first time. This restaurant caters to regulars.
author: Lily Y.

description:
We had a great time at Tuba . The food is pretty authentic . We had the marinated lamb chops and Adana kebab as mains . Done to perfection . Will go back again . 

Update: Went back again today. The food was as awesome as always. Lamb shank is served on Fridays and Saturday's
author: Vin M.

description:
How can I convey how perfect my dinner here was? To give you an idea, I usually scarf down my food; a minute or two and even the largest plates are empty. Tonight I wanted every bite to last forever. The service is impeccable too - every server was polite, extremely attentive, friendly and informative and not to mention: beautiful!

Whatever your fancy, you just must try the red lentil soup and the falafel. At first bite, the soup left me wanting ; I was waiting for a kick or a spice. At second taste, I was pleasantly overwhelmed at the texture and the layer of ingredients melded together. This was comfort in every bite; this was a rainy night, post breakup, cold season, long day bowl of warm hugs. Am I exaggerating? I felt better about humankind when that bowl was empty - 15 minutes later. My eyes and hands worked my way in circles around the table in every effort to make that soup last. 

And to my delight, there was so much else to pique my interest. The falafel was the best I've ever had. I'm not an expert in falafel but I've never met a falafel I didn't like. If it's on the menu, I will order it regardless. This wasn't your average falafel though. If there is a falafel heaven, Tuba's is falafel god. The texture was perfect - a slight crunch and flavor that made my tongue dizzy. Butter it up generously with hummus and you don't need anyone else to make it a date.

And then came the entree. Our server used the word "juicy" twice in her description of this chicken dish served - in laymen's terms - in tomato sauce and a medley of mushrooms and other accompaniments. She could have used it thrice over and it still would have not sufficed. This chicken is to die for. Every morsel was like reuniting with a long-lost lover. I couldn't finish it. Shock and horror, but I didn't want this night to end! So the friendly girls wrapped it up with some salad (delicious) and bread (divine) and I sauntered home with my meal that would last all night long.
author: Obichang O.

description:
I went there with my significant other for Valentine's Day yesterday evening. The menu was Prix Fixe, totaling $150 for two people. The extra additions that the restaurant made, including a rose given once the check came, were nice gestures. It was a bit confusing to be told this - "One mezze, soup or salad, one entree, choice of dessert, coffee or tea." We were helped out by the table next to us that had already ordered to tell us that it was one shared mezze, two soup or salad, two entree, two dessert.

The bittersweet moment was paying $150 for roughly $100 worth of food. I would be interested in going back when I can choose items from the full menu. It was my fault for not calling the restaurant to clarify if the menu would be Prix Fixe. I would have liked to see that reflected on their website, given the extra steps taken for the occasion.
author: Jordan M.

description:
This review is past due, and we are STILL thinking about the amazing experience we had at Tuba. No joke. 

It was my girlfriends birthday, and for weeks prior, I had been wondering where in the heck has she been wanting to spend her "not going to say the age" birthday this year??? So after weeks of racking my brain, as some guys do, I finally just came out and asked her, "where would you like to go for your birthday dinner?". The first thing she said was "TUBA!" (Apparently she's been wanting to check this place out for awhile) 

Of course, we checked into Yelp first, to see what people thought of this place. We're so glad we listened, because man this place is incredible! Literally every bite, we looked at each other and shook our heads in utter disbelief on how freakin delicious the food is. And the service was just as amazing. They were very accommodating and attentive without being overly in your face. 

At the beginning, I mentioned to the server that it was my girlfriends birthday and I wondered if they remembered. After we finished our amazing dinner, our server brought out a wonderful complimentary birthday dessert and the entire restaurant staff, including the other guests, sang happy birthday to my sweetheart! 

Needless to say man, this place is a MUST for anyone looking for impeccable service and amazing food! Would highly recommend to ANYONE.
author: Dre P.

description:
I had their lamb chops twice. First time it was excellent. Second time it seemed like it was prepared in a hurry, the restaurant was busy. 

Their service is good. I would recommend this restaurant. The restaurant is small. It is best to make reservation ahead of time so you don't have to wait outside.
author: Bhanu V.

description: Best Turkish restaurant over the city. Free Street parking is available. Good location.
author: Tuncer E.

description:
AWESOME!!  Boy, do I LOVE Turkish cuisine and Tuba does it perfectly!!  I'm a lamb lover, so, of course, I had their lamb chops, which were juicy and tender.  I'll definitely be returning!
Despite the fairly small size of the restaurant, which was full on a Thursday evening, with folks lined up outside, the noise level wasn't as harsh as one would think and the customer service was pleasant and attentive.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Stopped by for a late Sunday dinner, the place was pretty full for nearly 9pm but we were greeted and seated promptly.

FOOD:
Cevizli ezme starter - was fresh and tasty and not at all what I was expecting, based on the description. Comes as two scoops of purée which we ate with the bread that seems to come with every table, but I'm not sure if you're supposed to/it's traditional..? Anyway, we did; do what tastes good amirite

Hunkar Begendi main dish - also very delicious, also surprisingly bread-less, surprisingly because it was even less viscous than the starter we got. We tried to ask for more bread, but they had run out that late in the evening. Felt like eating a (thick, tasty) sauce. Could've used a higher lamb : eggplant sauce ratio, too.

AMBIANCE:
Nice space in a quiet neighborhood. There was a birthday happening and our waiter, upon greeting us, insisted (warned?) that everyone was required to sing. I thought it was sweet of him, but I imagine some people would rather not be forced.

OVERALL:
4/5; 5/5 with bread
author: Sijia H.

description: The food was excellent and the desert was wonderful. They were so respectful, cause the restaurant was so busy that we had to wait for about 45 minutes but it took much longer and they apologized about it and tried to make us happy and didn't charge us for the desert!
author: Negar A.

description: It was yummy but not my everyday choice I went there for a family dinner and it was really loud and small
author: Angelica L.

description: I'm big fan of this place..I ordered adana kabab and it was super delicious..After the main dishes we had Turkish tea and Kunefe..Wonderful service and food..The staff were amazing and professional..Highly recommend this place.
author: Abdullah B.

description:
Tuba is probably the best Turkish food I have ever had in the US and I tasted my fair share of food from a variety of Turkish restaurants including ones in the east coast where the Turkish food scene is much more advanced.

It has a nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Food prep time is very reasonable and everything I tried was extremely tasty. My favorite items are Icli Kofte and Ali Nazik. If you go to Tuba with friends, I definitely would suggest sharing a few of their appetizers. Mucver (Zucchini fritters) is also amazing. They have good desserts such as kunefe.

I don't really have any cons about this place. It is kind of on the expensive side, like on the upper bound of $$ but I'd argue that it is worth it.
author: Cem A.
