description: Despite its small size, the interior of Tuba restaurant is cozy and welcoming. The menu has many delicious choices, but one of the must-try items is the kunafa for dessert. I found the prices to be mostly reasonable. What stood out was the service; their servers were kind, hospitable and gave us good suggestions. Overall a great vibe and meal, i will definitely be returning. I would suggest reserving a table in advance especially if you are coming here on a weekend.
author: Muhammed A.

description: My wife and I are regulars here. We love this place from the cozy ambiance to the delicious food. I always get the Adana kebab and it's tasty every time without fail. My wife loves the eggplant puree with lamb chunks dish but tried their special, lamb shank. It was tasty, tender, and had a nice gravy. This is a lovely date night spot. They do get busy so recommend making reservations.
author: Ali H.

description:
Tuba's Turkish food is as good as it gets. The restaurant's elegant appearance and welcoming staff contributed to our positive experience, and ultimately provided the ideal ending to a fun day of hiking and sightseeing.

All of the mezes we ordered were delicious, but the falafel was the most memorable by far. It was served on a bed of hummus, and paired perfectly with their complimentary warm bread. The falafel wasn't greasy or overly dense, and the spices in each piece were very pronounced.

The fried eggplant in the Kızartma was fresh, and the dish contained a relatively even amount of eggplant distributed among the bell peppers and zucchini. And while the portion was small, it was still satisfying.

I can't speak for the meat dishes, such as the İçli Köfte, but I can say that all of our plates were polished off by the end of dinner. Visually similar to breaded meatballs or rice balls, the İçli Köfte were stuffed with spicy ground beef and crushed walnuts, covered in bulgur wheat, and pan-fried. The meze includes two big pieces, which doesn't look like a lot, but is sufficient for a couple of people to share.

By the time we left Tuba, we were stuffed. We wish we could've ordered additional items from the menu that night, because we weren't disappointed by any of the mezes we tried!
author: Daniela L.

description: Great food, great service. Its nice to have some high quality, authentic Turkish food in the city. I like their outdoor tables during warmer months. They have a good selection of Turkish wines as well, give them a try.
author: Kerim A.

description:
It was good. For the price, it really wasn't all that good. 

The ambiance is alright, it's pretty basic. 

A few friends and I came to dinner on a Friday night. We made a reservation for six people. I ended up going for the item on the specials menu lamb shank, tender cook, nice tasty sauce and the shank was huge. Dinosaur bone style!

I pretty much cleaned my plate and was super full. I liked it, but my meal and the beer came out to $45. Yikes. Wish I'd come in prepared to blow that much. 

My partner ordered lamb kebob, which he liked but said was under whelming and not worth the money. 

Overall, good food but I'd rather go somewhere else any day.
author: Priti K.

description:
I've never had Turkish cuisine but the food here is amazing.  It's a quaint, fashionable small-mid sized restaurant in San Francisco Mission district.

The all inclusive appetizer was the highlight of the night.  The flavors were distinct for each item.  The main dish was the Kofta which are grilled beef patties served with grilled veggies.  Normally I go vegetarian - these are worth a try.  Patties are moist on the inside and served with grilled veggies and yogurt dip.  

Service was friendly and efficient.  We arrived around 6 on a Thursday night.  At this time not many tables were filled.  But after 1 hour the place was packed so if you want to come, make a reservation on Open Table or Yelp
author: Peggy H.

description:
Delicious food, friendly service, fun atmosphere...everything we ate was perfectly seasoned and wonderful. I had the eggplant dish and I didn't want it to be over. The lamb Shank was huge and tender...absolutely delicious. 
Definitely coming back.
author: Nilu r.

description: One of the best Turkish restaurants in town. It is my favorite. I was there on 08/18/18 to celebrate my birthday. The food was amazing as usual. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. Great service. That's the only place that I recommend my friends if they ever want to try Turkish cuisine.
author: Beki F.

description: Best Turkish food I've had in San Francisco. My suggestion is to get an appetizer platter and entrees to share. Portions are large and you want to try a bit of everything. The staff is super nice.
author: Ruben L.

description: High quality food  and nicely decorated place. Warm vibe and good service. Place is small and can seem over crowded in peak hours. Parking is difficult to find. A bit over priced in my opinion.
author: M K.

description:
Ordered the Köfte. It's basically a couple of pieces of slider sized hamburger patties cooked with Turkish spices served with salad. I'm glad it took awhile for it to come out because that meant they freshly prepared it and it showed. Very juicy and the Turkish spices cooked into gave it a nice taste to it. It went well with the Elfes Plisner I ordered for a drink. I'm not sure exactly what type of rice it came with but it was just sticky enough for me. Friendly staff that took their time to make an earnest suggestion about what to order on the menu. The restaurant ambiance was nice but a bit noisy as I found myself almost yelling to have a conversation.

I'm not surprised anymore that restaurant is still a fixture in this spot when all the surrounding restaurants in the area have practically come and gone over the years.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
I was really impressed by the food and service here! The atmosphere feels very warm and welcoming. Prices are a little high but well worth it for the quality.

They give you free delicious bread to start. For the entree I ordered the Musakka ($22) which was eggplant stuffed with potatoes and zucchini covered with cheese and bechamel sauce. It's served with a small rice and salad. I could not get enough of the rice! It was so flavorful and the texture was perfect. The rest of the dish was filling and very rich from the cheese and sauce. I also tried some of the miniature beef patties from my friend's Kofte ($22) entree and I preferred hers slightly more.

Overall wonderful place to get authentic Turkish food!
author: Linda X.

description:
One of us got lamb chops, and that dish was very good, although tiny vegetable serving accompanied it. A few thin slices of carrot, pepper, etc.  Pretty but only enough for a couple of forkfuls.  

The other of us got a chicken dish with mushrooms, tomatoes, olives etc.  Other than being too salty, it was a tasty dish spiced to be typical of southern Italian cuisine, not Turkish, which was odd.  Server took my plate to kitchen to put leftovers in a to-go box.  I just got the container out for lunch and found an unappetizing surprise in it.  The rice was criss-crossed with long dark hair.  The server was blonde, so it was hair from somebody else in the kitchen.  Apparently questionable hygiene in the kitchen.  Yuk!  Very disappointing to have to throw out the leftovers instead of having them for lunch.
author: S L.

description: Great service, but only mediocre food. Lamb should be a specialty for Turkish cuisine, but was over cooked , bland, and dry. Not much lamb either for $25+ plus. Very disappointing. Sides also lacked spice and flavor.
author: B H.

description: "Authentic" is the right word for this food. Everything I tasted here was exactly like I used to eat in Turkey. Great taste, great portions, great service. I had Meze platter, wrapped beyti kebab, kunefe, and Turkish tea. Finished every bit of the food. Service was exquisite! Nice, friendly Turkish waitresses were very attentive. Instantly this became my favorite Turkish restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Ramsey O.

description: This place was an absolute pleasure and everything from start to finish was nothing short of exceptional. This is a "must try" and the food is absolutely incredible. The Adana Kebab and the Cevizli Ezme are must haves and are stunning dishes. The service was incredible and the staff there are knowledgeable and passionate about the food. Do yourself a favor - come here!
author: Christian H.

description: It's a nice restaurant, and very good food. You won't be disappointed. It's not the best, their choice of feta is off the mark, and lentil soup not quite authentic.
author: Dilek I.

description: I've traveled to Turkey and the food at Tuba is lit! This is the real deal.
author: Calforever C.

description: ...with a group of 6 tonight...we all left full & happy...not one complaint out of anyone...crowded for a tuesday...
author: Bob L.

description: The food was very good. My only complaint is that they charged us extra after we paid our bill and tipped. Sneaky .
author: Erica A.

description: Expensive but tasty! I got the dish that looks like mini wraps covered in red sauce and yogurt. Not a ton of room so try to make reservations if you can. Dont forget to check in on yelp $5 off but I forgot to use the coupon. Don't be like me, remember to use the coupon!!!
author: Y W.

description:
Okay. I just have to take a second to disagree with the other reviewers who say you don't get a lot for what you pay. 

We left STUFFED. Between two people, we split the Tuba Meze Tabagi (basically the cold appetizer sampler), Adana Kebab (beef and lamb kabob with grilled veggies), and the Kofte (beef patties with grilled veggies). The appetizer sampler is excellent, though probably better suited for 4+ people (our server told us that, but our eyes were bigger than our appetite). Both entrees were excellent, hot and full of flavor.

I must note that this was my first taste of authentic Turkish food, so I am not an expert by any means. But I know what good food is, and Tuba is bound to satisfy. The interior is cozy and intimate, creating a truly authentic dining experience. Highly recommend!
author: Fiona F.

description: A really perfect restaurant by all what it means. I will start with waiters they were very friendly and helpful . Although the restaurant is small but it has a unique design. I went there with my family and ordered alot of food without exaggerating all what we ordered was very tasty and also the quntatity was pretty good . After that we ordered the kunafa and baklava all of them were great but the kunafa was one of the best desserts I ate .
author: Talal A.

description: Great place for quality food! They were so good with our big and loud party of 6 girls, we never felt rushed and were taken care of so well! The food was absolutely delicious! We got a hot mezze, their signature cold mezze, moussaka, a shrimp dish, ground meat with eggplant and kebab wrapped in lavash! My favorites were the signature mezze, the kebab and the ground meat! I would also highly recommend the dessert (knaffe) which was unlike anything I have ever had and so delicious! We also got a Turkish coffee which came with the most delicious Turkish delights! Will definitely come back to try more of the dishes :)
author: Rachel N.

description:
***5 stars***
Before I comment on food, I must say their service is amazing. It's a cute  sit down place but never felt over crowded. They have great wine and beer selection. Hummus, ezme, rice, chicken kabob and yoghurt dip is fabulous. Vegetarian folks will definitely like this place!
author: Mitali M.

description:
So this was our back up for the night and I am glad we had to choose the back up cause it was so worth it. The kunefe desert was amazing and something we food mongers started with. We order the cold meze platter, the falafel plate, from entrees we ordered eggplant and marinated chicken and everything was super yummy. 

The Turkish tea and coffee after our meal with baklava made everything perfect. I would recommend this place to anyone who loves food, and you have so many options here, regardless of your dietary restrictions. So all you vegetarian friends, vegan lovers or gluten free people , this is the place for you. 

The staff is polite and amiable , and ambience is of a typical Turkish place, cozy and warm.
author: Ramyata M.

description:
I'm 34, born and raised in California repping a Turkish heritage, and never have I been to a Turkish restaurant Stateside that should actually be in Istanbul (when you walk out, you wish the Bosphorus or İstiklal caddesi was around the corner behind Lone Palm). TUBA serves a meal that would be the highlight of the evening for Turkish friends and family in Istanbul itself, and that doesn't require much by way of imagination. 

The food is layered with complex flavors that work off each other but don't overwhelm: the food feels classic but not dated. The mezzes are carefully made and memorable (patlıcan salatası, cevizli ezme, sigara börek and entrees Adana, pirzola were all memorable). 

I ate here for the first time last week, and came back excitedly one week later to introduce my friends to Turkish cuisine and culture. Well done.
author: Besim U.

description: I'm a vegetarian and this place has really good vegetarian options. Everything I ordered was delicious. The only negative thing is that the quantity of food is less for the high price you pay per dish. I would say it's more than a $$ restaurant.
author: Prateek K.

description:
Yelp says it was Michelin recommended; however, my bf and I experience nor service was any where near fantastic. First off, our complimentary bread was not served; despite seeing the table next to ours (they came in way after us) enjoying theirs. It wasn't until our food arrived at the table that I had to flag our server to bring us bread because we never got ours. As I should of read from the other reviewers, "service was non existent" seems to be quite true for this restaurant. 

One of the primary reasons why we wanted to go there was because of the Manti. We saw great reviews and photos; however, when we got there for our 6:15 pm dinner, it was not available. "Sold out" was what the server told us. Ok, a huge disappointment, so instead of deciding to order an appetizer to share and then main entrees, we decided to share a few appetizers. We decided on a few options, Turkish cigars (Sigara Boregi), zucchini fritters (Mucver), meatballs (Icli Kofte), prawns with in tomatoes, feta cheese and garlic in pepperoncini sauce (Peynirli Karides). I specifically asked if that was way too much for us in which our table server responded "that's good." Not once did she tell us it was way too much food for two. Unlike other restaurants, they'll straight out tell you if you ordered way too much and then it's up to the customer to want keep what they have. However, a couple of disappointments led us to a bad experience. Our food came out all at once in tiny small table that could not accommodate all our food. We had no room to eat since the table was jammed packed with four dishes. Given that it was all hot items, we would of enjoyed it if they brought out 2 dishes at a time so we could enjoy it while it was hot, but that was not the case, despite me asking our server if she could possibly not bring it all at once. "Too late" was her response. 

We didn't even get to enjoy our hot food since it quickly got cold before we could move on to another dish. Not only that, my bf who is Turkish was not impressed with the food. All the dishes were mediocre and nothing beyond fantastic. My bf even made a joke about Michelin recommended huh? 

Looking over the table next to ours, who got there complimentary bread and olives with their appetizer order; their main entrees took well over 45 mins to arrive. At one point, I heard the couple asking the same server about their main entrees. Now I'm not sure, but this restaurant doesn't know how to service or they don't get their food timing right. Overall, food was 2 stars and service was probably a 1.
author: Asianone T.

description: We came here for the first time and the food was great. The service was; let's just say you have to be a little assertive and let them know you are ready. But overall it was a great dining experience. It is a bit small so try to sit near the wall not in the middle.
author: Ana M.

description: Super fast. Super flavorful. Just amazing. Fun atmosphere to boot. I had an amazing chicken dish. My wife had lamb kabobs. Just incredible.
author: T H.

description:
I was very excited about trying out this restaurant when my Los Angeles friends happened to eat here, and told me they enjoyed this restaurant so much they wished there was one just like it here in Los Angeles. Being from Los Angeles myself, I made sure I visited Tuba Restaurant the next time I came to San Francisco. 

I called and booked ahead of time. Reserved a table for a party of 9 people. I told them over the phone that I was from Los Angeles and how excited I was about trying their authentic Turkish cuisines. 

At first glance, the restaurant is chic and cozy, on a cute little street. Street parking was hard to find. 

Once we sat down, with my American family, I introduced myself to the server and told them that I am Turkish and that I am very excited to be here. I told them about how much my friends had raved about their food, and thus, I brought my whole American family from San Francisco to try their food. 

We decided to eat family style, with lots of big dishes to share. At first we ordered a bunch of appetizers. 

So here is the part that drops the stars from 5 to 3: 
The first combo appetizer plate we get, I take a bite off the spinach dip and there is a hair in it! Immediately I spit it out, quietly, and drop it off to the floor so the rest of my party is not grossed out. But I am now very grossed out and dissapointed. 
I then call our server and tell her, quietly, in Turkish, that I got hair in my food. 
She looks at me in disbelief, and instead of apologizing, grabs my plate and brings me a new one. I decide that I am not going to ruin my whole family's experience so I tell no one. 
After all the appetizers are finished and we move on to the entree, the same server comes back and asks how everything was. I tell her the food was good, and then she says, "well I hope the good food made up for the bad start".  I tell her "yes" and we continue to eat. 

We order: 
appetizer plate
sigara borek
several plates of lamb, several plates of combination kebabs, 
Manti
Turkish wine, 
Various deserts: Kunefe, baklava, helva, chocolate pyramid
Turkish coffee and turkish tea.

Our bill is $500 plus tip.

So here is my verdict: 

1) Although they had charged us 20% gratuity, they never told us so my husband ended up giving them an additional 20% tip on top 

2) Even though the food was great, the hair in my food at the very beginning was a big buzz kill. What was even more annoying was at no point did they attempt to apologize about it. She just kind of looked at me in disbelief. What I expected, instead, was for them to apologize and perhaps bring a desert as a gesture for apology. Generally, in such establishments, that is the right thing to do. Especially for a table this big, who just dropped almost $500 for food, the least you could do is take out a desert or two off the bill as a sweet gesture of apology. 

Yes, the food was good and the ambiance was lovely. But I wish they had better courtesy.
author: Sarah S.

description: Excellent falafel, meza plate, and everything else! My partner and I dropped in without reservations - thank goodness they had a few bar seats! We will be back to try more menu items!
author: Emanuel K.

description: Tried this spot on a date night and loved it! The food was excellent and it was nice to try something different. The fried bulgur appetizer was very delicious. Only downside was that it was super crowded and loud but the awesome food made up for it. Definitely try Tuba out!
author: Rachel G.

description: I came for the first time Saturday. The restaurant was packed but they were quick to give us service. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I wasn't sure what to order so the blonde server helped me out. I love lamb she suggested that I order the lamb chops. Thee best lamb chops I've ever had, they were super tender and delicious. We also offered the cevzili ezme it's a spicy tomato paste with walnuts it goes perfectly with their pita bread. I will definitely be back and bring all of my friends!!!
author: Nicole S.

description: The food here delicious and the service is good. Highly recommend any of the house appetizers and entrees.
author: Steph A.

description: Perfect lamb chops! Delicious. Grilled well. Also haydari was delicious. Service was fast and good. Waitresses are so kind.
author: Ali S.

description:
We ordered take-out and split two entrees and an appetizer. After placing the online order, we took about 20 mins mosey over before the order was ready, which was expected and only a short wait. The staff were nice as we sat in an empty booth and waited. My brief take of the ambiance inside was it's comfortable, not too dark or pretentious, nice pixel art work.

Bread - Four pieces of a soft flatbread with sesame.

Mucver - Three little patties of zucchini fritters. I thought they'd be more latke like consistency but they were pillowy on the inside and crispy on the outside. Cheese mixed into which were little pockets of flavor with each bite. Yum, these were my favorite part.

Chicken Kebab - Perfectly done kebab, the meat was was tender coated in a flavorful, slightly sour yogurt marinade, meat was juicy inside and not too dry. The grilled vegetables had a nice crunch and had just the right amount of slight charred from the grill. Tzatziki sauce was incredible as well. Portion size a little small (~5-6 chunks of meat). The chicken also came with a cucumber and carrot salad that was a little on the wet side but well seasoned.

Kofte - Four smallish patties of beef grilled. Flavorful and smoky but a little too dry for my taste. I added on a lot more tzatziki and to balance it out.

The food is really good, the kebabs are among the best I've had. A little pricey for the portion size as a to go option. I'd go back again for the sit in experience and to try other dishes.
author: Truc N.

description:
I'm with Priti K. on the price. For 6 people it did end up at almost $50pp and we all only ordered 1 drink each. For the same total price of the bill we all went to dinner with 8 people a few days later at a different restaurant. 

I was debating between the lamb chops and the special, lamb shank. The waitress recommended the shank over the chops so shank it was. The portion size was huge. The lamb was tender and the sauce was fantastic. It wasn't too gamey which I was a fan of. My meal was good. My hubby ordered the beef/lamb kebab which I thought had pretty good flavor but again the high price tag on it makes you question it's value. Also I'm a little surprised it was a ground beef/lamb combo in the kebab as mediterranean food is heavy on the lamb. 

Ambience was nice. The chairs were comfy. I didn't feel cramped at the table. The service was interesting. Four of us got there first and about 2 minutes after we sat down the waitress was there trying to get our drink orders. We told her we needed a few minutes as we hadn't even looked at the menu yet and she went on to list the drink menu for us trying to get us to order - it was pushy. We wanted a few minutes to get settled, look at the menu, and talk to each other and catch up on our day. After that she backed off and the rest of the service was good.
author: Lisa D.

description: Loved Tuba, would definitely go back and recommend to others. We shared two dishes, which was more than enough with the complimentary (delicious) bread
author: Camden P.

description: This place was exceptional. Service was great, food was amazing and bathroom was clean. These are all signs of a great restaurant that knows what good food is and how to serve customers. A cut above the rest! I had some of the goat cheese stuffed falafel and it was amazing.
author: Nikhil M.

description:
Amazing amazing food! I always crave their bread and dip! It is all made at the restaurant. My favorite is the red pepper dip and yogurt. 

The staff are always nice and ask if you need anything else, awesome service. 

They are only open for dinner fyi. I've tried many dishes from this place and it never disappoints. Even though they can get busy, I never have to wait too long for my food. Love this place :)
author: Allison S.

description:
Very delicious food. Myself and some comrades made our way here last week and had quite the enjoyable time. My only criticism.... and perhaps this is a common one! What's the deal with the 20% additional tip for parties of 5 or more?

5 seems like such an arbitrary, weird cut off. I personally have served parties of up to 7 and I can assure you that there is no additional difficulty. 8 seems to be more reasonable!!

Anyway, delicious food. Weird tipping system.
author: Jack T.

description: What an amazing meal and overall experience. Every dish was delicious. The staff were warm, welcoming and helpful. Too many favorites to list - third time for us an no disappointments. We were excited to bring our US born Turkish friend and he spent the whole meal raving and saying how much it reminded him of visiting his grandparents back home. A SF treat!
author: Jay D.

description:
We had gone to this place after reading recommendation from a friend here. When asked our waitress had suggested a Turkish Syrah and a Turkish Cab. We went with the Syrah Sevilen and did not regret at all. They had some decent collection of wine going.
For started we had ordered the cold mezze platter and falafel. We did not regret the mezze at all however the falafel plate was slightly shy of salt. 
For entree, I had gone with their tavuk sis and amongst the six of us we had ordered their eggplant special and beef also. The flavors in the chicken did not do any wonders for me however, the egg plant signature was very delicious. My friends seemed to have like the beef kebab more than the beef sis. 
We had shared their chocolate mousse for dessert. The dark chocolate thick outer layer in the shape of a small pyramid sealed the deal for us. We enjoyed our dinner and would recommend this place for trying out. 
Regarding price I would say it's on the steeper side of $$.
author: Say D.

description:
This place had the best Mediterranean food I've had. The place is vegetarian friendly,
falafel with hummus, Dolmas and Moussaka were just amazing! Good selection of wine and beer, the food was served warm and very flavorful. The service was very good, they cleaned tables multiple times, filled water and changed plates. Parking is available in streets around he restaurant. We had an amazing time and would strongly recommend this place!
author: Ramkumar G.

description: Amazing food, wonderful service, great atmosphere. I had the best falafel I've ever had. I'm Celiac and has no issues eating here. Their menu is labeled with what is gluten free and the waitress was super knowledgeable and helpful with what certain dishes had and how they were prepared.
author: Jack A.

description: Great food n service. Delicioussssssss, yummy n enjoyed a lot. Very good attentive n helpful staff.
author: Farah M.

description:
I have not been to Turkey in 5 years, but Tuba magically took me there in a matter of minutes. Their cold mezze platter is worth every penny of the $25 we paid for it! For the entree we did the lamb wrapped in pita with yogurt sauce. The yogurt in general at this place is pretty unreal in the best way possible. 

The service was stellar, and while the place is small, I did not feel like I needed to yell at my BF ie the noise level is on point. 

At one point the door was left ajar, and the waiter was quick to close it. 

I recommend this spot to everyone, except maybe a vegan, as the veggie options were limited.
author: Stephanie I.

description:
Everything here is made from scratch including the house bread. I've tried many of the dishes here and each of them were flavorful and delicious.

My favorite are the lamb dishes. Totally to die for- best lamb I've had in the city. Must must try! 

They also have the best service- friendly, quick, attentive, and well informed.

Great cozy ambiance. It gets super busy on weekends, so definitely make a reservation.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Dinner review. 

Bread + dips - 3/5
Ili kfte - 4/5
Sigara - 2/5
Lamb chops - 3/5
Stuffed Eggplant - 3/5
Kunefe - 5/5 - Better than any other kunefe I've had.
Irmik helvas - 3/5

Overall, good Turkish option. Kunefe is "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description: So good. Great service, wonderful fresh food.  I had a shrimp dish that was amazing. It's a little pricier than some places but the quality is worth it.
author: Mark S.

description:
We are not qualified to comment on the authenticity of the food but, based on the reputation of what's served in Turkey, it might be the real thing. Based on the many tables where we heard Turkish spoken, the Turks probably think it is.

If you've not heard, many people believe Turkish cuisine is better than French. I wouldn't say that but it sure is good and what's served here really is.

The service was nice and the price was, 'though not low, fair. We shall return!
author: Icono C.

description: Food was very good and authentic to what I have eaten in Turkey before. The staff is very friendly and happy to give you some suggestions if you haven't tried turkish food before. Overall very satisfied and would recommend to try it out!
author: Karim C.

description: Very good Turkish restaurant with wonderful service.  Their lamb dishes are great.  It's a bit pricey though.
author: Thomas P. L.

description: Great Turkish food! Their mezzes are superb! Great ambience and the tea is so good! Try the Tavuk Sis.
author: Hemant J.

description: Wow. This place is amazing. Cozy and inviting- the staff are very friendly. My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday evening and it was packed! Luckily we had a reservation. The food was authentic and tasty...we both left very full. I loved everything I ate and would definitely come here again!
author: Sarah G.

description: They have a really good authentic Turkish food. I highly recommend it to everyone. Don't forget to try the Ayran with your main dish.
author: Salman A.

description: The food was awesome and they have generous serving size as well. Had loads of fun with my girls out there. The ambiance is pretty cool too. Definitely would go there again.
author: Erica E.

description: Can I give less than zero?  Was told to wait for 10 minutes for a couple to pay their bill.  10 minutes pass they're still there and so I wait for another 10 minutes.  They leave, ready to be seated only to be told another will be taking the table because they have a reservation. BS!
author: avi a.

description: Yes great turkish food. Must try. Recommend the Adna kabob and the daily special lamb shank. Great atmosphere and Ambience we are here on a Friday night and a Saturday night and the food was amazing very intimate great place to hang out with friends the lentil soup was also delicious we had no space for desserts
author: Adam W.

description: Sneaky overall experience. Felt like the food was okay at best. Overall tasted like authenticity and also relative quality for the price is definitely not worth while. There are many other types of Middle Eastern food or even restaurants that are far more satisfying at eight substantially lower cost. The only thing worth mentioning what is the baklava where she works at best sub car I don't understand what the hype behind this place is
author: Soroosh P.

description: After spending some time in Turkey this is by far the best Turkish food I have had in San Francisco. The service was great and the place itself is cozy and clean. We got an order of the hummus and the adana kepab and the flavors were just of this world. I can't wait to go back!
author: Sheena P.

description:
On a Saturday night I was able to get a last minute reservation but the place was packed.

It's a bit noisy and crowded and very stuffy inside, we asked them to open the door which I'm sure those sitting near it didn't love but restaurants without ventilation really annoy me.  The service was very friendly and attentive. 

We ordered wine and beer and started with Turkish salad, walnut dip and eggplant dip with bread. 

The salad was great, the tomatoes they used were sweet and ripe and it all took me back to the Mediterranean. The dips were excellent, eggplant smoky and walnut dip absolutely yummy. The bread was out of this world.  We really should have stopped there, we were actually full after.

For the main dish we shared the stuffed eggplant, this was very underwhelming, it was all piled together and looked messy and uninspired, the flavor was not there, the only disappointing part of our meal. I get the feeling the appetizers are better in this place.
author: Inga W.

description:
Hi
I've been living in SF for couples years and almost tried most of the good restaurants.
I'm Persian and I like middle eastern food. Tuba so far is my favorite Turkish restaurant in bay area. I tried the Adena kabab was awesome and also bakhlava and teas are all so tasty and yummy. Nice atmosphere, friendly people!
I highly recommend this place to everyone)
author: A B.

description: If you are debating it, just do it. Best food I have had in quite sometime. A little more expensive but well worth it! Vegan and vegetarian options as well. Everything was fabulous! Great atmosphere, service, and food.
author: Erika P.

description: Really good place. Lots of names that I can't remember to recommend specifically. We'll definitely be back.
author: Seth C.

description: The menu has many delicious choices, but one of the must-try items is the kunafa for dessert. I found the prices to be mostly reasonable. What stood out was the service; their servers were kind, hospitable and gave us good suggestions.
author: Langston J.

description: Solid food and very good service. The atmosphere is appropriate. They did a really good job jamming in a lot of tables with making the space cramped. Well done.
author: Steve T.

description: I wish we took pictures of our amazing food! This place is excellent. From the atmosphere, service, and A+ for the food! I had the Tavuk Sote which was so amazing. The Fiance had the Adana Kebab. We ended our meal with some Turkish coffee which was perfect. Lastly, they are on point with their reservations. We were running a bit late and they saved our table for us! This place is a gem. Thank you, Tuba for making a great date night for us!
author: Kat E.

description: Fantastic cuisine, and authentic Turkish (not Mediterranean) food. Their fish was bomb af, and that kunefe was through the roof. My to go stop in San Fran!
author: Y A.

description: Yummmmmmmy. Really good food nice atmosphere taste food , nice music   Service fast and all team member is professional. I ate lamb shish and turkish ravioli
author: Onur N.

description:
We came here for dinner last Wednesday and enjoyed the eggplant stuffed with ground beef flavored with Turkish spices and their herb chicken.  Both came in a hot casserole bowl that kept the food hot.  Both dishes came with really good rice pilaf mixed with beans and a generous salad.  We also had Turkish coffee, Turkish delights, and ice cream with baklava.  Everything was good except the Turkish delights which were very hard and had no flavor. 

Service was slow and when we checked in on Yelp, the bill was reduced in a very convoluted way that we found confusing.  This is a very cute place and the food is high quality and generous in portion. I would come back but it is very small and feels a little uncomfortable, maybe because of the red decor which is not relaxing.
author: Lorissa W.

description: We went this place for dinner with my Brother and we enjoyed the Turkish coffee and all other foods. We ordered some to go also because it was really good. The parking was no problem for us too , the place is clean and the service people were nice to us. Some of the other Turkish coffee places are not that good as this place , recommend
author: Mac P.

description: I came 2 times really like it and I ate combo apatezars and cupra it's really really taste and fresh. When I came with reservations I find table but walking in need wait ... it's really delicious and professional service . Definitely I will come with family.
author: Savas B.

description:
So my friend and I were in the city for a conference and were starved! I was in the mood for Turkish and we looked up some places on Yelp. Tuba was very highly rated and we decided to give it a shot. In all honesty, this was one of the best Turkish restaurants I have ever been to (and I have been to Istanbul), actually, make that one of the best restaurant experiences I have ever had!

The place was small but classy. It had a very authentic "Turkish" feel to it. Everything on the menu looked delicious but we decided to order the appetizer sampler (highly recommended!) It was served with some fresh bread hot out of the oven. I went with the Adna Kabob and my friend ordered the chicken mozzarella dish (forgot the name). The food was amazing! 

In regards to service, the waiting staff was excellent! We definitely felt very special and were well attended to.

Overall, an excellent experience that I would definitely repeat when visiting the city.
author: Ali M.

description: Great food and very pricey comparing other Turkish restaurants in the city. Will return again sometime soon.
author: Firuz N.

description: This place is WOOOW. I came from La and one of my friends recommended this restaurant to me. The food is delicious, tasty and looking awesome. They have big potion. Atmosphere in the restaurant is very nice.Service is also great. I recommend everybody to visit this place.
author: Mesut K.

description: Came back and it was really good and deserves another star. Service was excellent and the grilled lamb chops marinated for 3 days are a must order. The dessert of some kind of cheese fried between philo with a honey glaze and ice cream was amazing. Our waitress was sweet and prompt. Recommended.
author: Jordan C.

description: This place really is special: a rare cuisine for SF, done very well (from what I've tasted and heard). The eggplant cold meze and icli kofte are so flavorful, and great with the complimentary bread. The adana kebab is delicious, and it's many accompaniments are a tour of strong, delightful flavors. Plus, the atmosphere and staff are a joy. Can't wait to go back!
author: Blake A.

description:
G and I went to Aziza over a year ago. We did not know it was a Michelin star restaurant. We ordered a few things to share, the food was superb but well, we did not know that it was a modern Moroccan and I kept on holding out for a tagine dish that was never on the menu.

We made sure that we studied the menu on Yelp before coming here this time. It was Turkish and it is said to be authentic according to its description. Tracy A came here and wrote a nice review on Yelp. I tend to follow her around these days - perhaps our dining choices are starting to collide. 

G promptly guided me to another spot. He was way off. I should never trusted his sense of direction. We arrived 15 minutes later than expected but it was still early and they gladly took our call and said that the table was waiting for us. Nice!

Incoming the free and tasty warm house made bread with three dipping sauces. The one thing I did not like Seattle eating scene is that they charge you for the bread, even those terrible ones that I won't even feed the pigeons with. I don't understand it. I like a place that makes yummy authentic Turkish bread and serve them with three kind of dipping sauces. All free of charge. And they did refill and the refill was a basket of warmer breads. Can I just eat that instead? 

Of course not. Ordered their signature cold meze which is called Cevizli Ezme. It's a big portion and very flavorful. Then for a hot meze we did İçli Köfte. It's impossible to pronounce so of course it's deliciously foreign and exotic. Stayed away from the salad based off Tracy's review. Because our last North Africa + Californian expedition ended with lamb at Aziza, we decided to go with Sebzeli Güveç, which is stewed lamb cube served on a iron pan to continue our tradition.  Superb.

G is an excellent runner. I often get my running tips from him. We also are friends and we took the opportunity to catch up: I updated him on the revolving door part of my life (because the rest of my life is insanely boring), and he debriefed me on his comings and goings. We concluded that I must lay off running until I'm all healed fro the annoying back injury. I sort of want to kick him because what am I if I'm not a runner any more? The meaning of life is contemplated over a cup of warm Turkish tea. 

Dark no-running cloud hovering my heart. Just then, he said, when you get better, we should try that Egyptian place in Outer Richmond. "Remember that place?" Yes indeed. We ate dinner after running once by there. Perhaps the purpose of eating at this restaurant is a way to tell me that I will get better. I will run again.  G and I are only at the beginning of our Northern Africa, Middle East food expedition.
author: Victoria E.

description: The second you walk in to the restaurant the welcoming and warm atmosphere calms you down.   The menu is full of amazing and tasteful options to choose from. After you're done with your food the servers introduce you with a second menu full of amazing desserts for your choosing. The künefe is a must try and goes especially great with Turkish Tea. The quality of the servers stood out with their hospitality, kindness and help. The prices were mostly reasonable when the quality of the food and the attention of the servers are taken into consideration. In total a great feeling and fulfilling meal that makes me certain to come again. I would suggest reserving a table in advance especially if you are coming here on a weekend.
author: Yusuf C.

description:
Good food, but WAY too expensive for what it is. Also the Moussaka had NO LAMB, and was cooked with mozzarella cheese. 

If you want upscale Mediterranean - go to Kokkari. Greek is not Turkish, but it's similar food with much better price to quality to experience ratio.
author: Liza P.

description:
I went to Tuba with my family last night and could not have had a better experience.

The food is delicious and delighted everyone (our group had one very picky eater and another with a lot of dietary restrictions and a couple vegetarians and one person that doesn't think it's a meal if there isn't a lot of meat involved).  My ONLY complaint is that it was too hard to pick - so we ordered way too many appetizers and then had no room left for our entrees and desserts.  

The service is impeccable.  The are very attentive without being intrusive.  We had to expand our reservation at the last minute and they found a way to accommodate even though it was very busy.

Most importantly - the staff were all so warm, kind and friendly - these are good people.
author: Danielle T.

description: Authentic flavors. Highly recommend this place. Remember it can get crowded during weekends so plan appropriately. One of the best Turkish restaurants
author: Asa A.

description:
My parents were visiting from India and I brought them here for dinner on a Tuesday night two weeks ago. I had never been to this restaurant but chose it based on Yelp reviews - and I couldn't have made a better choice. The restaurant wasn't crowded and the ambience was very enjoyable for our group of 5. What made the experience really great though was the service. Our waitress was quite friendly and attentive, and she checked on us regularly. At the end, I realized that I forgot to ask for the $5 yelp discount until after the bill arrived. I thought I had lost the opportunity to apply the discount but when I asked about it, the staff graciously went to the trouble of reversing charges, applying the discount and drawing up a new bill. Which was a very pleasant surprise.

As for the food, you can't go wrong with the Musakka or the Adana kebab. Though almost everything on the menu tasted great. We also ordered a Turkish tea (one of the best I've had) and the kunefe (really good) for dessert. Overall we had a wonderful experience - I highly recommend Tuba for your next family dinner!
author: Preethi S.

description: What a lovely restaurant. The food was wonderful and very fresh. Would def go back for more.
author: nick w.

description: Excellent Turkish food and lovely ambiance. I particularly enjoyed the Sarma Beyti Kebab, Patlican Salatasi, and bread. It would be nice if they'd add a couple of additional California wines and perhaps if they'd offer 2 oz. pours the wine, as there are many Turkish wines on the menu that would be interesting to try in smaller quantities.
author: Valerie Z.

description: Get the lamb chops!!!! So good. The service and environment was both friendly and inviting. We had the option to sit outside. It was a nice change.
author: Taylor P.

description: Came back recently and the service was amazing. lamb chop is so delicious and I can never have enough of their rice
author: Anabella V.

description: awesome and taste food...really  authentic restourant ,service professional ,bread is as like mom bread...
author: Ali E.

description:
This is really as good as it gets in terms of high quality Turkish food in SF and maybe the wider Bay Area; I have been to this restaurant a number of times and can't ever recall being disappointed with anything I ordered. The manti (beef dumplings) is my favorite. It's always made with just the right amount of flavor and the dough is soft and melts in your mouth. The lentil soup from the hot appetizers menu is another favorite. Especially last night, it was amazing on another level! And I love the mezze platter and eggplant dishes as well. Last night my bf ordered their beef and lamb beyti and while I generally don't eat lamb, I took a piece from his plate and loved it. I haven't tried any of their desserts yet, but am looking forward to doing so at some point. I did really enjoy the turkish coffee + turkish delight. You really can't go wrong with this place. 

I will grant, though, that the prices are a bit steep (for example two appetizers, two entrees and three non alcoholic drinks came out to almost $80). Definitely not the kind of place to casually drop in for a meal, but worth it for special occasions.

Also, a shout out to the service. Last night, upon learning that I would be breaking my fast here, the host (and owner?) brought us a plate filled with dates, olives and feta cheese. It's little things like this that really endears a place to me. I will always look forward to returning!
author: Zohal S.

description:
Icli kofte, Cevizli ezme are reliably good and are must be tried. Hunkar begendi is probably the best entre on the menu, but is a hit-and-miss situation. 
The decor is dark, gloomy and almost feels dingy. Service is good, though.
author: Deniz S.

description: If you want authentic Turkish food--which is surprisingly sophisticated and goes way beyond typical "Mediterranean" fare--you can't do better than Tuba. We started off with Cevizli Ezme, a delicious scoop of a red pepper and walnut mash perfect for spreading on bread. For entrees,we had the eggplant stuffed with ground beef--delicious--and the lamb kebab, topped with tomato and a garlic yogurt sauce. The lamb was amazing tender. Service was great, the staff--mainly Turkish--knew the menu inside and out, and we just loved our meal there.
author: Phillip D.

description: The food was excellent and service GREAT. I got cold meze plates that has my mouth watering even now. You must try their lamb shank and lamb chops. I love this place.
author: Yalçın K.

description: This place was unbelievably good. To my mom here for Mother's Day. The service was just as good as the food.
author: AL M.

description:
I visited Istanbul last year and took a food tour around the city. Out of all the places I've visited I loved the food in Turkey the most and am so happy to have found a place in SF that offers authentic Turkish food with great atmosphere!

We went with a group of six. We started with the Tuba Meze plate which offers a nice variety of their dips, dolmas and breads. We loved all of them, especially the aubergine and dolmas. We also ordered Sigara Böreği Fillo which is a mix of potato and feta wrapped in a filo "cigar" and fried. It was crispy, light and so flavorful!

My mom and I split the beef Koftes and they were insanely good. It came with four patties, rice and veggies and was the perfect amount to share. The beef was juicy and flavorful and reminded me so much of the food I loved in Istanbul

For dessert, you have to get the Kunefe. This is everywhere in Istanbul but hard to find in the US. It's shredded filo that's fried and dipped in a honey pistachio glaze. I was with a group of Minnesotans who aren't very adventurous. The name and unfamiliarity of the dish initially scared them, but we ended up eating the whole thing and they couldn't stop talking about it all night!

Looking forward to my next visit
author: Sophie S.

description:
We went here for dinner, at the recommendation of a friend. We are so glad we went. The food was outstanding.  We had the Cevizli Ezme, which was to die for. It was absolutely delicious (nice degree of of spice), and wonderfully textured. We shared a lamb shank, which was very nicely done. The bread/olive oil appetizer was fantastic. If you are not too hungry, a shared appetizer/entree + the bread will do the job here. If this is what Turkish people eat, then, we definitely want to go there. The only downside is that you have to park on the street, and depending on when you go there, you may have to drive around to find parking. Maybe taking a taxi/Uber there would be a way to avoid that issue. Food is reasonably priced. They also have a good wine list, btw, featuring many wines from Turkey/Greece. 
Recommended without any reservations.!!
author: Ravi R.

description: We went for the first time and enjoyed an excellent dinner for four. We had the hummus appetizer and the special whole fish Sea Bream, chicken kabob Tavuk Sis, Kofte beef patties, Falafel Salatasi salad. We had three desserts and Turkish coffees. It's on the pricier side but worth it for the quality ingredients and service.
author: Dan S.

description:
A great Turkish restaurant close to where I live. Heavenly food, kebabs are
the best I have ever tasted. Red lentil soup is a must to try with hot pitta bread.
Fresh, good quality food cooked to perfection. Turkish delight is always a perfect 
end to your experience at Tuba.

Staff always make you feel welcome and are attentive without being intrusive.
author: Patricia H.

description: What can i say i love Mediterranean food.  This is a great spot for Mediterranean fix. I love their Tabbouleh, Falafel , Meat dishes, Rice dishes! So so delicious! no complaints here!
author: Meishi M.

description: This was one of the best restaurant experiences we've had in quite a while.  We brought special friends from out of town here and everyone had a wonderful time.  Service was great.  Food was fantastic.  We ordered an assortment of mezes and mains and shared them all.  I can't wait to find an excuse to go back.
author: Jim K.

description:
Ever since returning from Berlin I've been left obsessing over why, here in NorCal, we have such a dearth of well-priced, satisfying Mediterranean fare.  In the grand scheme of things this is not a bad obsession to harbor.  

Tuba, a romantic, lightly lit, quiet Mission District restaurant is an imperfect response to my quest for the great meze platter or Mediterranean plate.  It's imperfection is mostly due to its prices, which sit a bit above what I consider "well-priced" though not hugely out of line for the ambiance provided. 

Tuba's lovely "Tuba Meze Taba ğı" (which the menu described as "a taste of all cold mezes", $25) was accompanied by fresh, warm Lebanese bread and made a perfect starter.  With some wine (Jade Mountain Cabernet, $9/glass), this appetizer, and a shared entree as an accompaniment, a party of two would be well satisfied.  Because we were a party of three, we added (in order of preference): 

* A tasty Adana Kebab ​($18); skewered spicy ground beef with lamb mixed with green and red bell peppers & special seasonings);

*  A mild-flavored salad, the sumac-dusted Falafel Salatasi ($13; falafel stuffed with goat cheese, served with mix greens, cilantro, basil, red onions & and orange vinaigrette); and

* a forgettable, tepid soup, Mercimek Çorbası  ($8; red lentils, spicy pepper paste, tomato paste, onions, mint, garlic, cumin).

Tuba is not the answer to my quest but the food is good and the ambiance is special.  The Yelp Weekly recently featured "Dining Out on a Third Date...Wink, Wink" and it strikes me that Tuba would be a perfect addition to that list.  

Additional info:

- Entrees are priced from $18 - $26.  A "$5 off" with Yelp check-in can help bring those prices down.   

- Extensive wine list (including Lebanese wine and generous pours); corkage fee runs $15/bottle.
 
- Reservations accepted but didn't appear necessary, especially on a weeknight.

-  Street parking in this part of the Mission District was also easy on a weeknight.
author: Tracey A.

description: They had the place beautifully setup for Valentine's Day! The food here is amazing! The chicken I had was very flavorful and juicy. I would come back here again in future.
author: Sagar G.

description:
I have been wanting to dine here for some time. Finally made it in over the weekend, on a Saturday evening. The shotgun style dining area is quite tight, and the atmosphere is really loud. For those with hearing difficulties, they will have a problem here. (at least at dinner when the place was completely booked). 
Service was exceptional, as this family run establishment really pushes to impress on the service side. Super friendly, and efficient, making sure all felt like family.
We wanted to sample a couple items, so started with their signature appetizer (Meze). Cevizli Ezme - Walnuts, Turkish red pepper paste, tomato paste, fresh garlic, olive oil, and cumin. Wow, this was excellent, and fresh, served with a home baked bread
Second, we had Peynirli Karides - Prawns sautéed with tomatoes and garlic in pepperoncini sauce and topped with feta cheese. This dish surprisingly was rather boring for me. Not sure where the flavor went, given the ingredients.
Finally I had the Musakka - eggplant stuffed with potatoes and zucchini, topped with bechamel sauce, this was served with rice and salad. I was again rather unimpressed with this dish as well. I had such high hopes I guess for such traditional Turkish dishes. I am sure we will return to try some other dishes.
author: Greg S.

description: My favorite restaurant in San Francisco . The meses ( appetizers I think ) are delicious . The lamb was succulent . I could eat here every day
author: Stephen R.

description: Great food and many great Turkish wine. We were there as a group of 8. All of us got great dishes. The food and the service was excellent. The appetizers we're nicely done too.
author: Mete R.

description: I hardly ever leave a review, but I can't express enough how awesome this restaurant is. It is as good as you can get on the streets of Istanbul. Service is fantastic and food is so delicious that we will come back to San Francisco just to go to Tuba again.
author: Artem G.

description:
Wouldn't let me use the 5 dollar discount for carryout 
Even though I asked about the offer and ordered. The person working there told me yes you can use it show me the offer  when you get there.
Food was just ok!
author: Abdool V.

description:
Top notch place for dinner, highly recommended. It's plush, warm and inviting and the service matches.

The food is spectacular, delicious and beautifully presented. The lamb particularly had superb flavor, but nothing could be faulted. A delicious glass of Turkish wine, recommended on request by our server, was the perfect compliment.

The restaurant is tucked away in a small business district and well worth seeking out.
author: Em R.

description: Amazing food, amazing service. Make a reservation because it's small and they get busy. It gets loud once it fills up but the ambiance is wonderful earlier in the night. Everything we ate was amazing. I really recommend getting the appetizer sampler plate - delish. And don't skip dessert!
author: Rebeccah Y.

description: Yuuuummmmyyyy!!! The best falafel, in a very elegant presentation. Hummus is perfect too. And the shrimp garlic dish was HUGE, fantastically seasoned. Atmosphere was lovely and yet we could hear each other in our cozy spot by the window. I believe you'll love this place as much as I did because it's simply delicious food and good service.
author: Geffen R.

description:
Everything we ate here was fantastic and the service was commensurate with the quality of the meal. We will definitely return as it just catapulted itself to my favorite middle eastern / Mediterranean place in the city. 
Their signature dessert is to DIE for. As are the three day lamb chops.
author: Sherry Z.

description: Fantastic food! Great service! Definitely will go back. One of the best Turkish restaurants in Bay Area.
author: Arslan I.

description: Service is really good and the mint or tukish teas are unlimited. The lamb chops are amazing and all the food was delicious.
author: Neha B.

description: So far, the best turkish food in California! Their chef, service, overall of everything is really perfect. Nothing is "Americanized" food. You will have a chance to eat real turkish cuisine. Also if you like red wine, I highly recommend okuzgozu. It is the BEST! I don't know who is the owner but thank you to him/her from here for having such a great place in San Francisco and keeping up the great service.
author: Giselle S.

description: Great restaurant in a nice setting. Waiters do their job, no frills no games and honor the reservations. Great food reasonable prices.
author: Erica K.

description:
I definitely do not understand the 4.5 stars review here. 
Food was good - definitely. But WAY overpriced for what it was and the atmosphere was just basic, so it's not like you pay more for the amazing experience. It's just an "okay" overprice restaurant. 
I am not sure if it's related to what we ate there, but my girlfriend spent her night in the bathroom throwing up a few hours after eating at this place.
author: Pauline T.

description: Ive been meaning to try this restaurant for a while now every time i walk by it is busy. Finally i decided to make a reservation for friday night. The restaurant is a cute little intimate place perfect for date night. It was a bit busy but the servers were quick to help us out. We began our order with the meze platter. It had a little bit of everything on it. We also ordered a bottle of their turkish wine they had so many to choose from there server brought us a fee to sample and we chose the sevilen syrah. It went perfectly with our food. I ordered the kofte and my friend ordered the beyti kebab they were both very delicious. To finish it up we tried the kunefe the best dessert ive ever had. We will be back very soon
author: Emire D.

description: This meal was an amazing experience.  From the Cevizli Ezme, the Kuzu Incik, and the Turkish coffee, this felt like perfection.
author: David C.

description:
My Turkish friend told us about this place, and since I have been to Turkey I wanted to experience again their wonderful flavors!
We made the booking one week in advance... but apparently it wasn't worth the effort because they got confused with our reservation and made us wait for a while even when our table was ready, good thing they made it up with dessert! 
We started with the Turkish wine, which was really nice with full body. The Tuba Meze came, with all of its delicious flavors, by the time we finished it we were getting pretty full but our entrees were on their way... mine was the HünkarBeğendi which I highly recommend! 
For a great finale we got Baklava and of course Turkish coffee!!
author: Azul O.

description: I read lots of good comments and very rare individual negative comments about here. I was there last week and I really satisfied with service and food.
author: Hande O.

description: The food is pretty authentic... The atmosphere feels very warm and welcoming.Stuff was very friendly...  I had lamb shank and Turkish wine which is Kalecik Karasi.I highly recommend . I'II back again
author: Doğuş Ö.

description: Despite its small size, the interior of Tuba restaurant is cozy and welcoming. Authentic flavors, you have to try all their appetizers! Great menu, pretty decent prices, lots of different types of Turkish food.
author: Ivy P.

description: Wonderfull    Im eatıng köfte and ıcli köfte. Real'le nice and delicious good.  I will come with my friends and family. In recommended here
author: Cihat E.

description:
This is a pleasure. Excellent service....well seasoned delicious food. Special note of the wonderful appetizers. Hummus, falafel, cucumber yogurt, bread, potato /feta/rolls ALL EXCELLENT.
Main dishes ...3 day braised lamb & pasta dumpling style dish where both good. Highly recommend for nice meal. Had to pass on desserts as most have nuts...but there was creme brulee for those that like.
author: Sharine d.

description: In this place, I am sure that you will feel real Anatolian taste. From south to north, east to west, you will find various type of Anatolian foods in there. At the end of dinner, you need to order real Turkish coffee. Otherwise, it will not be a real Turkish food experience.
author: Cihat Y.

description:
Man, it feels like I am in Turkey every time I go there :) Top notch venue and food. When I first discovered this place I was literally amazed by how delicious the food was. Because I was in SF for 7 months and drifted away from Turkish flavour at that time. I was sure of that it wasn't gonna be the same with places in Turkey. Well, this place showed that you can find any flavour in any part of the world at same level. I am really glad that I found this place. Now, it is one of my favourite restaurants in SF for sure. Very cozy place with caring staff, who is always smiling. You know Turkish people are famous with their hospitality. This place brings every feature of it. If you know nothing about turkish food, then try this place. I am sure it won't be your last time..
Also do not forget having a baklava. Keep the best for the last:)
author: Doğancan Y.

description: Mediocre food in extremely high prices. Food is a normal unsophisticated Mediterranean and the prices are of a chef bistro. Kabobs for $24, 3 tiny pieces of a strange baklava for $9. Not worth it really.
author: Eric K.

description: Good food, good atmosphere. They ran out of most of the wine we asked for on the menu but the one that the host suggested was good too.
author: Nikita N.

description:
Tuba is one of my favorite finds this year. The food is amazing, and the service is friendly and quick.

I've had the kuza pirzola (lamb chops, marinated for 3 days, and served with rice and veggies), and it is delicious, but I'm going to have to advice that you get the Somon, which is salmon baked and topped with spinach fume sauce, served with rice and veggies. It is hands down the best salmon dish I have had in a very long time.

Excuse me, I'm going to have to go and get some now. See you there?
author: Christina S.

description: Excellent! All the dishes were superb! Their signature cold meze whose name I can't recall, but included crushed walnuts, was packed full of flavor and an absolute must order! We also got the lamb that good but not great and the ground beef stuffed in eggplant which was delicious. Absolutely not to be missed is their cucumber tomato salad. The dressing on it is unbelievable, light but packed with flavor. The salad is huge so the three of us split it and each had plenty. Definitely check this place out. It isn't cheap, but it is well worth it.
author: Monica R.

description:
First night in SF, and I'm not sure what to eat, yelp recommends TUBA being the closest, and the kunafa or kunefe picture entices me to zero down on this! 

The restaurant was packed, which I understand from my server is not unusual over weekends. Luckily being on my own I got to sit by the bar and enjoy conversations with the bartender and servers. 

The home cooked bread with tomato and pepper dip was the best. Reminded me of something my mom makes and I enjoyed every bite of it.

I order the signature lamb chops and having grown up in the Middle East I'm familiar with the cuisine. The chops were grilled and served well, yet could have had a slightly deeper infused flavor and spice. The sides with the entree complemented the chops, and so did the rice. 

The kunafa was the best, and it's been long that I had kunafa and was craving for some, so this came at a right time. Aptly crisp, cheesy, light and sweet with pistachio, and ice cream, was a perfect end to my meal.

The best part about the experience was the ambience and the warmth from the staff, and their passion, I thoroughly enjoyed speaking to them.
author: Zaina H.

description: I am sooo happy ! We have been looking for a great, authentic casual Turkish place.Best food best service!
author: Ipek U.

description: This restaurant was amazing! My boyfriend and I drove all the way from LA to SF. It was late and we were starving hoping we could get into this place as Turkish food is our favorite, but noticed the long lines and impossible parking in San Fran. Walking in, we were told it was all reserved for the night (good sign for restaurant but not for us), walking out the host chased after us telling us they made room for 2 so we could eat! So extremely happy that they try to be the most accommodating (that's rare to come across!) from the start, all of the servers were just so nice to us. The food was beyond delicious, best Turkish food we've had (and my boyfriend is from Turkey!) We were so mad our bellies were full, as we wanted to continue eating the goodness! Prices are 100% fair for what you get. Highly recommend  Thanks Tuba for a great first experience in SF, we will be back.
author: Anna N.

description:
This place already has plenty of good reviews, but I was so happy with my experience that feeling eager to say few words. I am giving Tuba 5 stars based on the type of dishes/style, pricing and service, the balance between all three aspects. We were a group of 5, and ordered 4 main dishes to share, Adana kebab, lamb kebab, moussaka and beef with eggplant. For appetizer we had meze sampler. 

All dips were excellent, and were flavorful and light. I am very familiar with Turkish food, so I will admit that the dips were all very authentic, with warm bread served it was heavenly.

All main courses were good as well, nice presentation. The danger of ordering lamb kebab is that it can be dry, but this one was perfectly cooked. This is not some intricate creative upscale cooking, but good solid Turkish food, prepared with love.

Most of their wines are from Turkey. I didn't care for red wines (sampled one), but the white wine we had was excellent. 

We also ordered kanafee for desert, and I must say, it was the best one I've had in a while (and the capital of best kanafee is Nablus, Palestine, and thought Tuba's was better). Perfect temperature, often it is too warm or too cold. 

Service is outstanding. 

The only recommendation is perhaps to play more subtle music, folk music, instead of loud Turkish pop.
author: Meerim I.

description:
One of the pleasures of taking BART into the city is that some days it is delayed and instead of moping around, you can actually explore the city. That's how I ended up here with a Persian friend of mine who said that he had heard good things about Tuba. After a good meal there, I can see why.

This is around a 10 mt walk from the BART station. We were happy to get in because it was sprinkling outside (yes, it now rains again in CA) and were greeted by the warm colors. I really liked the lighting and red decor. Service was very friendly. 

My friend got the Turkish Pilsner which he said was ok. The complimentary break came with flavored butter, olives and feta cheese. Apparently is made right there which is cool. We started off with the Boregi appetizer which is fried filo dough filled with potato and cheese. It was as good as it sounded.  My entree was the lamb chops which was really good. Two thumbs up from me!
author: Sunil R.

description:
Best Turkish food on the West CoastEverything was fresh and authentic.... Especially Beyti Kebab, meze plate, icli kofte and kunefe were delectable.. 

Excellent service throughout, attentive amd prompt with everythimg we asked for. Friendly and  knowledgeable staff. 

Highly recommend a visit to this restaurant for both authentic Turkish cuisine as welll as authentic Turkish hospitality.
author: Seyhun S.

description: It was our first time dining at a Turkish restaurant, and I can promise you it won't be the last. Everything we tried was delicious - the piyaz and ezme cold mezes were both excellent, especially on a hot day, and the kofte and sarma kebab were terrific. Our server sometimes neglected us a bit, but the pace of dinner was right on, and she allowed us to taste many Turkish wines  until we found what was right for us. The kunefe, which is their signature dessert, is also not to be missed. We'll be back!
author: Doug T.

description: Awesome food . There signature cold meze is must try. It was utterly butterly delicious. There chicken skewers is also awesome . Chicken just melts in the mouth. Awesome place
author: Shv C.

description: Possibly one of the best restaurants in San Francisco.  Friendly staff, prices are fantastic, portions are generous and great selection of Turkish wines.  My husband took me here for my birthday for the first time last year and we have been in love ever since. I may be biased as Turkish food is one of my favorites, but the combinations of flavors here are just stunning.  We particularly loved the Cevizli Ezme, walnuts, red pepper and tomato paste with herbs made into the consistency similar to a tapenade and eaten with their fresh bread.  And basically all the mezes are gorgeous.  You could easily order just mezes and be completely stuffed.  I also recommend the Haydari, cucumbers, mint and dill, to accompany your richer dishes like Hünkar Beğendi, pureed aubergine with leg of lamb.  The last time we dined here, we went with our veggie friends and decided to go vegetarian with them for the evening. This proved to be very easy as many of their dishes, especially the mezes are vegetarian.  Our friends said it was possibly some of the best food they've ever had.  Plus, it was a tuesday night and they were packed.  So glad we made a reservation.  This place gets busier and busier....and they deserve it!
author: Adrian C.

description: So we were going out to dinner last night and the place we wanted to go to is now closed on Monday so our friend suggested Tuba. Now I love Turkish food so I was game and when we got to Tuba I had seen them there, ate at at restaurants over the years next door and across the street but never at Tuba. The were welcoming and sat us down right away. We order two appitizers, one being the Haydari which was to dye for. I could eat this every day! Dinner came and all the my dinner companions food all looked delicious and they all said it was. I ordered the Tavuk Sote which cane with rice and a small side salad, so good. We ordered one desert which was their signature desert that i cannot remember the name but it was a flakey dough, with honey and a side of vanilla ice cream, a must and next time I will get my own! The service was friendly and near perfect and I will be going back soon.
author: Ben G.

description: Yummyyy .  I love this place , really good delicious taste food. Server and manager is professional. I enjoy with food and Turkish tea
author: Jennifer D.

description: The filipina waitress was the best. She was very attentive to our table and gave great recommendations from the menu since it was our first time dining at a turkish restaraunt. Super nice and we will be coming back to this place more often. Highly recommend this place!!!!!
author: Martin M.

description:
Excellent
Omg the food was delicious. We order the meze and an other appetizer that looked like a meatball but it was a hard crust kinda like a shell and it was filled with ground meat and walnuts super delicious. The service was also great kids loved the chicken skewers with bell peppers. Husband got the Adana kebab in lavas bread and I got the lamb chops and it was amazing! Finger licking good! The dessert was this chocolate ganache pyramid filled with a chocolate mousse which was good but didn't have the hazelnuts that are advertised in the menu.
author: Iftikhar K.

description: Very nice ambience. Great food. We ordered the Sarma Beyti Kabab. It's a must order! Also, must order dessert Kunefe with Turquish coffee, it's unbelievably delicious! For 2 people, we spent $67 with dessert, coffee, wine and 2 courses. Definitely will come back!
author: Ibelig V.

description: Not that much better from other Turkish restaurants in the area. However, it is quite overpriced. The best things about this place are a really good wine selection from Turkey and good service. Not sure I will make the trip to SF for this restaurant but if you are around and want to try some interesting Turkish wines it is worth a try.
author: Vv V.

description:
Phenominal dinner!
Service was great and the food was excellent.
Perhaps the best Turkish food I've ever had.
Tovuk Sote was to die for.
Our server was great.
Recommend to anyone in the Bay Area ... Only 6-8 blocks away from BART station on 24th & Mission.
author: Henry B.

description:
This is a cozy restaurant with a laid-back atmosphere and tasty authentic Turkish food. It's my favorite spot for Turkish food out of all similar ones in the bay area especially since I think they get the taste right unlike some other places with a lot of hype and not so much quality in taste. 

I highly recommend their hot mezes. The favorites are icli kofte, mucver and sigara boregi. As the main entree we usually get hunkar begendi which is a great eggplant based dish with lamb chops.
author: Alper E.

description: First visit here tonight. This restaurant came HIGHLY recommended by a foodie friend who has worked in the fine dining industry (both in the kitchen and front of house) and knows about GOOD food. Much thanks to him for introducing me to what is now one of my favorite restaurants in the bay area, not to mention favorite Turkish restaurant hands down. From the service, quality of food starting with appetizers to dessert and coffee, to the cozy ambience (though noise level is loud), everything was exceptional and the quality was undeniable. I was excited to see on the menu different wines from Turkey, and our server did not hesitate to offer some tastings, as well as happily guide us through the rest of the dinner menu. Cannot wait to come back for more lamb chops and wine.
author: S K.

description: I don't remember what I had. But it was good. I would come back just for the Kunefe dessert. AMAZING. That is all
author: Laura D.

description:
Delicious, original food - more than the standard Middle Eastern fare. Yes they have kebabs, but their appetizers featured  several Turkish delights (pun intended) that I had never heard of before - and all were delicious. Various cold salads made of white beans, tomatoes, zucchini, eggplant, and lentils all tantalized our tongues and prepared the way for the delicious food to come.

Like I mentioned, in addition to their original Turkish dishes (the beef dumpling plate with yogurt and sumac sauce was very good), their kebabs were executed much more deliciously compared to similar restaurants. We had the mixed grill plate - an unbelievable value at $24. The lamb chops were charred nicely on the outside yet a perfect, tender medium on the inside. Likewise for the minced lamb, beef, and chicken kebabs. 

Not only is the food very delicious, but the prices are very reasonable and the service attentive and friendly. If you don't know what to get, your server will be more than glad to explain and guide you to a savory selection.

I highly recommend Tuba. I know I will be back again.

Delicious, original food - more than the standard Middle Eastern fare. Yes they have kebabs, but their appetizers featured  several Turkish delights (pun intended) that I had never heard of before - and all were delicious. Various cold salads made of white beans, tomatoes, zucchini, eggplant, and lentils all tantalized our tongues and prepared the way for the delicious food to come.

Like I mentioned, in addition to their original Turkish dishes (the beef dumpling plate with yogurt and sumac sauce was very good), their kebabs were executed much more deliciously compared to similar restaurants. We had the mixed grill plate - an unbelievable value at $24. The lamb chops were charred nicely on the outside yet a perfect, tender medium on the inside. Likewise for the minced lamb, beef, and chicken kebabs. 

Not only is the food very delicious, but the prices are very reasonable and the service attentive and friendly. If you don't know what to get, your server will be more than glad to explain and guide you to a savory selection.

I highly recommend Tuba. I know I will be back again.
author: Sherif H.

description:
THE WAIT: None on a Sunday night at 8pm for two.

THE SERVICE: Very prompt, formal. They took a really long time to make the first check-in at our table, but once our server came around that first time, he was pretty accessible. I was a little sad to realize later than when he packed my Sarma Beyti leftovers, he barely included any of the sauce I'd carefully make sure to leave plenty of on my plate.

THE COST: About $100 total for a 3-course dinner for two. Yelp check-in gets you $5 off!

* Free flatbread - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tuba-restaurant-san-francisco?select=zUeTTskaHaF-_I6B3vbrOw#w7tJAY4p7uYw83CnC-Q39w
This is one of the nicest complimentary dishes I've every received. The flatbread was fluffy with a good crisp. It was topped with sesame seeds and other tasty spices. And it came with three dips. This was great to have with the Ezme! 

COLD MEZES
* Cevizli Ezme (walnuts, turkish red pepper paste, tomato paste, fresh garlic, olive oil, cumin. $9) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tuba-restaurant-san-francisco?select=zUeTTskaHaF-_I6B3vbrOw#4RXKqseRAzOMqDdsmoHQ7g
Very flavorful! I love the texture too. The dish was smaller than I thought, but it was more than enough to go with all our bread, plus we had leftovers. 

SIGNATURE ENTREES
* Sarma Beyti Kebab (adana kebab wrapped in lavas bread, broiled, topped w/ homemade tomato & garlic yogurt sauce. $20) - 4 stars
