pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tuba-restaurant-san-francisco?select=zUeTTskaHaF-_I6B3vbrOw#bE-KpN3-zG9ZRfeVPOrxrA
Very very tasty. The lavas bread was soft and had a great consistency, but held together well. The kebab meat was dense and full of flavor. The sauces were fantastic. This came with a big slice of roasted green pepper (very spicy!) and tomato, which were a little out of place as you had to go out of your way to cut small pieces of both and mix it in with a bite of the sauce and the meat/bread.

* Karniyarik (eggplant, stuffed w/ ground beef, tomatoes, onions, chopped parsley, then baked. rice & salad. $18) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tuba-restaurant-san-francisco?select=zUeTTskaHaF-_I6B3vbrOw#Ebl4uCw0CmeJya3CvqypAg
The ground beef mixture was really great! However, I wish the flavor had soaked more into the eggplant. If you took a cross-section slice of the eggplant, it was about 60% eggplant (which was bland and a little dry, plus the skin was super tough), but the meat was great. The rice and onions actually had pretty good flavor. The salad was simple.

Dinner menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tuba-restaurant-san-francisco?select=zUeTTskaHaF-_I6B3vbrOw#zUeTTskaHaF-_I6B3vbrOw

DESSERTS: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tuba-restaurant-san-francisco?select=zUeTTskaHaF-_I6B3vbrOw#Gjihsvgi9ZiLPXzck4F2Ug
* Künefe (2 layers of kadayif, shredded fillo dough, filled w/ sweet cheese, baked. w/ homemade syrup & pistachio nuts, ice cream. $10) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tuba-restaurant-san-francisco?select=zUeTTskaHaF-_I6B3vbrOw#Zq5OQ_kZrk48lV3j35NP4w
Wow, nice! Intense honey-like flavors. The filo dough ends up being pretty hard, but this comes fresh out of the oven. The ice cream was really sweet and a little icy in texture when it first came out (but I guess it worked out well because it melted quickly with the hot kunefe.

Our receipt: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tuba-restaurant-san-francisco?select=zUeTTskaHaF-_I6B3vbrOw#lq9nUyxOE9op5EqoabvIJA
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Excellent Food and Service - will be returning!

I am usually critical of Turkish restaurants in the US, since I always compare them to the food in Istanbul. However, the food here was incredible, I ordered the house special lamb shank and my friend ordered the eggplant with ground beef entree, both were tremendously flavorful and beautifully presented. The bread and sides were also high quality and the prices were very reasonable for what I would consider a nice SF sit down spot. 

The service of the staff was remarkable, I casually mentioned it was my friend's birthday and they made the dessert quite a fun and memorable experience. 

I suggest making a reservation ahead of time as this can be quite busy on a weekend evening.
author: Mohsin A.

description: Amazing service, amazing food. That really sums it up. Truly family owned and run which is reflected in the food. Order anything off the signature entree list and you'll feel like you're in turkey. Highly recommended
author: Faiz H.

description:
Wow. Just...wow. Service is great, the servers are polite, kind, attentive and efficient.
The food is PHENOMENAL! A great selection of vegetarian, seafood and meat. Everything they make with eggplant is delicious. 
They have a salad with prawns coated in some sort of heaven. The salad has a citrus olive oil dressing that's the perfect blend of tang,savory and sweet. And it's a huge salad. Two of us split it and there were leftovers.
And the Turkish Delight - little square puffs of happy tasty clouds in your mouth.
I've eaten there 3 times and never had a anything close to a disappointing experience or meal.
Don't even question - just go.
author: H. H. M.

description: Delicious food so authentic!! Rice was amazing had chickpeas in it, delicious meat and tea was great! I wish they had an option to get a plate of Turkish delight as a dessert!
author: Asif A.

description: I came to this restaurant just based on the reviews and wanting to try something different. I came here last night with my cousin and casually mentioned it was her birthday. Not thinking of it. We order the food and it was amazing. Nothing short of spectacular and service was great. Than after we ordered dessert the staff came and sang my cousin happy birthday. We were so surprised we didn't expect it. It took them evening from a 9 to a 12. It is an amazing place. Enjoy and have fun
author: Yasmeen A.

description: The best new restaurant I have gone to in a long time. The best service and attention to detail to be had. It gets my highest rating. Completely awesome  , the highest effort from everyone there. Going back real soon.
author: Milton L.

description: I came first time here my friend said to me about here. Really nice , delicious, really good taste and really really professional service. Lady's really good , Beyti and chicken kebab very well. Yummmmmmyy
author: Esat U.

description:
The best lamb preparation I have had in a while. Go there on a Friday or Saturday and have their lamb shank. It should be a bucket list item for people! 

Service is alright but the food is so good....nothing else matters when food is that good.
author: Sugar P.

description:
Excellent, excellent Turkish food. Reminds me of my days living in Bursa. Wish they'd get more authentic bread or sub out pita - their bread is just "ok". Which is a shame, because their mezzes are terrific. 

Highly recommend the cold mezze 'try one of everything' platter.
author: Sarah K.

description:
Having lived in Turkey for 6 months and having travelled to over 10 major cities all over Turkey, I can say that this restaurant is not authentic. 

What I ordered: Yellow Mercimek soup - 2.5/5 stars & Adana Kebap (spicy) - 2/5 stars. 

While the food is not authentically Turkish, it does have flavor. It's definitely skewed to the American palette, especially in terms of spice. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who has not been to Turkey who would want to be exposed to Turkish food for the first time.

Service: Excellent, friendly and accommodating. That bumps my rating from 2 stars for food quality to 3 stars overall.
author: Amelia N.

description: Order the lamb chops. You won't regret it. No gaminess and extra crispy on the outside.
author: W A.

description: Found this amazingly lively restaurant after seeing a hilarious show at The Marsh.   Food here is delicious.  We had the dolma and falafel & humous first, then shared the eggplant with ground beef.  They also provided some delicious bread, feta, olives, buttery spread as well.  Loved every bite!  Beautiful restaurant full of energy.
author: Lori S.

description: Fresh sea bream and truly explosive tasting cevizli ezme, a pepper paste and walnut appetizer. So this is what real Turkish food tastes like!
author: Han K.

description: After many years of eating here, this remains one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. The food is consistently excellent and the service is Turkish hospitable.
author: Jim S.

description:
I can only say wow my first time and it's orgasmic!!! Like better than any turkish cuisine I had before... The shrimp appetizer wowwwwww the sauce , I can drink by the bowlful !!!!!!! And did I mention !!! It's orgasmic!!!! I don't want to even mention the dessert, cause it was the finish line for me ;))) and yes I am talking about the food!!!!!! 
People amazing, great service.. This is not a fast food place so be ready for 5 course dinner with great company... I will definitely come here again. And recommend that you make a reservation cause it's super busy!
author: Stacy M.

description: I thought this place was great until I found out the wine we ordered (the cheapest Chardonnay on the menu) was marked up over 300%. We got a bottle of Creme de Lys for $35... the price of the wine online is $9.99. That's how much a glass of this stuff costs at the restaurant. I understand it's expensive to run a business in this city but this restaurant should be ashamed of ripping off unknowing customers.
author: Elina P.

description: authentic turkish food, sweet kunafa. hot red trea that what i wanted and found in san francisco.
author: Khalifa A.

description:
Ran across this place on OpenTable and thought the menu sounded pretty good.  We've been to Troya's and Anatolian Kitchen, so do enjoy Turkish food.  

Cevizli Ezme Walnuts, Turkish red pepper paste, tomato paste, fresh garlic, olive oil,
 and cumin - Since many Yelpers raved about this app, we decided to give it a try.  It was a bit salty for me, but it came with 2 scoops of it which was nice size to complement with the bread.  Of course we ended up having to get more bread to pile it on.  

Adana Kebab Skewered spicy ground beef with lamb mixed with green and red bell peppers and our special seasonings - I was afraid that it might be too spicy but surprisingly it was mild enough and I loved it with the yogurt sauce.  

Hünkar Beğendi Pureed eggplant with mozzarella cheese and garlic, topped 
with leg of lamb chunks in red sauce - the eggplant reminds me of the Persian mirza ghasemi which I do enjoy and although there weren't a whole lot of lamb chunks, it was still filling enough since we had an app.  

Would definitely like to come back to try more things on the menu.
author: Joyce Z.

description: This is our second visit. Food is good but not excellent. Appetizers are really good. Main dishes not too bad but if you order from grill- expect burnt meat. You need to clean it unless you want to eat burnt food. Second visit triggered to write review. Our waiter simple forgot to order main dishes for us, more - she asked if we want to see dessert menu after we done with appetizers.  We waited more than 20 mins after we done with appetizers to get main entrees.  Nobody even said simple sorry.
author: Olena M.

description:
Tasty, beautifully cooked and nicely presented Turkish food. Most authentic Turkish meal
I have had in SF.  They even have çay (tea)!

Cosy ambience.

We had: lentil soup, roasted egg plant meze, lamb skewer entree. Freshly baked Turkish bread to accompany meze was a nice surprise.
author: Jared S.

description:
Is 'Tuba' a Turkish word? I typed it on Google Translate under Turkish, and the English translation came out, get this...'tuba'. Then I Googled it as 'Tuba Turkey' and found out it was either a scientific organization ousted by the current administration, the Turkish Academy of Sciences (TÜBA), or the first name of a Turkish supermodel. Something tells me I've been over-thinking this one, but I will say I like finding good Turkish restaurants in the city. Alongside Machka in FiDi and Troya in the Inner Richmond, this one may be the best of the bunch.

Located next to the far trendier Beast & the Hare on Guerrero near 22nd, it's as dark as a sultan's private tent, but I guess it's all part of the exotic mood they are trying to evoke. Of course, a loudish work party of fifteen wasn't doing anything to enhance the mood. I was seated at what appeared to be part of their take-out table next to the register. I didn't mind since I was there on my own to try some of their food. First came the complimentary Homemade Grilled Turkish Bread with three little dishes - a whipped hummus, a couple of olives bathing in oil, and a crumble of feta cheese (see photo). It was nice and warm and probably too much for one person, but who's complaining?

As a starter, I decided on the $9 Tuba Salad, quite a large plate of freshness with chopped hearts of romaine, tomato and cucumber mixed with some Turkish touches - cranberries, pita-based croutons and a sprinkle of paprika (see photo). It was a bit like a Caesar in a whirling dervish. My entree was the priciest thing on the menu, the $23 Grilled Lamb Chops. I was feeling cocky since a Yelp deal popped up with my check-in which gave me $5 off my meal. It was a quartet of nicely charred lamb chops artfully arranged with a scoop of rice, a ramekin of yogurt sauce, and sautéed vegetables - a seeded pepper, a grilled half-tomato and a pile of julienned carrots and mango (see photo).

It was deliciously savory, though as I always feel when I eat lamb chops, I found the quantity of meat a bit skimpy to the critical point where I need to decide whether I pick up the bone and gnaw. I was alone, so of course I did. And yes, I had dessert. Go ahead. Mock me. I've tried Künefe at Machka and knew it would be too overwhelming, so I went with the very satisfying $5 Sütlaç, a small crock of oven-baked rice pudding with a layer of burnt milk skin on top (see photo). This was good stuff just like I remember when I visited Constantinople in days of yore...I mean Istanbul, not Constantinople.

FOOD - 4 stars...another great Turkish find in the city
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...dark and busy on the quieter side of the Mission
SERVICE - 4 stars...definitely attentive, not too talkative
TOTAL -4 stars...Turkish delights come in many forms
author: Ed U.

description:
Decided to try Tuba for dinner after a friend recommended it. 

It was absolutely delicious. We got the Sigara Böregi, which is fried fillo dough wrapped around potato and some other fillings. It looked like an egg roll. The palate came with 4 pieces and yummy garlic yogurt sauce, which was enough for two people as an appetizer. 

For the entree, we shared the Tavuk Sis. The chicken was the perfect consistency, buttery, and melted in my mouth. The plate also came with garlic yogurt sauce in addition to a grilled pepper, bell peppers on the kebab stick, carrot slaw, rice, and some pickles. It's something where if you want to eat all the components separately you can or you can mix everything together which is the method I preferred. Our friends got the doner kebab and köfte (beef patties). Although I didn't try it, they kept reiterating how delicious their food was. 

Didn't get to try the dessert this time because we were both full with our food and wine, however the menu looked good and we will try something next time. Overall good service, awesome food and great ambience.
author: Priyanka S.

description:
This has been bookmarked for 8 months and I finally got around to it this past Friday. I'm always skeptic of Turkish restaurant's who don't serve Doner Gyro but the food was on some next level stuff. 

It took about 15 minutes for someone to come take my order after I gave them the evil eye. Ordered lentil soup and lamb adana. They brought out the soup shortly afterwards with fresh bread and a set of cottage cheese, olives, and some type of good butter. Lentil soup was really really good as they say "Best in Town". After a bit, the main entree came out. The Lamb Adana was amazing, spicy, fresh, and long (giggity). The rice was a good amount, the pepper was a pepper, and the salad was whatever. 

According to Yelp a lot of people loved their desserts but again I had to wait 10 minutes or so for someone to ask if I wanted dessert. I got the chocolate pyramid and the chocolate creme brulee. Both were really good, and a perfect way to end dinner. The only thing I would recommend to the restaurant is to be more attentive to guests when they first arrive.
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
If you can't go to Turkey, this restaurant is second best. From the moment I entered, I felt welcomed. The server was also great, and helpful with menu choices.

The restaurant is a cozy space which could be great for a romantic date, but also worked well for our group of 4.

The plates are generous, so keep that in mind if you order appetizers. We ordered the Tuba Meze Tabağı, which is a delicious assortment of their cold appetizers. I especially liked the Ispanak, a spinach and yogurt dip.

For the main course, I ordered the Eggplant Musakka, which came with a medium salad and flavorful rice. The eggplant is perfectly mixed with potatoes and zucchini, and topped with bechamel sauce, which creates an elegant dish. There are vegetarian and vegan entrees, in addition to ones with meat, so vegetarians would be happy with this restaurant.

We didn't have room for dessert, but noticed the beautiful Baklava pastry at the next table, so will try that next time.

Tuba Restaurant offers a great experience, with delicious food and very good service. Enjoy!
author: Carol W.

description: Amazing friendly service, delicious food a must go for great Turkish food. Lentil soup, Lamb chops to die for and kunefe was delightful!
author: Lulu S.

description:
The best turkish food in the city hands down. Their lamb special (marinated for 3 days) is absolutely to die for. Their mezze plate is copious and very authentic (we just came back from turkey, so we know!). And of course the Kunefe is the must have desert. To top it off, the waiting staff is incredibly nice and fun - our waiter showed us a trick with spinning around a glass of turkish tea. 5 stars all around!

We'll definitely be back!
author: Naomi L.

description:
One of the best authentic Turkish restaurants in the Bay. The kebabs are on point, as well as the mezes & the desserts. Tuba is representing a well rounded sample of the Anatolian kitchen and serves good quality dishes. 

The service was always very welcoming and reliable. I love to come here with our non-turkish friends and so far everyone was amazed. The servers are always eager to help so don't be afraid to ask any questions.

My favorites on the menu:

Cold Meze Plate
Adana Kebab
Karni Yarik
Künefe
author: Sümeyye H.

description: Delicious food. Overpriced. You will definitely lose customers, including myself. I won't be there again unless they readjust their prices reasonably.
author: Tarek S.

description: The best service. Unbelievably delicious food.  We came here once and instantly knew we'd become regulars.   I feel like making another yelp account so I can give them another 5-star review.
author: Gautam J.

description: Meze platter together with adana kebab are a must. Very friendly service and the owner is meeting and greeting guests.
author: Aysem O.

description: We had a later dinner here based off the recommendation of our Uber driver on our last night visiting the city. We had a lot of great food on our vacation but this was hands down one of the most enjoyable meals I've ever had. It was my first time at a Turkish restaurant and certainly won't be the last. The food and the service were exceptional!
author: Erin J.

description: My favorite restaurant so far! I celebrated my husband's birthday there and the workers there were very helpful and kind and brought a very nice desert with a candle to him.. The desert was soooo delicious!! I love the atmosphere there too. Great for romantic dinners.
author: Fatima E.

description: everything about this meal was perfect! the food was delicious and full of flavor without being overwhelming. they do not try to rush you through your courses, rather they let you savor each part.
author: Shan R.

description: Never really had turkish food before so was quite surprised. Got the Cevizli Ezme, İçli Köfte, HünkarBeğendi, and a fried dough dessert with sweet syrup and ice cream. The first was very salty and should be eaten with bread! (which they provide but since we were knew we weren't sure). The next appetizer reminded me of a falafel. It was hard on the outside, and in the inside it was ground beef. The dish is surrounded by a yogurt and was a good combination (much more tasty than a falafel as it was primarily meat and was very warm once you broke the ball. The eggplant entree we got is just eggplant paste. Don't expect an entire eggplant!. It had some lamb as well. Overall if you are looking for a lamb dish, I wouldnt' choose this one. It was primarily eggplant puree and some lamb. The dessert! We wanted baclava, but decided to try something new. We were glad we did, it had the same sugary syrup that drenches baclava and then string dough pieces deep fried that were kept together with some cheese. It came with some ice cream, and the warm + cold combo was good.
author: Victor D.

description: Best Turkish food in the Bay area. Good food, good servic.
author: Chalan A.

description: Delicious food.  The majority is authentic Turkish with some Mediterranean influences on a couple of dishes.  Staff is friendly and atmosphere is subdued.  Try everything!!!
author: Dean P.

description:
This place is only..okay. I had some lamb chops with rice and veggies. I ate the grilled pepper that came with it, and it was too spicy!!! I shouldn't have eaten it..... I got four pieces of chop, and my friend got five! Unfair.. :(

The lamb was okay, not too gamey, but I like the gamey flavor. The rice was really good and salty. I thoroughly enjoyed it. I did not enjoy the vegetables, just not really my thing. 

The price point was expensive.. Maybe Turkish food just isn't for me!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Thought this place was ok, but not 5 stars. The food was decent, but chicken a little tough. The service was good, but towards the end of our meal we felt stressed out by the staff trying to hurry us through our meal because they had another party waiting (there were 10 of us and we had hardly been there for 1.5 hrs when they started clearing our plates while we were still eating and handing out dessert menus).
author: Neha G.

description: Some of the most amazing Mediterranean food I've tasted! Truly a gem!
author: D K.

description: Great turkish foods, great lamb dishes, and service.  The adana kabob, lamb shank special were all great as was the kinefe dessert...outstanding.  Ambiance and service are top notch and the quality of the food is great.  It would be wonderful if they had Pide bread.
author: Shariq H.

description: This my favorite Turkish restaurant in SF i am a Mediterranean fun I always go to Tuba for there best food and the welcoming service there homemade Turkish pide with olive,butter and feta cheese is best thing the start with I always order signature meze which spicy ezme  for aptz  also lamb shank is very tender  for dessert I really die to eat the kunefe for dessert  restaurant staff has very welcoming service I will come back again thanks for best food
author: neck v.

description:
Come for the service - stay for the Turkish wine and beautiful platted Turkish foods.
I know that Tuba has other mediterranean foods beyond Turkish food such as Falafel and humus and the combination of cuisine styles feels familiar and all superbly well executed.  I have both dined in and have catered from and have always appreciated the nice portions of food and the freshness.  The owners are superbly nice and the staff has always been so friendly--be sure to order the Turkish wine.  So nice to see Turkish wine on a wine list.

I love their Cevizli Ezme - an starter plate that red pepper, walnuts, bread crumb, garlic and olive oil--nicely satisfying and a point of difference dish--a classic dish.  Their dolmas are fresh and the best I have tasted at any restaurant in the Bay Area.  I also love how they serve their bread with butter, olives and feta.  I have enjoyed on several occasions the chicken kabobs.

Also, the Turkish house made is nicely prepared and fun to watch.

A wonderful experience overall.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
We came on a Thursday evening, parking was quite the mission. We went around for awhile but eventually found a garage 3 blocks away.

Food:
Excellent, I ordered the shrimp dish. Which was amazing. $25. Reasonable. 

Service: 
Waitress was a little pushy. She really wanted us to order an appetizer although we already ordered our entrees. When I asked how long the entrees would take she said only 15 or so minutes. Which ended up being more like 25 minutes. Could be why she really wanted us to order a appetizer. 

Overall, positive experience! Would come back.
author: Gio B.

description: Have the lamb shank!  It was the best lamb I have ever had!  I asked about the cut because it's not something you can buy in regular store meat department and the chef came out to talk to us about it.  They order it special from a Turkish butcher and it's marinated for three days before it's grilled.  IT REALLY IS THST GOOD!!  We also had the dolsa stuffed grape leaves, the shrimp small plate and the roasted red pepper and walnut spread and truly everything was outstanding!  We will be back.  My husband can't stop talking about the lamb.
author: M. R.

description: This restaurant is the best Turkish food restaurant in San Francisco. They have delicious food. And not pricey. Very cozy place and people are very friendly. I strongly recommend.
author: Mahir K.

description: What an amazing experience.... great food, great customer service. Lamb chomps are one of a kind , i recommend to all my friends.
author: Ozzy D.

description: Very nice service.  Small place, filled on a Wednesday evening tells you their food is worth the trip.  Enjoyed a large family gathering here and would definitely recommend their restaurant.
author: Rj P.

description: I known my lamb chops well, have had many chops in London so let me say this, the lamb chops here are delicious. A little pricy but ambiance is nice and the crew is good too.
author: Fawad H.

description:
I can't believe there is an actual authentic Turkish restaurant in the Bay area,,, I've been disappointed many times before but Tuba not only have the great Turkish food but it's cozy and authentic atmosphere makes it a "must experience " .
I'm definitely going back especially for the lamp chops and kunefe!!! Over all friendly, professional staff and attentive awesome owners,,,
Fantastic all around..
author: Kaya U.

description:
Great place to dine.  Food was awesome, but the best thing here is a waiter who served us last night.
I will definitely come back here soon.
author: Kahori M.

description: Albeit Authentic, food lacked flavor, seasoning. We got the lentil soup, Adana Kebab, hummus, Vegan baked eggplant. Portion size was average, steep prices for what you get-&8 soup, $10 appetizer, $21-24 entree dishes. Service, however,was terrible. They were friendly but inattentive-served a table of 2 that arrived after us first,didn't get us water after asked a few times, brought us the wrong appetizer. Then, tried to push wine and dessert on us & seemed ticked off we weren't going for it. Will be skipping this joint in the future.
author: Maria T.

description:
The good folks at Tuba went above and beyond when we came in super late one evening with a visiting friend. We told the server that it was her birthday that day, and they pulled out all the stops for us despite having zero notice. 

They decorated the delicious chocolate creme brûlée we ordered for dessert with a candle and "Happy Birthday" written on the plate in tasty dessert syrups, and they even gave our friend a $20 off pass for future use at Tuba, in a hand-labeled "Happy Birthday" envelope too. 

We were just happy to even be served given that it was late and the kitchen was about to close, so to get such a warm reception was just amazing. Kudos to the folks there for being awesome. 

Oh yeah, and the food is pretty good. :)
author: Cat C.

description:
The food was good, but quite expensive for the portion size. Very little meat on each entree, and very little food in general. I'd probably need two plates to feel remotely full, and I'm only like a 180 lb male.

Other than that, service was pleasant, and the food was tasty.
author: Kevin W.

description: Excellent Turkish dining experience. Nice selection of wines, interesting and varied plates, and an amazing dessert made out of pastry and cheese. We started with a bunch of appetizers, the highlights of which were the hummus and the Cevizli Esme, a spread made out of walnuts, roasted pepper paste, and tomato paste. The falafel was also quite good. I went with the Hünkarbeendi for my main course, which was pureed eggplant topped with chunks of lamb in a red sauce. The eggplant was excellent and the lamb nicely seasoned and cooked. Overall the meal was better than any I remember having in Istanbul. (Granted I mainly ate street food there). For dessert, you MUST get the Künefe. Phyllo dough with sweet cheese, pistachio nuts, and syrup, served with ice cream on the side.
author: Michael S.

description: Tuba is the one of the best Turkish restaurant in Bay Area. If you are choice Tuba, your taste bud is going to have festival each of the bites. Real traditional taste of the Turkish food. Really fresh vegetables, well marinated quality meat. Outstanding service by each of servers. Melike is the best. Thanks to all Tuba staffs.
author: Kadriye B.

description: Amazing, authentic Turkish food from a family owned restaurant. The prices are a little too steep, but I think it's well worth the price.
author: Zorayr K.

description:
This was my 2nd visit.

Order: Mousaka falafel hummus and lamb 

Taste: 9/10 veg Mousaka tastes really good. May b small complaint is quantity of rice.
Ambience: 9/10 nothing to complain.
Service: 10/10
Price: 7/10 I always find lot of city restaurants a little pricey. I think restaurants should be affordable enough to go often. Tab with food and wine is $40 per person.
Overall:  8/10. I wish to rate it 4.5 but Yelp does not let me do that.
author: Abhijeet T.

description:
Delayed review! My husband and I went to SF in May to celebrate my birthday and wanted to find a vegetarian-friendly spot to treat our awesome friend/host on our last vacation night. This place did not disappoint. We had a reservation and were seated quickly. The bartender came by and asked if we'd be interested in drinks. He suggested a Turkish beer (our friend had that) and we went with Anchor Steam Beer. Delicious! 

Appetizers:
Sigara böregi- fillo dough stuffed with potatoes and feta cheese
Falafel on a bed of hummus
Mercimek Çorbası-lentil soup

Entrees:
Karides Tava: Shrimp
Kuzu Pirzola: Lamb chops marinated for 3 days

Desserts: 
Künefe
Baklava
Pyramid Noisette Chocolate

Everything was absolutely amazing. No complaints at all. Everything we ordered was gone and we even licked our fingers. The service was great! The server, bartender, and even the owner of the restaurant came by to check on us. The owner was really nice and conversed with us for about 5/10 minutes. She was encouraging us to visit Turkey and experience the culture and food there for ourselves (it was our first time trying Turkish cuisine)! We couldn't have had a better meal to end our vacation. Thanks Tuba! We will come back to SF just to eat here again!
author: Natalia C.

description: [Speaking as a Turkish person who has lived in the Bay Area for the past 6 years] Hands down, the best Turkish restaurant in San Francisco, and possibly in the Bay Area as well. I wanted to change the number of people on my reservation a couple of hours prior to the time, and they were very accommodating. Though a bit on the pricier side, the food was really delicious and filling. We had the awesome meze platter as a group and destroyed it pretty quickly. As for the entrees, I had hunkarbegendi, and couldn't help myself but munch on my friends' platters of karniyarik, beyti kebap, and fish. The service was great, the waitresses/waiters were very friendly, and we even got the chance to speak to the amiable owner who showed us great hospitality. Overall, a great experience which set the tone for the rest of our evening, too. Thanks Tuba!
author: Ahmet E.

description:
Excellent food. Great service.
Highlights!
Kuzu sis,
Dolma
Bread (Pide) was best ever!

Owner  needs to open much bigger restaurant like Kokkari in more accessible place. This food & service can support it big time.
author: T M.

description: Loved the ambience and the service. Falafel was out of the world and so was the rice pudding.
author: Puja I.

description: It's an amazing atmosphere with the authentic Turkish cuisine. The meat is incredibly delicious. And lastly the service is immaculate!
author: Servet B.

description: So so so so so good. I've been here multiple times and have never been disappointed. The portions are generous and the food is fantastic. We had the ispanak, mercimek corbasi, sarma beyti kebabi, and the musakka. Everything was perfect! Also, their bread and dips are fresh and delicious. My favorite Turkish place in the city for sure!
author: Nethra V.

description: Came here with my husband and we were totally blown away by the amazing food here. We got their lamb shank special and it was the most delicious lamb dish we've ever had. Everything is cooked to perfection, light but full of flavor, and service was great. The space is a little tight but feeling a bit cramped is a totally reasonable price to pay for access to this food.
author: Rachel A.

description: We chose this restaurant as a result of a good recommendation from Yelp. It was a hassle to drive around San Francisco and find parking. It was worth it to have dinner at such a delightful venue. We walked into the restaurant. It had a warm and an intimate feeling. People were dressed in casual attire and very relaxed. It felt like being invited to the home of a dear Turkish friend for a Sunday dinner. We were seated quickly. All of the staff in the dining area appeared to be genuinely Turkish people.We ordered wine from Turkey and surrounding countries. Elena had Pinot Noir and I had Pinot Grigio. Both glasses were excellent. I ordered a prawn dish as an appetizer. It was gourmet and top 1%. I was dazzled. Elena had lentil soup. She liked it and she is an expert on lentil soups. For the main course I had meat patties.They were superb. There was so much food that I couldn't eat it all. Elena had a vegetarian dish and took some of it home to reheat for lunch today at work. The bill came in at $100. This is not expensive for a San Francisco restaurant. We also saw some criticism of service. They stay full and busy so sometimes things take a little longer. It's worth the wait. This is a special and a class venue. We will be back.
author: Jack W.

description:
The best Turkish restaurant in the San Francisco Bay Area. I had phenomenal dinner at Tuba.  We started with the  cevizli ezme ( which is crushed walnuts with tomato & pepper paste and spicy. ) and icli kofte ( bulgur stuff with ground beef and walnuts) They serve all the appetizer with warm homemade bread dipped with feta cheese and olives. Highly recommended.
For the main dishes we ordered;
Lamb chops ( Best lamb I've had in the city ) 
Adana kebab ( signature entrée Lamb and beef and spicy ) 
Feta prawn ( the sauce was little spicy but really tasty) 
Turk salatasi ( salad dressing was  so good )
They also have selection of Turkish wine ask for the Turkish wine dry and fruity
For dessert;
Try the kunefe,baklava and irmik hvasi all come with vanilla ice cream . 
Great food, excellent-quick service and polite staff. we will come back soon . thank you tuba we all enjoy every moment.
author: Angel O.

description:
I've come here a couple of times. The real stars on the menu are the kebabs. They are all excellent. They have the proper meat mince so the kebab isn't too fatty or dry. I would recommend getting the adana kebab. It's unique and has a different taste than either a seekh or koobideh kebab. One of the tastiest adana kebab's I've had in the US.  The serving size is usually enough for at least one meal and sometimes even a little snack later. 

If you are looking for a unique dessert try the the kunefe.
author: Tim M.

description: Very nice environment. Great food and service. Prices are very reasonable for the quality of the food. Highly recommend the meze platter, beyti and lamb chops.
author: Gokhan G.

description: This place is closest to what you will actually get in Turkey. The food is delicious, atmosphere is chill, and the staff is very friendly. Hunkar begendi and Kunefe were both awesome. I will definitely come back.
author: Onder O.

description: They sell fresh meat that is kept very clean. Try the Kuzu Pirzola (Lamp Chops) or Sarma Beyti Kebab or Kuzu Sis... Actually, It's all good. Enjoy!
author: Hayri O.

description: I feel responsible to people who may choose to go to this restaurant to let them know that we had a disturbing experience there. My brother and sister-in-law were in town from the East Coast, their first visit here, and I wanted to bring them to an interesting restaurant near my house. The reviews for this restaurant are quite strong, so I felt confident booking a reservation for us for 6:30 seating on a Wednesday night. The restaurant was pretty much empty when we arrived. The woman who was our waitress was a Slender Woman with curly dyed blonde hair and a very Stern expression. She did not greet us but asked us if we were ready to order. As it happened the fourth member of our party had not yet arrived. He was 5 minutes late. But she was insistent in standing over us waiting for us to order, so I rescued the moment by suggesting that we have some drinks and order appetizer. She did not say those words; I had to tell her that we could proceed that way. No sooner did the appetizer arrive, and we began sampling it, she came up again with a Stern demeanor, an impatient facial expression --- no welcoming, no warmth---really a cold person---and asked us to order our entrees now. I asked her are you in a hurry? And she looked at me with no change of expression very cold and said no, and then continued standing over us. So we interrupted our appetizer and figured out what we wanted to eat and took care of her needs. Not ours. Not our needs at any point in this meal. We were still finishing our food, and let the busboy know that we were not ready to have him clear. But he went ahead and started anyway. And I looked at him and said no! I had to raise my voice to get him to understand that we weren't finished, we still wanted to have our plates. So this was terrible really. I've never had such an aggravating embarrassing and really kind of humiliating experience in a restaurant before. It was made worse by the fact that I was trying to show my guests a good time, and we had the opposite of a good time.  Everybody agreed it was terrible, deliberately rude service.  The female server was by far by far the most offensive and quite calculated in doing it.   We are friendly,  polite people , and in no way deserved such cold, rude treatment.  The two stars are for good food, but it in no way compensates and I will never return to that restaurant under any circumstances that's how strongly I feel about the experience we had there. It was awful.
author: x v.

description:
I looked forward to this place as it's been recommended and I've tried to walk in twice without a reservation (they were too busy). This time we thought ahead and brought a friend. 

Tuba has a $5 off check-in offer, but the waitress forgot to include it in the bill after she had me mark it as used. Maybe a free appetizer or drink would have been easier to remember?

We ordered an appetizer, but bread with herb butter and feta also came, which negated the appetizer. And at $12 for two meatballs (essentially) it felt overpriced. 

The entrees were large (dumplings and kalides tava- sautéed shrimp with rice and veggies) so we were stuffed. Yet we still shared the signature dessert. This probably isn't what the restaurant was going for, but it reminded me of a frosted mini-wheat as a dessert...if it were larger, baked and stuffed with honey. Don't get me wrong though, it was delicious!

After the entrees came it felt like we got less and less attention-- still the minimum, but forgetful (like a longer wait for water and dessert, and the check-in offer not being reflected in the bill). 

The food was filling and flavorful, but on the pricey side compared with the service, which was good before it got crowded. Unfortunately, 'crowded' still meant several empty tables. 

I'm left feeling like I expected too much. I'll probably return when I have money to spare, but not on a busy night.
author: Krista L.

description: Great food. Lamb shack was amazing so tender and juicy. The dessert kunefe was awesome , order this 20 minutes advance cause they cook fresh for perfection... Also highly recommend the great selection of Turkish wines . Fast customer service plus great ambiance;))) highly recommend this place.
author: miray a.

description:
Phenomenal meal. Three in our party. We started with the cold appetizer sampler platter and it was more than enough. More notably, every item on the plate was outstanding. I particularly loved the smoked eggplant and a spread of spiced tomato-based paste with walnuts. Also delicious was the cucumber-yogurt spread and white bean salad. Gorgeous presentation as well. 
Kofte (4-slider-sized burgers with Turkish spices) entree came on a beautifully arranged plate with a roasted poblano pepper, roasted tomato, fragrant basmati rice and a delicious slaw. Daily special was a lamb shank dressed with a beautiful bechamel sauce. Our server explained that the lamb shank is slow-cooked for 4 hours. It was tender, moist and falling off the bone. An outstanding entree. 
We were too full for dessert but enjoyed Turkish coffees which were served in exquisite cups, as were complimentary bites of lovely Turkush delight candy. 
Staff is warm and it's obvious they enjoy sharing their culture through their fantastic food. Their pride and love shows. 
This meal was a highlight of our visit to SF. A memorable experience, thank you Tuba.
author: michelle g.

description:
From the moment we got in, we loved this place!
The service is just perfect! Everything we ordered was great.

We had the Cold Meze, and the Dolma were specially great compared to any other Dolma I had before!! They do everything great. I love Turkish food, and this is (from now on) my favorite spot in the city!

Did I said the service was great? 
MUST: order the Turkish coffee. Not for the coffee per se , but for the trick (I don't want to be a spoiler, just trust me ;) )
author: Maggie J.

description:
I had purchased a google offer a few months ago and was super stoked to try this place.  I've recently discovered Turkish food and absolutely love it!  Of course, I don't know what's authentic...but what I do know...is what tastes good.  Haha.

I don't really have any huge complaints about tuba.  The service was good...The food was pretty alright...and the prices were decent as Tuba seems to be a higher end Turkish restaurant.  

We started off with some pide...love the stuff...ate the entire plate.  I ordered a glass of Turkish white wine although I cannot remember the name of it.  The server was wonderful...she offered me a sample prior to ordering a full glass.  The wine I had was a little on the dry side and fruity...exactly how I like it!  

For our entrees, I ordered the Hünkar Beendi, pureed eggplant with mozzarella cheese topped with lamb cubes.  DELISH.  Although the pureed eggplant had the texture of baby food...it was dang tasty baby food.  the lamb was perfectly seasoned and cooked.  good stuff.  Wifey ordered the Beyti Adana, wrapped in lavash bread served with tomato sauce and yogurt.  This item we have had at other restaurants...Tuba had our least favorite.  It just didn't have that wow factor...maybe it was a tad on the dry side?  In any case, we've had better elsewhere.  

We had to order dessert!  We picked the Künefe, two layers of kadayf (shredded fillo dough) filled with sweet cheese, baked to perfection and served with homemade syrup and pistachio nuts.  Mmmmmmmmmmmmm....The syrup was absolutely phenomenal on the cheese...this is a must order when you come here.

I'd give Tuba a 3.4...not exactly 3.5 having to round up to 4.  I don't think I'd come back again...unless there was another offer available...maybe for a glass of wine and dessert?
author: Jen W.

description: Extremely tasty food, excellent and very friendly service.  I've never tasted Turkish food this good!  Very grateful for the experience.
author: Dmitri K.

description:
Sometimes, you just need to get in the mood -- the right mood for food, that is. We had been walking all over the Mission district for nearly an hour, finding various locations either closed or not up to snuff, when we finally approached Tuba for Turkish.

Always sharing everything, we first ordered the Patlıcan Salatasi, an eggplant purée with bell peppers and garlic. Absolutely scrumptious, and I applied it with my knife upon the bread served at our table.  

Also got the Sigara Boregi, which were sets of fillo dough including potatoes and cheese, alongside a Tzatziki dipping sauce. Entree was called their Tavuk Sote, a hot herb chicken dish with plenty of olives, mozzarella cheese, tomatoes and mushrooms, served with rice. All dishes were quite satisfying, so much so that we unfortunately were full before entirely finishing!

We'd eaten an appetizer earlier on from El Techo de Lolinda at a friend's birthday, but next time, we hope to come with empty stomachs and revel in even more delicious flavors here! Their garlic spices are spot on, and that corner of Guererro (also with "Company" and "The Beast and The Hare") is certainly a hidden gem.
author: Garett T.

description: The food was outstanding! Some of the best Middle Eastern food I've found in SF. They have tables for 6; best option to get a spot and maximize the number of dishes you can share around the table. We had lamb skewers, hummus was great, and the signature mezze was really good. Can't wait to go back.
author: Michelle G.

description: Just can't wait to go back.  The food was excellent and the service beyond great.  I got this appetizer that has my mouth watering even now.  Housemate bread with a thick dill and cucumber yogurt/cheese.  Lamb was off the hook.
author: molly m.

description:
Having lived in Turkey for some time, I took way too long to finally try Tuba - in part because I was afraid it wouldn't live up to my high expectations about Turkish food. Well, I'm glad to say I was wrong - Tuba is fantastic. We had the meze tabağı (appetizer sampler plate), which is well worth the $25 and is a great starter for 3-4 people. Everything on it tasted authentic, from the patlıcan ezmesi (roasted eggplant) to the red pepper paste and the cacık (garlic-mint yogurt.) The bread was nicely toasted and came with olives and turkish cheese.

It's also really in the details, like the fact that there is kekik and sumac (two common turkish spices) mixed with salt dashed on top of certain dishes and on the corners of the plates.

Karnıyarık (roasted eggplant stuffed with meat, tomatoes, and spices) is by far my favorite dish in turkish cuisine, and Tuba's is excellent. Hot, very savory, and very filling. They did not skimp on the portion size as I find some restaurants do with this dish.

For dessert, we had the irmik helvası, a semolina-based dish over ice cream. It was really great. If you haven't had künefe, and have room in your stomach for a slightly heavier dessert, I would try that instead / as well.

The only thing that didn't quite live up to expectations was the sarma beyti kebap. While the meat was (as in the karnıyarık) delicious, the tomato sauce was a little too sweet and tasted like it had a tomato paste base instead of a fresh tomato base. However, this one small thing wasn't enough to make me consider giving anything less than a 5 star review.

The service was also excellent. If you know even a little turkish, be sure to try it out. The staff there is all Turkish, as are the chef and her husband who manages the space. They are very friendly and accommodating. 

Will definitely be returning!
author: James F.

description:
Great service and delicious lamb!  The wine that was recommended was superb.  Really friendly and intimate location. Definitely try the lamb chops!

Staff is very helpful and even was patiently holding a table for us even though some of our party was late.  Parking is tough in the Mission but this is a place you shouldn't miss!
author: Mykael N.

description: Last night was my first time trying Tuba and it was an excellent experience! From the ambience to the service, everything was excellent and on point. They have a good variety of food And the flavors are rich and complex. My absolute favorite though was the lamb chops. I could probably eat a dozen of those thing! An overall great experience and I would definitely recommend this place to anyone!
author: Idean M.

description:
I've been to this restaurant twice already. The consistency and quality of the food has been great both times. 

I'm sure whatever you try will be delicious! 

I've had the following:

Cevizli Ezme
Sigara Boregi
Mercimek Corbasi
Tavuk Sote
Kazu Sis
Sarma Beyti Kebab
Sebezli Guvec
Chocolate Cup Creme Brûlée
Rice Pudding 

No complaints on any of it! 

Service is good too!
author: Kiki O.

description: I went to Tuba Sunday night and was not disappointed. The food was incredible to say the least. Each dish was individually and overwhelmingly flavorful, but the manner in which they paired with one another is what really created a memorable experience. The service was remarkable and very attentive. Drinks remained filled, food was delivered on time. Overall, I would not only recommend this place for Turkish food, but I would recommend this place as a must try in San Francisco.
author: Matt B.

description: Love this place! Reservations are a good idea, but on a weeknight, you can probably get lucky walking in. Corkage fee is reasonable for bringing your own wine, or the restaurant has a good selection. The menu is traditionally Turkish. Highly recommend the içli köfte appetizer and the Adana kebab entree. The house bread is actually quite notable. And the service is always friendly, courteous, and professional. We've eaten here about 3-4 times now, and it never disappoints.
author: Patrick F.

description: So good!!! Place had a great atmosphere, friendly service, and amazing dishes. I'd come here again and again.
author: Anne G.

description:
Not a good value.
The food was nothing special at all. I had a lamb shank, came with about 2 tablespoons of shredded carrot salad and about 1/4 cup of a bulgar or rice side- 30 bucks. My boyfriend has the chicken kebabs and those were 22- for about 6 oz of chicken and similar sides. The Turkish coffee was served in an espresso cup. I wouldn't call that authentic. Food was not exciting by any means and cost us 75 plus a tip. I have no problem spending a little money but the food should be good. This definitively didn't live up to the yelp hype. Save some cash and go to liberties accross the street. You can have drinks and food with flavor for that price.
The pros- service was friendly, nice atmosphere.
author: Disco B.

description: Loved this place, a family member suggested this place and I immediately made a reservation for a date night with my boyfriend. They were very accommodating to me, as we made the reservation a couple hours before, and we were seated by the window in a cushioned area. Was not too crowded so we had ample space. We got the falafel salad which was delicious but we didn't realize that the entrees came with a very similar salad. For our entree, we ordered the lamb kabobs (AMAZING) perfectly seasoned and cooked. We also had the moussaka which had a mild flavor, covered in a gooey cheesy later, also delicious as well. For dessert, we chose the baklava which was perfect for the two of us. Then to close, we had the Turkish tea which was served in a tiny glass cup on a fancy serving tray. I was quite impressed. Would definitely recommend this place.
author: Jamie Z.

description:
This place is my favorite Turkish restaurant i have been eating there for 2 years.
They have good wine options and really delicious baklava and my favorite dish is rack of lamb which it was not as delicious as before.
I enjoy the Turkish coffee too.
Well done , Keep it up Guys!
author: Vedat D.

description: This is a great place! The food was delicious and the wait staff all so friendly and helpful. The table bread was fresh and delicious. I tried the Sarma Beyti Kebab (Adana kebab wrapped in lavaş bread, topped with homemade tomato and garlic yogurt sauce). The flavors were amazing. The lamb was just a little spicy, the tomato sauce slightly sweet with a creamy garlic sauce (is your mouth watering yet?) Another in the party tried the Somon Salmon (salmon baked and topped with spinach fume sauce, served with rice and veggies). The salmon was moist and tender in a spinach cream sauce.  So good you had to dip the delicious bread in it once the salmon was gone. And lastly Hünkar Beğendi (Pureed eggplant with mozzarella cheese and garlic, topped with leg of lamb chunks in red sauce). Couldn't even tell it was eggplant. Tender chuncks of lamb. Everything was delicious.  I would also recommend their signature Künefe dessert!
author: Dee S.

description: The food and service here was incredible. I had the Adana Kebab, which is ground lamb with beef and seasonings. Tender and plenty of flavor. For dessert I had the Asure, which is a "pudding" made with garbanzo beans and dried fruits. Again, very tasty, almost like apple pie. I will definitely come again.
author: Alex D.

description:
As I continue my journey, here is another Turkish restaurant.

I love lentil soup, and it is very difficult to find a good one.  Best Lentil Soup I have tried in US. It had a unique taste. It was little spicy as well. I wish soup bowl was little bigger. I literally licked the bowl. It is the best!!!

Tuba is a very nice Turkish restaurant.It is not cheap, but it is great. 

If you are not sure what to eat get mixed grill. For dessert, You have to try Kunefe. It is as good as in Turkey. Maybe even better. You will thank me later.

Very nice decoration an environment. Everybody in the restaurant was extremely  friendly.

After beautiful meal, get a Turkish coffee, and after drink it put the cup upside down. Maybe somebody will read your fortune.

Thank you again. Yelp people here is the one of the best Turkish restaurant in San  Francisco. Try it and Thank me later.
author: Hasan Y.

description:
Cok, cok, cok guzel!! This is the best Turkish restaurant I've ever eaten at stateside.

We started with the cold mezze platter, which was so, so worth it.  The hummus, cevizli ezme, and kizartma were all to-die-for, although it was all so, so good.  The table polished off every last lettuce leaf garnish on the plate.  Phenomenal.

My fiance and I are pescatarians/vegetarians so for our main entree we split the musakka and the somon.  Both were melt-in-your-mouth candidates for best meal in a restaurant.  The musakka especially was for me, truly exceptional.

The restaurant surely isn't perfect; it's small, for one thing, which meant that our table wasn't ready when we arrived for our reservation at 8:00 pm on Saturday.  Still, they let us go across the street and have a beer; when the table became ready they held it for us, which mostly made up for the delay.  Mostly.

Although I can resent them for putting off my life-changing experience of tasting that musakka...
author: Allison M.

description: The eggplants (meat and vegan) are extremely delicious!!!!!!!! The service is superb! And the mint tea is perfect.
author: Maria M.

description:
i made the colossal mistake of ordering from EAT24 through tuba.  Apparently EAT24 is the worst food delivery service in american history and does not allow you to review them on Yelp (because they are owned by Yelp) or facebook (they are against facebook for some reason).  the experience was terrible with the customer service agent calling me a derogatory name.

with this said, i must tell you that tuba handled it with class, professionalism and kindness.  i am very grateful for all the help Ishmeil (sorry if i spelled the name wrong) offered me, the kindness (the owner offered to drive the food) and the class of the way they handled it.

i highly suggest you VISIT this place (do not order from eat24).  they are first class- their food is incredible (i have had it several times prior) and they are the kind of people that make san francisco a community.  

thank you tuba for being so fabulous....keep up the great food and service.
author: Samantha B.

description:
So good. The flavors are totally authentic.  I'd say portions are a little small for the price, but not small in general, if that makes sense. For the money, you'd expect more food, but you won't need it. We shared a dessert and left completely stuffed. But it's San Francisco. Everything is overpriced. That's the only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5

Everything from appetizer through to dessert was delicious. Perfectly and delicately spiced. The service was impeccable, truly the friendly service the Turkish are famous for.

FYI the Künefe dessert was insanely good. Go eat it. Oh and make a reservation, even on weeknights they are packed.
author: jared c.

description:
My knees go really, really weak for the Tuba Meze Tabagi...
I love how it has great texture, not just mush. 
Hummus is super creamy, the Cevizle Esme is just divine, K Zartma is my favorite, and the Ispanak is just lovely because it is creamy without being too much. 

It is a bit on the expensive side: $25, but I think it's worth it for the quality and taste they produce. 

Will always go back for the Tuba Meze Tabagi!
author: Miss C.

description:
Love, the food atmosphere.  Service is great.  
One time, the older female owner came out and brought us a bottle of wine when it was one of our birthdays.  Another time, the host found us in another bar while we waited for a table to open up, getting us in 30 min quicker than expected.  Its always great service like this.

The food also is exceptional.  Kudos
author: Paul H.

description: New cuisine & new restaurant for me. Great time with friends and lots of enjoyable dishes large enough to share (which we did)!
author: Nick S.

description: I love this place! I have been here twice in three weeks and each time my guests were equally impressed. What a find. The service is spot on and the food cannot be beat. The quantity, presentation and quality are sensational. Love the shrimp dishes, the bread....I could go on and on. The prices are extremely reasonable and there is an unusual wine list with many nice wines from Turkey. During my second visit the chef visited the table to chat. So personable. The only reason I hesitate to give them five stars is that everyone else will now know about them :-).
author: Mark D.

description:
Great service!  Great food!  Great wine!  Great Turkish coffee!  Great atmosphere! 

We were visiting from New Orleans and some local friends of ours took us here for dinner.  It was our first time to try Turkish cuisine and we were not disappointed.
author: Kensie S.

description: Very authentic Turkish food. Mezes, Entrees, deserts, deserts, Tea and coffee everything tastes very very close to what we would have in Turkey. Service is great, the owner is super nice. Thanks for the great experience.
author: Ozge Y.

description: Great food, fun ambiance, polite staff. Great for intimate or large groups.
author: Dee K.

description: Tuba was absolutely fabulous. The waiters were attentive and happy to provide recommendations and descriptions. This was my first experience with Turkish food, and I was really happy with the over all experience. We had two cold meze and one hot meze. We also spilt and entree with a wine recommendation from the waiter. I will definitely be back again!
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
AMAZING service, delicious food, and great location!! When my cousin said it was in the Mission, I was kind've drawn off. Busy, sketchy, hard to find parking, but it was actually 2 streets parallel to the main street. 

We made reservations for 5pm on a Saturday. THAT IS THE PERFECT TIME to arrive. We were seriously the first group to arrive before the dinner rush. We got the front window seat towards the street. 

LOVED the Adana Kebab!!!! If you love ground beef you'll love this skewered meaty dish!!! Complete your dinner with some Turkish coffee (can request for it to be sweetened*), and have it with the Kiinefe!!!!! Cheesey sweet goodness!! It looks like a fancy hashbrown, but ooooooh!! That shredded fillo dough!!! AMAZING!!!!
author: Tiffany M.

description:
I recently had dinner here for the first time with my fiance.  The restaruarant has a chic feel to it while at the same time having a family atmosphere.  The waitstaff were really attentive and our server was really knowledgebe about the menu.  She asked questions about our individual tatses and made suggestions accordingly.  Highly recommended is the Cevizli Ezme as starter, which consists of blended walnuts, Turkish red pepper paste, tomato paste, fresh garlic, olive oil,
and cumin.  It has the consistency of hummus and is delicious with flat bread.  The moussaka is also not to be missed and we also enjoyed the Turkish Kavaklıdere Ancrya wine we tried. It reminded me of a Sauvingon Blanc.  For dessert we had the Şöbiyet, which reminded me of baklava and was delicious.
author: Paul V.

description: Best Turkish and Mediterranean cuisine in SF. Every dish is beautifully crafted and delicious, you'll have to come many times to try them all. Fresh lamb, chicken, fish. Best eggplant dishes in the Bay Area. Beautiful ambience and friendly service. We bart from Oakland just to have dinner here. They book up fast so reserve ahead.
author: Tracy P.

description:
Walked by this place a few weeks ago and decided to check it out.  I went on a Thursday evening with a friend and it was about half full.  We were greeted immediately by a very friendly server.  She let us have our choice of table and took our drink order as soon as we sat down.  We decided to try the Turkish house wine which I really enjoyed.  Our server was so sweet and came by a few minutes after dropping off the glasses to make sure we liked it.  She even offered to replace it before we gave our response. 

The falafel salad was really good especially considering the price.  I tried some of my friend's chicken which was also delicious.  It's not the best Turkish food I've ever eaten but it's reasonably priced, the service was great, and the restaurant is very cute. Definitely a place worth checking out if you're in the mood for something different!
author: Sarah H.

description:
Usually a few months after an international trip I'll locate a restaurant here at home that serves the cuisine of the region visited and reminisce through food. Istanbul was the destination in January, and I have lovely memories of the city's abundant food. On Istanbul's Asian shore there were terrific fish markets, with typically a small cafe in back popular at lunch time where one can eat well and cheaply. This experience prompted me to select the sea bream, one of two specials offered us at the outset of a recent dinner at Tuba, not necessarily expecting a mirror recreation of what was made available in Turkey but curious nonetheless what the local chefs might make of the dish. My girlfriend ordered the karniyarik eggplant off of the menu. 

As the food began to arrive the server asked if we intended to share our dishes, which is certainly feasible given the ample portions delivered and perhaps is the answer to one of the few repeated complaints on Yelp (the price per entree, that is). I think the entrees are meant to be shared. If/when we return to Tuba we have decided we will order one entree and augment this with mezzes. I think this will work very well. My sea bream was tasty but I'll likely choose something different next time. Ayran appeared on the drink menu, which thrilled me because we had tried the salted yogurt drink while on holiday and liked it a lot. I had to order it at Tuba, and it tasted very similar, just as refreshing paired with the food. 

We had actually made a reservation for early in the evening, then canceled because we weren't ready to eat yet and ended up going later just ahead of the dinner rush. We had a pokey little table pushed against the wall near the wait station that I was prepared not to enjoy but that turned out fine. The high-backed, cushioned chairs were extremely comfortable and ticked up the enjoyment scale. There appear to be a lot of people on hand to wait on the hungry at this establishment, translating to warm and convivial attention. We got to blab about our visit to Istanbul to a young woman who wasn't even our server but that had approached us anyway. The maitre d'hotel complimented me on the scarf I was wearing, and later held the door open for us to exit. I remember a similar warmth and hospitality extended to us in Istanbul, so experiencing it here was a sort of special confirmation of something that I won't preach about on Yelp. 

What a nice experience, though.
author: Brian G.

description:
I came to Tuba for dinner with a good friend. We were seated promptly and served with water. I ordered the Köfte, which is flame-broiled beef patties. I was a little disappointed with the size of my order when it came. The meat was on the dry side, and I would take in a bite of meat with some tomatoes to give it more moisture. The patties were well-spiced and have good flavor, but it was a little too dry for me to warrant more stars.

Service was decent - water was refilled when glasses were half-empty, and they were not disturbing too often asking "Is everything okay?"

I would like to give this another try but I am a little hesitant because of the small portions and expensive prices.
author: Kailin H.

description:
Tuba is great. 

Stayed in the neighborhood and got takeout from here for 3 people.

We all shared: the Tuba Meze Tabagi (a taste of all cold mezes), the Tavuk Sis, the Sarma Beyti Kebabi, the Sebzeli Guvec, and the Kunefe  for dessert. Perfect for 3 people to gorge on, and came out almost an even $100 - totally worth it.

Need to eat here more often!
author: Ches W.

description: Food was great, good vibes all around, and the staff were super friendly! Portions were also fairly large.
author: Srikar C.

description:
It is always reassuring to  find that there are  things that can be relied upon!  First, I  have always been well-advised by reviews from Yelpers. When so many people say it is good, it always is.  Second, the food and service at Tuba was excellent.  I will most definitely return to try other things on the menu.  And third, we had a lovely evening with our friends.  Who can ask for more? 

It is so nice that the tempting  descriptions of the dishes on the menu are actually followed by really delicious food!  I had the smoky eggplant purée topped with chunks of leg of lamb in red sauce..sooo good.  The others had the succulent lamb chops and the baked eggplant stuffed with ground beef and veggies.  We shared the scrumptious Tuba salad, and Noah's Pudding to round off a great meal.  I was very happy that we tried this place and can't wait to come bak!
author: Lynn R.

description:
I am judging Tuba against the food I had while traveling in Turkey - and it meets expectations.

To Start- Dolmas: and they were delicious. I hate when dolmas are served so cold you know they were just pulled from a fridge. These had a delicate texture, flavor and came at the right temperature. They were also served with a small green salad.

The Bread plate: which they give everyone is really nice. I love the spreads that came with it.

Lentil Soup: It seemed to me in Turkey every restaurant had just amazing amazing soup. This red lentil is a great representation of that. It had a nice amount of pepper in it that I appreciated and I felt it unnecessary to add a squeeze of lemon (which came with it). 

Falafel Salad: The falafels were a little to firm for my preference but they were delicious just the same. The salad was an excellently priced and healthy option your vegetarian friends and friends on diets will appreciate. 

Stuffed eggplant: My friend doesn't like bell peppers so she picked them out of it but she enjoyed the dish. (We went to Tuba because she was missing a Turkish friend's home cooking). 

Rice Pudding: I thought it would be served hot because of the description. It was served cold and was really good.

Kunefe: is a sweet cheese wrapped in shredded filo dough, baked, drizzled with syrup and sprinkled with pistachios. I'd never had this dessert before but I would tell anyone going to Tuba to order it. 

Turkish coffee: They asked how sweet I wanted it. I told them to serve it how they would in turkey and they gave it to me "only a little sweet" because I was having it with dessert. I'd seriously go back just for this. The presentation is very cool as well.

Service: very attentive and friendly without being too in your face. 

So as you can see the two of us had quite a sampling of the food. As soon as I got home I told my boyfriend we should go and we probably will in a few weeks. 

Go!
author: Alex W.

description: I love this place. It's probably the best Turkish place I have been to in the Bay Area. The food is amazing- I especially like their Mezzes. Everything else I have ordered has been amazing as well. There's a nice feeling inside with red walls.
author: Clara D.

description:
I love Mediterranean food and this place hits the spot. I appreciate that the menu marks all the gluten-free options!

Our waitress was helpful and friendly and gave us great suggestions on what to order. The special was the lamb shank and normally it's a hit or miss for me when it comes to lamb, but the lamb shank is so incredibly tender!!

I ordered a falafel salad while my boyfriend ordered the lamb shank, so I got a bite of his. The falafel salad was so good; there must be hidden yogurt or something creamy in the center of the falafels. I was so full I didn't even finish my salad.

Try Turkish wine!
author: Peggy C.

description:
Well, I have been here like 6 times in a month. Yes, they are a little costly but worth every penny. If you love hummus, this is the perfect place for you.

Get hummus, cevezle ezmi (blend of tomato, chilly)  and it comes with an awesome bread. I, also, take pomegranate  juice (always), its really good. 

My main course: Lamb chops, they are juicy, super tasty and what not! They marinate like for 3 days and serve you the best. The staff is super cool and awesome. No doubt, an awesome place! Yes, TUBA!
author: Pratik J.

description: Tuba impresses me every time. As someone with high standards for turkish food, I can confidently say Tuba is among the best in the Bay if not California in terms of taste.
author: Rob G.

description:
The food here is DELICIOUS!  It brought me back to when I visited Turkey a couple of months back and boy was it reminiscent of the tasty Turkish food I had!  This is what I sampled:
-Turk Salatasi (Turkish Salad):  recommended by our server as an appetizer, this salad is simple yet tasty and HEALTHY!  So good- we devoured it quickly!
-Karniyarik:  one of their signature dishes made with one of my favorite ingredients- eggplant!  It consists of eggplant stuffed with ground beef, tomatoes, onions, and parsley.  This entree was very flavorful.  If you've never tasted Turkish food before, I recommend trying this!  Oh it's sooooo good.

My entire group enjoyed their dishes as well.  The atmosphere is warm and cozy, and the servers are friendly.  We dropped in without reservations and luckily they had one table available.  It seems like a popular place so I recommend making reservations ahead of time.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Abby D.

description:
Excellent service and food. Every dish we ordered was delicious. We started with a salad and eggplant purée ....we didn't want to waste a drop and sopped up every bit of the yummy dressing and eggplant. Our main course was the dumplings with yogurt which were fantastic.

Nice to go to a place where the food is special and not something you could whip up at home.

Even better, I can walk there from my home.

Attentive service, nice ambience, and yummy food.

Highly recommend.
author: Gina C.

description: Awesome service and fresh beautiful food. Our Mexican waiter was very knowledge about Turkish food and even taught us how to pronounce the dish names! We were impressed by how friendly he was, the ambiance and speed of service. Highly recommend it!
author: Amy Y.

description:
We came here because of Groupon. My fault for going on the expiry date, so we waited for almost an hour for a table (with reservation). I can't comment much about the service, since it's not really fair to judge the poor service because of the massive Groupon crowds. They comped us and the owner apologized and came to our table several times. That's a nice touch.

Hummus is super delicious. I was 70% full eating it with the bread that they gave before my entree came. Falafel is yummy, I like the simple version without the goat cheese inside. For entree, the chicken kebab is very tender and juicy. The rice is just ok, which is kind of a bummer. The sauteed chicken is also really good, it's like chicken and tomato stew.

We ordered 4 different desserts and I think the Pyramid Noisette Chocolate and Künefe are sooo good. Künefe is like a sweet grilled cheese sandwich (but instead of bread, they use phyllo dough), very yummy. Helvas and Sütlaç are kinda weird and have these soft rice texture. Not my favorite.

We ended up leaving the Mission early because of the food coma. Very satisfying dinner. 4 stars!
author: Novalina N.

description:
Very good food. The cold meza consisting of spicy red pepper (forgot the name) is amazing. The bread which they gave also was yummy


We also ordered the Musakka and it was very nice creamy and rich with flavor and taste. 


 The kunafi (dessert) is a bit disappointing (way too sweet)
author: Bhanik S.

description: This place will leave you wanting to come back again and again. The atmosphere is warm and inviting make sre to make a reservation tho it can get full. I was new to Turkish food and a vegetarian and worried what they might have to offer with no meat. They had plenty of choices for me and oh everything was just amazing! They have so many small plates or mazes as they call them that you could share and make a meal of them. Or order a few small dishes and entrees as our group did and share family style. I highly recommend the larger of the small plates to share called Tuba Meze which consists of all their cold dips, hummus, and spreads. The red pepper Walnut spread is a knockout. Also their hit Meze plate called Sigara Böreği... Fillo dough stuffed with potatoes, feta cheese, parsley. This cannot be missed. We were a large group so we got to try a alot nothing disappointed, same goes with the carnivores in my party they enjoyed many of the lamb dishes and seafood. The bread is house made and the waiters are super attentive and helpful. You'll feel right at home. Make sure to try some Turkish wine or beer!
author: Christina A.

description:
Amazingly delicate flavors!

Even among the restaurants of the mission this one stands out. We loved the Icli kite with its light walnut finish, and the mucver too.

Will be back!
author: Dan O.

description: Outstanding food and service. Order beyti, sigara borek, and some Ayran. They make the Ayran there and it comes out of a tap. This is some of the best Turkish food I've had outside of turkey. Will definitely be back!
author: Erhan A.

description: Amazing!! Dinner was delicious. The service was friendly and very helpful. The ambiance was warm  and cozy. I would highly recommend Tuba.
author: Jennifer M.

description: We first tried Tuba for dinner that we ordered online and picked-up. We were blown away by the quality of food so decided to go into the restaurant. Yet again - we were blown away. From the service, to the presentation, to the flavors of the food - it was perfect. We love the Türk Salatası (a large salad) and the Sarma Beyti Kebab Adana is a super unique dish that was so simple, yet mouth watering. I fully plan to return and continue to order more items on the menu!
author: Roya P.

description:
My experience is that SF is kinda hit-and-miss when it comes to authentic foods from anywhere other than near-Asia (Cantonese, Sushi, etc. usually are fine), and Meso-American food in the Mission. There are a few stand-outs like Kokkari for Greek food, but other than that I've been left wanting.

Authenticity is the first word that comes to mind when I think about Tuba. While there are certainly a number of blanket "Mediterranean" dishes on the menu, there are other things that I'm not sure you could find elsewhere -- the Kofte Kebab is not the kind you might get at a Pakistani place -- not mild, but complex in flavor and not overpowering. Their lamb was expertly cooked -- not tough, not too gamey -- and we were very pleased away by the solid wine list including a good number of imports and locals.

I think the portion sizes were more than adequate -- my partner and I both walked away feeling full and satisfied. That said, the shrimp dish we got was a little overdone, and it did feel like something they just grabbed from Greece or Eastern Italy.

Our service was quick and attentive, but no-nonsense either, which is fine by me, but a turn-off to some. That said, the menu (with the exception of the desserts which were mostly philo-based)  is *extremely* gluten-free friendly, which is wonderful for me... I really didn't have to ask many questions about what is in what like I do at other restaurants. 

Making me feel welcome and not like an inconvenience to the chefs? That's what earned Tuba its fifth star.
author: Amy P.

description: Beefaroni. Whether from a Chef Boyardee can or a cafeteria tray, you know it held you down. This was before vegetarian / vegan options, so don't trip. Add to that the pixelated zoomed-in zoomed-out artwork and the Mr. Hankey / NTFD dish, and this is a memorable experience.
author: Dan B.

description: What I loved most about Tuba was the incredible customer service -- prompt, friendly, available for any need, and genuine!  Food-wise, the dishes were tasty and well-portioned but perhaps slightly more expensive than what I would have expected to pay for the quality.
author: Joni W.

description:
How to Woo your Honey "Flight of the Conchords" style: 

1) Tell her: 

"Looking at the room, I can tell that you are the most beautiful girl in the ... room.  In the whole wide room." 

"And when you're on the street, depending on the street, I bet you are definitely in the top 3 good looking girls on the street." 

2) Buy her a kebab. 

She'll be impressed by the selection of kebabs at Tuba.  Chicken, Lamb, Shrimp, etc.  If she's feeling indecisive, she can get the mixed grill. I ordered the Shrimp Kebabs and they were awesome ($17). Two sizeable grilled skewers of large shrimp with little wedges of lemon in between. The cool, creamy cucumber yogurt that came with it was a great accompaniment as were the perfectly cooked julienned veggies, roasted tomato, and rice pilaf that rounded out the plate. 

Hummus fans will enjoy Tuba's version as it is smooth and garlicky ($6).  Lentil Soup lovers will adore Tuba's pureed and flavorful tomato-y version. ($5) 

She will enjoy the sexy ambiance.  Deep red walls, brightly colored geometric art, elegant embroidered pillows, dark wood furniture, a cozy bar in the back, and warm and friendly service up front will help you seal the deal. 

3) And don't forget to say: 

"I can't believe, I'm sharing a kebab.  With the most beautiful girl I have ever seen with a kebab." 

"Cause you're so beautiful.  Like a tree. Or a high class prostitute.  You're so beautiful.  You could be a part time model.  (But you'd probably still have to keep your normal job.)"
