(If this doesn't work, then she's not a FOTC fan and should you really be dating her?) 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=89zOtd6VAiU
author: Amy C.

description: One of the best Turkish restaurant in San Francisco. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The prices are reasonable. If you have any interest in Turkish food, you should give a shot to Tuba.
author: Burcu K.

description:
This place was pretty good. Their lentil soup was a little different from what i expected. Its actually a puree. I was thinking it was going to be lentils with veggies. It was tasty, and had a bit of a spicy kick.

I had the mix grill for my main entree. There was so much meat on there I couldn't finish it all. Kefta, kabobs, lamb, and on and on and on. It was really delicious.
author: Kenson K.

description:
As a SF Destination Manager and Personal Concierge it is my job and duty to find THE best restaurants for my clients and I did!

Tube provides unbelievable service,the staff was incredibly warm and the flavors in everything we tasted were out of this world!!

From the cold "meze" of hummus to the Cevizli Ezme (Walnuts, Turkish red pepper paste, tomato paste, fresh garlic, olive oil, and cumin) with their fresh baked bread to hot " meze" the Peynirli Karides (Prawns sautéed with tomatoes and garlic in a lovely spicy pepperoncini sauce and topped with feta cheese) and pan-fried İçli Köfte (Bulgur on the outside and the inside stuffed with spicy ground beef with crushed walnuts & garlic) to the SPECTACULAR Turkish Moussaka and the scrumptious Tavuk Sote Herb (chicken that is BEYOND juicy, perfectly cooked in tomato sauce, green olives, onions, peppers topped with mozzarella cheese with rice and salad) And dessert? Forget about it!! I couldn't eat another bite but oh my!! Chef Merram is a wonderful GIANT talented GENIUS in the kitchen!!
author: Carmen M.

description: Decent middle eastern food - best was the lentil soup, one of best I've had / not the gourmet level of Azizza. The spreads were okay but no better than la med and many places. Main course of shrimp and vegetables was quite plain and not very flavored - and the quality of fish and produce was mediocre. Service was very slow and our dessert order simply lost
author: Clark F.

description: This is more of a 4.5 star review. I get what I didnt like about this place out first, the portions compared to the price. The only exception to this was their special which was a lamb shank and it was THE best I have ever had. Other food which I tried from others in our big group (16 people) were all very tasty, but portions were small. The wine was great and the best part was the service. Everyone were super friendly and our server was phenomenal. I did not catch his name but he was a tall latino guy. He recommended great wine to pair with our food and knew the names of the entrees better that Turkish people. This place is a must try especially for people who love great service. oh, dont forget to try their dessert and remember nothing on their menu will disappoint.
author: O S.

description: Amazing food. Cevizli Ezme, Haydari, and Mücver are absolutely outstanding. Goat cheese-filled falafel is interesting and provides good balance to the salad. Didn't expected to have an entirely vegetarian meal but left compeletely full and satisfied.
author: Adam X.

description:
Okay, so this is a hard review to write.  

I thought the food was just okay.  I was really annoyed at the ambiance because, thought it is described as a romantic date kind of place, there were kids yelling in the kitchen or upstairs (somewhere out of sight, definitely employee children playing somewhere) and a couple behind us brought their crying baby who was hysterical our entire dinner.  

However, the service was excellent.  I let them know that it was my boyfriend's birthday and they brought him a dessert and gave him a gift card for a future visit.  The owner came over and wished him a happy birthday and thanked us for choosing them for this special occasion.  I can see they really are trying to be a romantic, date-worthy restaurant.   I only wish people would be respectful and leave their screaming kids at home.
author: Kelly M.

description: We got a craving for Turkish food after spending a few hours at Mission Cliffs nearby and found Tuba on yelp. It was new year's eve and their schedule was pretty full with reservations, but they were kind enough to fit us in right before the evening rush. We ordered the meze sampler as well as the prawns and kufte and all of it was delicious. For dessert, we had kunefe with ice cream and some turkish coffee. Overall service is pretty good. Excited to come back here and try the rest of the menu another time.
author: Alice H.

description:
5-star experience in every way.  Everything we had was original and wonderful.  The service was highly attentive without being overbearing. If you are not sure what to have try the appetizer sampler mezza,  A truly wonderful assortment of goodies.

Definitely a must return. Do not miss out on this great place.
author: George S.

description:
After all these years, my first Yelp review goes to a superb experience. We had dinner here for a surprise birthday dinner my fiancé coordinated for me and we left feeling beyond content. We had 14 people in our party and they were able to accommodate us well. The staff was on point but also had fun providing excellent service. So what about the food? Authentic and delicious  just as I remembered when I had it visiting Turkey. 

When all was said and done, and the cake was cut, Tuba even gave us a token of appreciation for having our celebration at their restaurant. Class.

Dinner Date: July 2014
author: Theresa N.

description:
Overall this is a decent local spot in the mission. The bread was a bit "old" tasting they served. We split a few appetizers including the Sigara Boreği (somewhat boring, kind of more like a spring roll), falaffel and hummus which was very good. We opted for a bottle of Zin which was great, and well priced. The whole wine list here is reasonable. 

For my main I got the Hünkar Beğendi which was okay, probably the least impressive of the food I had during the meal.

Overall this place is decent, but nothing to write home about.

The staff and owner were very nice and attentive!
author: Jonah K.

description:
Yesterday we came across Tuba walking randomly around the neighbourhood, being rather hungry I suggested we take a quick look. I have already heared of Tuba, but wasn't sure it was worth the trip, eating Turkish food outside the Middle East is hardly ever a mind blowing experience! 

Upon a closer look, we quickly realised this wasn't your average kebab spot. It was beautiful and effortlessly exotic. I was looking quite shabby minus chic having been out all day backpack, tights and trainers. The lady at the door caught us as we were about to walk away, she said I look fine sit down and enjoy your time. Everyone was dressed up nicely though, just so you would know! 

They are mainly indoors but they have about 3-4 tables sitting 2-4 people outside on the street. The street itself is quite and suburby looking so it was very pleasent. 

The food is incredible!!!! They seem to use different spices and herbs, so don't expect it to taste familiar. We ordered: 

Hummus for starters (delicious) comes with their complimentary bread ( also white cheese crumbles, olives and a butter spread).

Adena kebab, a large minced meat skewer (spicy) sereved with rice (I would come back for the rice alone) and salad. 

Eggplants and  mozzarella mash topped with a red beef stew (Amazing). 

Finally Kunefe and tea. We had no room for this at all but it had to be done judging by how great the meal was. My +1 the kunefe expert says it is one of the top in the world. Too sweet for some but the tea cuts through it well if unsweetened. You could maybe ask for the syrup on the side too. The kunefe comes with mildly chewy vanilla ice cream. 

I am declaring my love for this place right now! A beautiful place, brilliant ( and I don't say this often) warm service and just great food that makes you really happy.
author: Nora B.

description:
My friends and I ate dinner here on Saturday night. The restaurant was not too busy, considering we were eating around 9:30pm.   The service was good and the servers friendly. 

We ordered the tuba cold platter, which came with all the cold appetizers.   The ones that I enjoyed were the grilled eggplant puree (Pathcan salatasi grilled), Piyaz (white bean salad), and Ezme (a tomato paste with walnuts).  

My entree was the mixed grill. Served with chicken and lamb shish, kotfe, adana, and lamb chop, it was a lot of meat.  I substituted my rice for more sautéed vegetables, which was a good choice.  It allowed me to eat more meat than starchy carbs. I still was not able to finish my meal and took the rest home.  

A good option to go to in the Mission if you want something different. Or if you don't want to drive to the Tenderloin.
author: Marck N.

description: Excellent food great casual environment.  My first but not last meal there!
author: Neil G.

description:
This was my first time trying Turkish food and it was sooo good! The venue itself is intimate and has a warm comfortable feel to it. Could be the lighting or the fact that it's family owned, but you sit down feeling at home. 

The food was amazing we had the most tender lamp chops, the pistachio crusted shrimp were perfect and we literally fought over the Kunefe- best dessert ever- definitely order one per person if you go lol the plate was flying across the table. 

The service was great, they were attentive, friendly, and walked us through the menu and our dishes letting us know how everything had been prepared. It was wonderful I am definitely going back.
author: Janai F.

description:
Meh. Not impressed. Service & staff were really nice, but that's never enough is it.

Went based on other yelp reviews during our trip to SF. It was a group of 4 foodies, and none of us thought much of it (just saying... I'm not being a food snob!). I can't quite pinpoint what was wrong, but I found the food quite bland and uninteresting. Turkish cuisine is usually bursting with flavor and meant to be an experience one bite after the other. This experience was slightly characterless. Like a dull date.

I'm breaking up with you Tuba. It's not me, it's you. And no, we can not be friends.
author: Shuchi M.

description:
When my daughter's super cool 1st grade teacher told her that his favorite restaurant of the moment was Tuba I had to check it out.  I had never had Turkish food, so it was  intriguing on that front as well.  

We were a group of five, at various life stages (single, new mom, older mom w/ older kids, etc.) so we always get that early bird table-this time 5:15.   There were only two tables until 6pm, so service was super attentive, but judging the staff it seemed like it would be like that anyway. 

Food was so tasty, actually using spices and herbs rather than dumping it with too much salt.  None of it was spicy, just super flavorful.  We did the app that let you try all the cold appetizers, and shared all the dinners-keftka, kebabs (lamb and chicken), dumplings that looked like someone pinched them with the tiniest fingers ever, and  salmon w/ yogurt sauce, And for dessert it would've been easier to tell them which ones we didn't want since we ended up ordering all but two items.  Rice pudding and their house specialty (listed as such-name escapes me) were table favs.  

So nice to try something outside of our normal routine of sushi, Italian, and burgers and pizza (thanks to kids!). 

Highly recommended!
author: Susie M.

description: Delicious, authentic Turkish cuisine. The cold meze plate was superb and the service was friendly. They even had Efes beer! Really enjoyed it and will be back again.
author: Ali B.

description:
I really enjoyed Tuba. Came here with a huuge group and we had a reservation. 
Service was great, on time and very friendly. I loved the little apps that they offer you before your food comes out as well as my shrimp kebab, and it seemed that everyone else at the table enjoyed their dishes too.

Would definitely recommend it!
author: Dominique F.

description:
Authentic Turkish Cuisine is served here in an elegant ambiance. Ezme, Manti and irmik helvasi dessert are traditional fare that many places don't offer and those three things were some of the most memorable and tasty eats I had while visiting Turkey. I know everyone thinks kabobs when they think Turkish food but there is so much more to the cuisine than meat on a stick. 

The Ezme was something I had from a street vendor in Istanbul. This was the cart that the locals lined up for. The Ezme paste of crushed walnuts, tomatoes and spices were slathered in a lavash style piece of bread and then whole leaves of romaine lettuce were placed on top and rolled up to be easy to eat as you roamed around the city. At Tuba they present it a bit more elegantly with the paste prettily plopped on a plate and the bread broken into pita chip like pieces to scoop it up with. 

The Manti is similar to beef ravioli but the sauce that tops it is a yogurt/tomato sauce. This is good stuff. The creamy , tangy yogurt sauce is incredibly addicting. It's also pretty to look at with the contrast of white and red swirled together and not completely mixed. 

The irmik helvasi is a semolina flour desert that I stopped a passing boy in the Grand Bazaar to try. In Turkey, the ice cream was encased in the flour mixture but here it's served on the side. The slightly gritty texture of the moist semolina tastes heavenly with the cold smooth accompaniment of ice cream. 

Tuba restaurant is a great find for authentic Turkish delights here in the states. Now if they served Salep(a warm horchata like drink made from the tubers of an orchid), and Dondurma(sticky ice cream) I'd be in Turkish foodie heaven but alas, the special orchid flour that is the main ingredients of those two things are a rarity outside of Turkey.
author: Oulie T.

description:
This is one of my favorite places that I've been to in San Francisco. The food is phenomenal and it's owned by a very warm and funny family.

I put my evening in their hands and took recommendations of dishes that I could neither pronounce nor really understand what they entailed. I had the İçli Köfte, Hünkar Beğendi, and the Künefe for dessert. They were all incredible. 

I really can't say enough good things about this place, and I can't stop talking about it to anyone who will listen.
author: Jimmy H.

description: Hands down, the best Turkish restaurant in the Bay Area, and I know of what I eat, I mean speak! Try the beğendi, try the mantı, try it all!!
author: Nil T.

description: The host was arrogant and rude. I want to try this restaurant but now I'm not sure if I'll return because on first impression they are ignorantly lacking on professional, polite service.
author: Jordan Q.

description: What a lovely delicious and jolly place! Obsessed with the charming service and their fresh Mediterranean fare. The chicken was super lush and juicy. The Kunefe dessert was unlike anything I'd ever tried.. Super crunchy texture with sweet pulley cheese and perfect species. Ishmael waited on us and made the whole thing feel like wine tasting experience meets moms home cooking- that is if my mom knew how to use cumin. And though modest on the outside, I'd even recommend the red sexy interior for a date night.
author: Lera D.

description: I used to like this place for the good and different food to be had here compared with other nearby options. But a few times there were quality and presentation problems. Our sampler plate was still almost frozen, obviously having just been taken out of a cold fridge. And when the prices jumped skywards, it became harder to justify going on a weeknight, or for that matter any night.
author: Bruce H.

description:
Good ambiance, but the food tasted like it might have been frozen - especially the falafel. The domas were too sweet for my taste, but might be good to someone else. 

Additionally, we were only in there for ~45mins because they brought us the bread, our wine, and dinner all at the same time about 5 minutes after we ordered. I felt rushed and it was too expensive to feel rushed.

Wont go back.
author: Brooke N.

description: Nice dinner celebrating gf's birthday!
author: Doris Z.

description: Love this place. Quick service. Great quality food. Authentic ambiance.  They bring this amazing bread, cheese, olives, and tomato paste -- absolute delight. Not to mention, it's very reasonable for the area it's in.
author: Ari J.

description: The best Turkish restaurant in the San Francisco Bay area! My son and his wife honeymooned in Turkey and Tubas seemed appropriate to begin their anniversary celebration. The four of us have worked and lived in Europe, and have experienced great ethnic restaurants. Accordingly, our expectations were high. The dolmas were superior... Better than any we had along the Bosphorus. The lamb chops were also outstanding. The Adana Kebab were great - almost as good as my lamb chops. This is authentic Turkish cuisine and well done. The cost was quite reasonable by San Francisco standards. Service was gracious, fast and attentive; the ambiance is informal and inviting; the selection was broad and varied, to include the usual Turkish drinks plus Turkish beers and wines - a wonderful place for an intimate evening with friends and family. Well worth the drive into the city!
author: J D.

description:
Holy shit is the food good here. I've honestly never had anything like it..

I've eaten Greek and eaten Mediterranean food but whats different here is that the ingredients are fresher.

A friend of mine had just gotten back from Istanbul and be says it's the real deal.
author: Chastity C.

description: We ordered a zucchini appetizer which didn't seem fresh. Had a bad stomach next day. Won't go back.
author: D T.

description: We ordered a takeaway of Bklava and Knafe, they both tasted good, but for the price we pay-20$, it wasn't worth it.
author: Ny N.

description:
I found this little gem on Yelp about 5 months back and have returned several times since because I can't get enough of their food!

Coming from New York, the one thing I really miss is small, mom & pop-type restaurants where waiters know your name and go out of their way to ensure you are enjoying your meal and having a great time. Tuba reminds me of this intimate dining experience, where the waiters/owner is invested in providing you with the freshest food and an overall great experience.

The food here is great. Some of the best mezes I've ever had. You can't go wrong with any of the dishes!
author: Roshni N.

description:
Tuba is NOT a vegetarian restaurant, and I do not understand why it is categorized as such on Yelp. The vast majority of the menu is heavy on the meat factor (I mean, it specializes in kebabs...). I came with a vegetarian friend and we were able to comfortably order non-meat items, but this is by no means a vegetarian specialty restaurant.

This confusion thankfully did not mar our otherwise tasty meal. I haven't had too much experience with Turkish food in the past, so this was a great introductory course. We got the Mucver ($7) and Musakka ($16) to share, which filled us up pretty fast. Mucver is a zucchini pancake with a refreshing yogurt sauce. I love yogurt as a sauce/condiment! Musakka is a dish of something that resembles lasagna in looks. The flavors were rich, yet not food coma-inducing. For some unknown reason, I actually really enjoyed the rice on the side.

The place started filling up substantially after 7PM on a Wednesday night. The space is relatively small and the lighting is dark. The prices might look a bit daunting at first, but I do think they are justified by the portion sizes and quality!
author: Jessica F.

description:
My girlfriend and I met in Istanbul and since we've moved back, one thing that we've missed SOOOO much is the amazing food. 
I had been hearing about Tuba for quite a while now but didn't want to risk trying it as I felt nothing would hold up to the amazing food we had gotten accustomed to at our favorite spots in Istanbul. Oh how wrong I was to hold off; Tuba is amazing. 

From the Patlican salatasi (eggplant purée), Dolma (stuffed grape leaves), (2) Adana Kebaps, Kunefe, Baklava, Turkish Coffee and Turkish Tea . . . everything was perfection. 

Can't wait to go back with the family!
author: Deniz U.

description: I had high expectations for this place. We went there for date night. It wasn't bad. Just not great. May try it again.
author: Wildeflower M.

description: Fantastic food, service, and vibe. The signature dishes are definitely the way to go. Unbelievably yummy!
author: Jen A.

description: good service and great kofte dessert. the food was okay - nothing amazing. pretty pricey for what you get.
author: Ai N.

description: Wow. And lots of it. The puree'd eggplant with lamb was exceptional. I have never had eggplants prepared in such a rich, exquisite and delicious man. Friendly staff, and friendly customers! Two sets of neighbors struck up conversations with us and made our experience even more enjoyable. Big kudos.
author: Booky C.

description:
Loved it!

The food was great - really delicious and fresh. 

Atmosphere is kind of lacking - they had serious issues with temperature control when we were there. 

Service was good - nothing to write home about. 

Will likely order to go next time, but really recommend it!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Probably the best Turkish / Mediterranean food I've ever had.   

Flavorful, and moist with unique herbs, the food here is truly authentic in style, and well prepared.  

The owner is warm and very hospitable. He makes sure each guest feels welcome and has a great  rapport with people.   His wife is the genius inside the kitchen .. constantly evolving the menu with new "Signature dishes"

I will no only be back, but will bring people here as well.
author: Ben I.

description: I am from LA, everything I 've tried was fabulous. Tuba meze dish, karides tabs, iclikofte, manti, Adana kebap, meat patties, lampchop was out of this world. If you happen to come SF please make a stop to this Turkish restaurant. Good job guys, I wish we had a Turkish restaurant like this in LA.
author: Nagihan U.

description:
I wasn't hungry enough to chow down anything more than an appetizer dish.  I ended up ordering the crab cake dish ($10).  It tasted like any other crab cake I've had, but it didn't come with tartar sauce.  It came with a small side of salad and some sort of sour-cream looking dip.  I was a little thrown off by it and was a little disappointed that it wasn't a tartar sauce.  I was fine eating without using the sour cream looking sauce though.

Note: cheapest dish here is like $10 although hummus was $6.
author: Wendy T.

description:
The food is excellent. The service is okay.

The owner said he would put my name on the list if I promised I would come (I called him on a Friday night). I told him I would be there, and that I would call if I changed my mind. I came, in-laws in tow, to find he never put my name down. After waiting a bit we were seated. 

The first server was awesome, then this guy who had no social skills took over. The first server warned us that they were working on this guy, but WTF, you know?

If you like Turkish food more than excellent service, Tuba is a must. If you need it all, you should still go because the food is awesome, but you'll be annoyed.
author: Marcus C.

description:
Turkish deliciousness!
I seriously love that Tuba moved into the neighborhood a few years ago. We eat in occasionally, and get take out all the time.
The hot & cold appetizers are great, particularly the goat-cheese stuffed falafel salad, the Mercimek Çorbası, crab cakes, Patlıcan Salatası, and Cevizli Ezme.
For mains, we're addicted to the Tavuk Sote (chicken in tomato sauce with veggies), Hünkar Beğendi (lamb cubes on cheesy pureed eggplant in amazing red sauce), and Musakka.
Dishes are large, and just super tasty. If you're eating in, the Efes Turkish pilsner is excellent.
We love Tuba, and are very happy to see it continuing to do good business!
author: Don H.

description: I took my family here for my dad's birthday. Everyone was satisfied with their order. we tried their salmon dish, lamb chops, lamb kebab, lamb kebab with a wrap, ground beef on eggplant. My dad got a complimentary birthday mousse cake which was nice of them. Service is as always...great! I have been to this place many times. Try their yakut red wine. The chianti was also good with the dishes we ordered. They also give you complimentary bread.
author: Pam Y.

description: UNREAL. This place blew my mind. The service was fantastic. The food though..... I'm still talking and thinking about it 4 days later. It was amazing. We asked the waiter what his favorite things were and they were great. I am a vegetarian and the mussaka was one of the best vegetarian meals of my life. The prices are not outrageous and the ambiance is nice inside. :) This is a must-see in the Mission.
author: Katherine J.

description: One of easier places in the mission to grab a reservation, but still very good.  The five of us started off with the cold meze sampler, which included some of every appetizer.  There were several kinds that were really delicious, and the plate comes with plenty of bread to dip with.  I got the adana kebab, which was just ok, but my girlfriend had the stuffed eggplant, which was better  Last but not least, the kunefe dessert was absolutely amazing ... soooooo good.
author: Simon L.

description: I lived in Turku seven years this is the closest to Istanbul restaurants I have been to it love it
author: Nada K.

description:
Food: Sauces and dips are the strong point. See the photos on yelp to get an idea. We tried the beyti kebabs and 3-day marinaded lamb entree. The former was good but the lamb was a bit disappointing. 

Atmosphere: Small, cozy and intimate. Right on Guerero St at a convenient distance from the public Mission/Bartlett parking garage. 

Service: Fast and friendly. 

Would recommend this place for a low key date night.
author: Food S.

description: We've been here a few times, most recently to celebrate a friend's birthday, and Tuba was perfect - nice atmosphere, excellent food at fair prices, and very attentive service. We couldn't have asked for more.  The cold meza plate was amazing as always, I really liked my eggplant stuffed with ground beef, and my husband devoured his prawns in pepperoncini sauce - we'd come back for that dish alone.  Can't wait for an excuse to go back!
author: Jeff P.

description: Icli kofte, ezme, kizartma fabulicous awesomeness. Great service. Not loud turkish music. Recommended.
author: Simge B.

description:
This place can get crazy busy.. I repeat - CUH-RAY-ZEE busy.  Fortunately, the food is worth it.  

Made a 9:00 reservation on a Thursday night.  Drove through the neighborhood and zoomed right past it.  I had enough time to squeal out, 'There it is!' before we hit the end of the block. Hubby dropped me off, as we were running a tad bit late. Successfully securing our table, I perused the menu and knew we were gonna have to make some tough decisions.  We settled on: 

* The Hot Platter - the sampler platter of their hot appetizers. Loved the falafels and deep fried cheese (who wouldn't?!) 
* Hünkar Beendi, which is pureed eggplant with mozzarella cheese topped with lamb cubes. You'd never know it was eggplant; the texture was silky smooth.  Paired wonderfully with the tender lamb cubes.  Mmm.. I almost couldn't share it.. 
* Chicken dish that had tomato sauce and onions & peppers.  
* Künefe - One of my absolute favorite desserts.  We order it at almost every Greek festival we go to.  It's layers of shredded fillo dough filled with sweet cheese, baked to perfection and served with homemade syrup and pistachio nuts. I am seriously drooling right now.. 
* Turkish Coffee - When in Rome - erm, Turkey, right? Definitely some good ish right there. Bold flavors and strong enough to get you home and then some. ;)
author: Shereen R.

description:
Great food and decently priced for the portions. I'm giving them a four because I want to come back and try more to make sure everything is as good as it was last night. We had:

walnut pepper spread - excellent! Must order more next time. 

Sautéed shrimp with asparagus - perfectly seasoned and great flavors

Lamb shank special - meat fell off the bone, but the gravy seemed a bit bland compared to the other flavors.

Stuffed eggplant - not as exciting for me since I don't eat beef much, but well prepared and great flavor

Künefe. Hands down. Best part of the meal.
author: Madison S.

description:
First off, I have to say that parking in this part of the city was a total disaster. I think we drove about 5 blocks out in every direction before finally having to park by Dolores Park, but I digress - this is a review about a restaurant not about walking 6 blocks in stilettos (lesson learned). 

The restaurant was interesting for lack of a better word. We came for a friends birthday party and I had no idea what type of food we were getting. The place is small and long. It's unfortunately really loud too, even without a ton of people in it. 

The ordered the Shepherd salad, which wasn't at all what I was expecting. I was expecting some lettuce with my veggies, but I misunderstood the concept of a Greek salad I guess. It was pretty good but I had cucumber burps for a few hours afterwards. My boyfriend ordered the Kofte kebab which was really delicious. Charred in the grill, yum!

We unfortunately didn't get to try anything else, I would have loved to have to baklava since that is my favorite but no such luck. Im not a huge fan of Greek food so I don't know if id be back but I would recommend it at least.
author: Ashley T.

description:
Well here goes my very first experience with Turkish cuisine! 

On a Tuesday night, Mr. MC decided to take me out on a date night. Not telling me where we were going, I had no idea what sort of food we were getting...but hey! Tuba was definitely a pleasant experience!

He made reservations at 6pm. We arrived late due to traffic and walked in at 6:15pm. Parking wasn't bad, but you definitely have to look.

The restaurant only had 2 other tables when we sat down. This place is very quaint. Dim lightening, colorful decor, and a special scent within the restaurant. It was relaxing, yet very classy. We were than greeted by a waitress that handed us the menu and poured us glasses of water. Being the very first time of having Turkish cuisine for both of us...we needed some time to digest the menu. 

Momentarily, this gentlemen came over and asked if it was our first time. We later on figured out his name was Burke. He gave us recommendations and was very personable. As my boyfriend butcher the names of the dishes, Burke was so nice to tell us that it is pronounced the way it looks. We decided to go with:

Appetizer: Cevizli Ezme Walnuts, Turkish red pepper paste, and tomato paste with fresh garlic, olive oil, and cumin. SO GOOD! The bread was fresh and delicious. The red pepper paste really caught Mr.MC's attention. It complimented the bread very well. It was tasty.

For entrees, we went ahead and ordered two to share:
Sarma Beyti Kebabı -  Adana kebab wrapped in lavaş bread, topped with homemade
tomato and garlic yogurt sauce. VERY saucy. If you are not someone that likes too much sauce, you might not like this dish. However, this dish was very flavorful. The garlic yogurt sauce was just right. It wasn't sour or anything. It was a generous portion.

Mantı - Dumplings stuffed with ground beef, topped with garlic yogurt sauce,
pepper flakes and dried mint. The dumpling were tiny! They were bite-sized! But the meat within was very fresh. The ground beef was a tad bit dry, however, it didn't both us because it paired well with the the sauce as well. 

Bread and water were refilled without request. We were able to eat the bread with the yogurt sauce as well!

At the end, we were stuffed but we HAD to order Pyramid Noisette Chocolate to satisfy my sweet cravings and 2 orders of the Turkish coffee. I am a coffee lover and I approve! Turns out Turkish coffee isn't in a cup or glass, it actually comes in a super tiny small mug shot. Very strong.

Burke was very helpful and personable throughout our whole dining experience. He definitely made our first Turkish cuisine an awesome one! Thank you!

p.s. check in on yelp for $5 off!
author: Stephy L.

description:
Great neighborhood restaurant with friendly yet effective service.

Have come here on multiple occasions on busy nights without a reservation and was politely and promptly accommodated. Some restaurants in this area can be downright rude towards walk-ins, so the service was much appreciated.

Everything I've had here has been excellent, from the appetizer platter to the moussaka, but if I had to pick a standout it would probably be the kunefe dessert. It's delightfully chewy yet flaky and served hot with a cold scoop of ice cream on top.

Service here has always been great as well. The owner will even occasionally come out and chat with customers!
author: Nitya S.

description:
Tuba is a great go-to place for a night out with friends, or just a casual dinner for two.  The food is delicious, the service is attentive, the ambiance is comfortable, and it's totally reasonable.  Kind of awesome across the board.  

I came here with 4 girlfriends and we all loved it.  While they offer both meat and non-meat dishes, vegetarians, gluten-free folks, and vegans would also love this place.
author: Tina T.

description:
Another monthly dinner with my cousin and another great pick on his part. We started off with the dolma. Having had them before, I knew what I was in for . . . he on the other hand didn't know what it was and didn't care for it. It's ok, more for me!

I had the Adana Kabab. I'm not a fan of lamb at all, but had to give this a try. The spices mixed in with the sirloin and lamb was fantastic. I could have had eaten another plate of this. 

For dessert we tried the Kunefe. I don't like cheese, but you would have never know it was cheese. It oddly had the taste of french toast. This is a must try for sure!
author: Adelina W.

description:
I've been to Tuba 3 times and it just keeps getting tastier with each experience!
Family owned and opperated with traditional recipes! Great service too!
Enjoy!
author: Jeffrey G.

description: We just had an outstanding meal. I liked the lamb chops but the salmon in a creamy spinach sauce was outstanding as was the sautéed shrimp. The shrimp  seemed similar to dishes that I have had in Greek restaurants although with less lemon.  The service was very friendly and accommodating.  They even chased after us when my daughter forgot her handbag.  A great family friendly place.
author: Jon R.

description:
Nice place , but a bit expensive .

Ayran is not really good , but food and desert are really good .
Especially manty , adana kebab. 

Lentil soup is not perfect but okay. 

The best turkish restaurant in the bay area in my opinion.
author: Jay M.

description:
I'd suggest getting a reservation for this place, though our group got lucky getting a table by just showing up at the door.

The food was absolutely amazing, the dolma being some of the best I've ever had and the mussaka (I don't know how to spell it, but if you're vegetarian, get this) was delicious.

Service was fantastic, with great wine recommendations by the staff. Great ambience too.
author: Sanju A.

description: By far the best Turkish restaurant in SF area. The meze platter is definitely the best. If you came in with 4 people it is a great starter, it might be a bit large for 2. The cook is amazing here, Meral. Love this place and come here often. Oh also they have some Turkish wine as well, okuzgozu is pretty good if you never taste Turkish wine.
author: Ismail S.

description:
"Do you have a reservation?"
"No."
"Uhhh..." Chuckles and shakes head. 
"You have seats open on open table."
"That's separate."
"How long is the wait?"
"Thirty minutes. So, until next time." (Lilting voice, smug smile.)

No. If you are a smug asshole, there is no next time. There is a nasty yelp review.  I'm an actual foodie. Restaurants with name chefs and Michelin stars have earned the right to be snooty; you have not. And I've never encountered this kind of rudeness from one of them. Good luck at your next job.
author: Brian L.

description:
I will never try to make hummus again.  Mine tastes like mud compared to theirs- holy cow, it was so delish I could have taken the whole tray and just had that with bread for dinner.

Wasn't a fan of their crushed walnuts dish; ezme but if you love nuts and tomatoe paste, you may be more keen to it than myself.  Enjoyed the refreshing shepard salad with abundant cucumber and the icli kofte had a wonderful thick and crispy bulgar shell encasing a spicy ground sirloin.  That was much smaller than I expected, as the icli kofte was basically two small oval, the length of an index finer and a couple fingers thick.  The salad on the other hand was much bigger and probably would have been too much for just two people if they didn't cucumber.  

Their kabab was delicious and had so much flavor.  Also big portion!  Ours was a bit dry but I think it's because we took so long eating everything else they had to keep it waiting for us.  

Pyramid Noisette Chocolate with hazelnut mousse and chocolate mousse sounds like something I would love, but it fell short.  It didn't taste like it was made with quality and care as I would have wanted it to.  On the other hand, the baklava was perfect!! 

My recommendation for two on a date: 
hummus, icli kofte, a kabab and baklava. enjoy!
author: Hannah W.

description:
After visiting Istanbul I've come to appreciate Turkish food, and aside from what you would get in the motherland Tuba is the next best thing. In my opinion it's the best Turkish restaurant in the Bay Area.

On my last visit we had the icli kofte appetizer which is ground beef mixed with walnuts, rolled into a ball, covered in breading, fried, then served on a bed of yogurt. How can you go wrong. Other menu standouts I've tried include beyti kebap (kebap wrapped in lavash bread and topped with tomato and yogurt sauce), manti (meat dumplings served in yogurt sauce--I guess I really like my dairy) and Adana kebap. The Adana kebap is different then those I've had elsewhere (and from what I'm told more authentic). The meat had a softer texture and was a lot spicier, so keep that in mind. I find most Turkish food pretty heavy so by the time I'm done with an entree I feel like I'm going to die and therefore too full for dessert. If you don't have that problem I'd suggest the kunefe and or irmik helvasi.

They have a nice selection of Turkish beers (gotta love Efes Dark) and wines. I had the red Kavaklıdere which was like a pinot noir and very good.

Service is friendly, but that may be because I always come with native Turkish speakers. Our last waiter was a real chatty Cathy but not in a creepy or oppressive way. I'll probably come back here before I go back to Turkey again, which is ok with me. Afiyet olsun!
author: Joann T.

description:
Came here with some coworkers last Friday and had a great dinner. The food was tasty, but the place was a bit squished with the backs of chairs touching each out making it kind of uncomfortable. We ordered the following items:

- Falafel on hummus - very good
- Kofte - DELICIOUS, high recommend it!
- Dumplings - very good, I've tried Turkish dumplings at other places and didn't enjoy it that much, but this place nailed the combo of tart and meaty

We also had a bottle of Turkish wine which was good, but nothing amazing.

Overall, this is a great spot in the Mission close to some cool spots. I would definitely recommend coming here for dinner!
author: Vidya D.

description: Just ok.  Food wasnt really that good in comparison to other Turkish restaurants I have been to.  After dinner Turkish tea should be free it's customary.  A little over priced too.  Probably wont go here again.  Friendly staff though.
author: Maria L.

description: Best Turkish restaurant in SF. I had the lamb chops and several different appetizers, and they were all perfectly done and tasted fantastic. The service and hospitality was excellent!!!
author: Hamza S.

description:
Surprisingly good food... not sure why it's surprising - think there was something about the name or signage that kept us from ever trying it out.  But we finally gave it a shot and will definitely go back.  

Especially enjoyed the prawn meze in pepperoncini sauce.  Delicious.  The meatball special was also tasty.  It wasn't bad, but not sure we'd get the white bean cold meze again.
author: Neil M.

description: The service at Tuba was incredible, Ismael was our server! The food was amazing. The prawns, lamb chops, and the kabab were all great. It was our anniversary and they even brought us a complimentary dessert. I would highly recommend this place! Great place for a date or small group.
author: Sam H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night for a simple birthday dinner. I'm pretty sure you have to make a reservation to eat here because the place was packed at all times. We ordered the Dolma and the Tuba Hot platter. The dolma consisted of rice wrapped in grape leaves, and the tuba hot platter contained crab cakes, falafel, sirloin wrapped in some sort of shell, pan fried zucchini, and pan fried cheese. I surprisingly enjoyed the pan fried zucchini the most.

I ordered the Adana Kebab (spicy sirloin and lamb) which turned out to be amazing. I loved dipping the meat in the yogurt and eating it with the rice. The rice was absolutely DELICIOUS. I wish I could have more of it! I tried a little of the lamb chops from the Mixed Grill which was also very good. I wish you could order an extra serving of rice!

Because we were celebrating a birthday, they gave us a complimentary dessert, which I believe is the Pyramid noisette chocolate. The only downside about the restaurant was the Chocolate cup creme brulee. We ordered three of them-- two of them were frozen on the inside, and one was soft and melting. We assumed there was something wrong with the melting creme brulee and complained to the waitress. The waitress said that the dessert was supposed to be like that, which meant two out of three of the creme brulees were prepared incorrectly. Other than that, everything here was delicious and I'm definitely coming back here for more!
author: Monica L.

description:
Hmmm, what a find!

Turkish food at its best in this small and beautifully decorated place hidden away in the Mission area.

Our waiter was friendly, attentive, and fast. 

And the Kunefe, ahh... the Kunefe was to die for. 

Will definitely go back!
author: Monique T.

description:
It was my first experience of Turkish restaurant and it was so delicious ! Omg I want to return in this place !! 
We were a group of 10 people and we order differents dishes to share :) 

I can't remember every things but I liked it so much !! 

I recommend you this place and actually you have 5$ off on your bill of you check in .
author: Laura B.

description:
My nephew took me here last night because he lived 5 years in Turkey. We got there early and we got a table right away, the one another review noted as the table by the wait station. It was not a problem and in fact Iiked it because when the place starting filling up, we had no noise issues. My nephew thought the food was very authentic and we both were very happy with what we ordered. I ordered mezzas that we shared and he had a kebob entree which was declared as spicy on the menu and it was not. I only had a taste which I liked a lot, ANY spice is too spicy for me but this didn't bother me.
We had the dessert with shredded filo, cheese, honey and ice cream it was delicious. IF you like cheese, this is a must. I also had the Turkish beer, Efes Pilsner. Which I found refreshing.
Service was perfect with one exception. Which is why I gave it 4 stars. I was thirsty and they brought warm water in a hot glass. I asked for ice water and they put a few in that melted immediately. I feel they should have paid attention and offered more ice or brought a fresh glass with ice in it. That would have been great service.
author: Anna T.

description:
Wow- real Turkish food in the City! This place is fantastic!
Went here last night for our monthly Anniversary dinner having read about it from Patricia Untermann and all I can say is how right she was in her review.
Nice room at the corner of 22nd + Guerrero, well decorated but not fussy. The menu is wonderful, with lists of cold and hot appetizers and entrees and kababs and more, we ordered both the cold and hot mezes and were knocked out. How good were they? I could have sworn I was back in Istanbul, the flavors were so perfectly balanced and presented. Everything we ate, and between the 2 of us we can pack it in and we did, was superb. Service was welcoming and friendly and helpful, wine and beer list offered wines I'd never heard of and will be back to try. 
Come and see for yourself, you won't be disappointed. Enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
Unfortunately, I do not agree with the rest of the Yelp community regarding this restaurant. The service and the food was nothing special and I will not be coming back. 

Let's start with the service. As soon as my friend and I entered, we got a bad taste in our mouth. I made open table reservations for 5 people and at the last minute, another friend of mine decided to join. I forgot to update the open table reservation, but didn't think it would have been that big of a deal. When I mentioned that there will be one more person joining us, the man who greeted us did not look happy. He was snappy with me and told me that they have a table for 5 already set up with us but he "guesses" that he can sit us at a larger table. Sorry, I didn't realize adding an additional person was going to be that big of a deal... I'll go on --- when our waitress asked my friend if he would like a recommendation of their Turkish wine, she recommended the most expensive glass of wine on the list. It's not as though my friend had a problem paying for it, it was more principle and a bit shady. Our water glasses were never refilled unless we asked. Also, I noticed that the same man that greeted us, rolled his eyes at one point when he walked by our table for no reason at all. I understand that our party may have been louder than the rest of the parties (we like to laugh and talk and not just stuff our mouths - sorry), but we do not deserve to have somebody who works there roll their eyes at us. In fact, I believe that man is either the owner or the Manager. 

As for food... nothing special. Their hummus was probably the only decent item from everything else we had ordered. The only annoying thing that happened (and never happens at other restaurants) is that my friend has an allergy for gluten and asked for cucumbers instead of their bread for the hummus. Although they were able to accommodate her, they charged her extra for 8 slices of cucumbers. Again, it's not about the money, it's the principle. For my main dish, I had their shrimp. The shrimp tasted extremely bland and they had no Turkish feel to them whatsoever. It came with plain rice and some veggies. I could have made it at home and saved my money. The rest of my party were also not thrilled with the food. 

All in all, I don't recommend this place. I hope the owners and management read this review and make a few changes.
author: Anastasia N.

description: Great appetizer dishes and traditional Turkish food. We had terrible service for a party of 5.  Just allow time to wait for service. The Turkish wine was fun and tasty.
author: A F.

description: Tuba was a pleasant surprise. We made a reservation for 2 for a Friday night. We had never been here before, and I was excited to check it out because their menu reflected some consideration of gluten-free guests. The service we received was warm and friendly, and the food was delicious! We will certainly be coming back soon.
author: Patricia D.

description:
Went here for dinner with a friend - 

Pros:
* Great ambiance
* Friendly server
* LOTS of veggie options! We ordered an appetizer platter which allowed us to sample almost all of their vegetarian starters. It was a lot of food, but a great way to try a lot of new things
*Focaccia bread was amazing (warm and perfect to eat with the appetizer platter)

Cons:
* Sigara Böreği (Fillo dough with potato and feta) entree was very bland and looked like a thin spring roll - whole dish was just oily and lacking any distinct flavor.
* Though we sampled a lot of dishes in the appetizer platter (Tuba Meze Tabağı), only the Cevizli Ezme, Haydari and the Kızartma stuck out as unique and were really yummy. The others (esp Humus and Dolma) seemed like substandard versions of dishes I could've eaten at any other Mediterranean restaurant.

Overall, it was an ordinary dining experience and I probably wouldn't come back.
author: Vaibhavi U.

description:
Tuba's relaxed, unpretentious atmosphere and good food make it a nice dinner spot. I was torn between ordering the lamb chops and lamb kabob and ultimately decided on the latter.  While my lamb was very good, my friend's chicken kabob was average (not bad, just nothing to tear your pants off over), as was my wife's Hünkar Beğendi (eggplant smothered with mozzarella). For desert, I had the Künefe, fillo dough stuffed with sweet cheese and topped with syrup, which was also pretty good. 

Overall I enjoyed my visit and there's definitely lots of appetizing things on the menu that are worth a try.  Maybe not a destination restaurant I'd return to over and over again, but if you plan to be in the Mission for dinner, it's worth a visit.
author: Ryan S.

description: This was an okay spot.  The service was great as was the atmosphere, however, the moussaka I ordered tasted more like eggplant parmesan.  I'm not an expert on moussaka but I had it at another restaurant and it was prepared a completely different way, more like a stew.  The dessert, Kunefe, was delicious - a sweet cheese in fillo dough.  If you're in the area, this is a nice spot for a date dinner.
author: Jen S.

description:
Looking for a place with nice ambiance, good food and great service? Tuba is the place to be.

This is a nice catch up with your friends place and also good for dates. I advise making a reservation, this place place is cozy.

We started with the Sigara Borei appetizer ~ pan fried feta cheese pastries with yogurt dill dipping sauce. It reminded me of lumpia with feta. It was served piping hot & crispy, really good. 

Entrees ~
I had the Stuffed Eggplant with pine nuts, onions, tomatoes, feta and rice. A flavorful, light dish, I enjoyed it very much. I normally don't eat much rice since it takes up valuable real estate in my belly, but the rice with this dish is irresistible. Try it.

My friend had the Köfte Kebab ~ ground beef and lamb with fresh herbs. I had a bite of the kebab and it was packed full of delicious flavor. 

The service was very friendly and helpful. We had a great time at Tuba. I highly recommend dining here.
author: Cathy K.

description:
The food is excellent and what a great value.  the small plates are actually quite large, filling, and delicious.  two of us shared 4 small plates and left beyond stuffed.  we probably could've just had 3 small plates and had the perfect amount of food.

we shared the piya, cevizli ezme, icli kofte, and mucver.  all of them were super tasty and pretty big portions.  i really loved the ezme- it was super flavorful and went so well with the warm bread.  next time, i'd probably skip the mucver.  i expected them to be crispy since theyre deep fried, but they were kind of pillowy.

service is a little slow, but if you're ok with a leisurely meal it's not so bad.
author: Lisa C.

description: I am not an expert on Turkish food, but we have enjoyed our two dinners here quite a bit. The service is friendly, helpful, and prompt without being rushed. The the food is delicious, the portions ample. For appetizers, we've tried a white bean salad, a fried zucchini dish with yogurt sauce, and the falafel salutasi (falafel stuffed with goat cheese, served over a bed fresh greens with an orange-y vinaigrette). All for these were delicious. The moussaka, karniyarik (stuffed eggplant), and manti (small meat-stuffed dumplings with yogurt sauce and spices) were all delicious! There's a wine list with a variety of Turkish, European, and California wines, but we found we got something better when we asked what they had that was NOT on the list. This place is definitely worth a try if you already like, or would like to try, Turkish food.
author: David K.

description: Very decent Köfte and great Baklava with ice cream. Also Turkish coffee was authentic. And they have Efes beer which gave me pleasant flashbacks to my vacations in Turkey. Waiters were very courteous and nice. Food is on par with Sheepshead bay, Brooklyn and close to Mannheim, Germany; of course not Istanbul but that wouldn't be for me to judge... Would definitely come back.
author: Till M.

description:
Excellent meal. I know nothing about Turkish food, but I sought out this place based on some Yelp reviews by people who appeared to know that this place was legit. 

We got the red pepper paste appetizer, which was great, and it comes with some fresh flat bread. I've had variants on this dip/sauce/paste/whatever before, but this was definitely the best I've had.

My friend got something or other and I got some pureed smoky eggplant with marinated lamb cubes and maybe mozzarella or something. Anyways, it was really flavorful, hearty and great.

Had some nice Turkish coffee too.
author: Mike K.

description:
The lamb was amazing and so was their cevizli ezme. 

The waiter was really nice too! I used my check-in bonus :)
author: Vi Vi V.

description: What a great dining experience! We found this place by luck and we were rewarded. Having been to Turkey the expectations were high and all of the food exceeded expectations. This is family owned and they are terrific folks! We look forward to returning!!
author: G S.

description:
AMAZING LAMB!!! I came here with a date, he had been here before and I'm so happy he brought me because ALL their food is delicious here. I can't remember everything we ordered but from the appetizers to the main-course its a definite WIN!!!

Although we had to wait, it was definitely worth it! And there's a bar right across the street that you can get a drink at during the wait or you can sit in their bar. Parking is hectic, like all of SF. I didn't finish all my lamb and it was still delicious the next day.
author: L T.

description: Asked them for tavuk sis prepared as salad, an off menu item they pulled off nicely.  Service was efficient and friendly.  Great neighborhood location.
author: Jim P.

description: Amazing authentic Turkish food. My favorite dishes: Ezme, Hunkar Begendi, Kofte and Bakalava. Everything in the menu is delicious! I strong recommend for anyone to try this restaurant.
author: Tatiana M.

description:
Went here on a lark, last-minute date with the GF after a work trip.  I love Turkish food and this place hit all the right marks.

The staff was incredibly friendly and good and the owner was onsite and checked in with all of the patrons and did a great job of making everyone feel welcome.  We sat outside on one of those few balmy warm nights and it was wonderful.

I'd also recommend it to any out-of-towners that want something a little different.  Great place.
author: Doug M.

description:
From the top - The ambiance is really nice, cozy and private. The waiters are very friendly and helpful (even if you're a first-timer trying Turkish food). They didn't keep us waiting for the food for very long either.

Now coming to the food - My friends ordered vegetarian dishes and lentil soup and they loved it. I ordered the lamb shish kabab. I expected it to be very soft but it was a little rubbery. 

The desserts completely blew my mind! The Kunefe is a must at this place! and even the Pyramid Noisette Chocolate was amazing! They are on the heavier side though, so don't get too greedy too fast.
author: Sofi H.

description:
This is a great neighborhood find (value, ambiance, and service).

Recommend the Crispy Falafels, Hünkar Beğendi, and Künefe.

We're going to try one of the Turkish wines during our next visit.
author: Francis M.

description: This is an amazing place. I have been twice here and would definitely go again. Their appetizers - Shrimp thing and hummus are amazing. One thing that you shouldnt miss is Lamb chops, marinated for three days with so much flavor and tastes delicious. Oh yeah, please dont miss their baklava. Excellent service. Five stars for this place.
author: Dinesh C.

description:
A total pleasure from start to finish. This is the real thing, fantastic Turkish food, prepared in a lovely setting with excellent service. Began with the cold appetizer platter, followed by shrimp scampi and lamb chops. Every bite was exceptional! Finished with chocolate pyramid. 
The Turkish wines were a delightful surprise. 
We will be back, very soon.
author: Nicolas E.

description:
I've never had Turkish food before, so I was hoping it would be all that it was hyped up to be. So when searching for a great place to try Turkish food for the first time I came accoss Tuba. i read the reviews and said what the heck , lets go!

With out exaggerating, it was the bombdotcom! I'm officially a turkish eater because of this restaurant! The food was amazing! The kabobs, the eggplant puree, the bread OMG i can go on and on! My date and I really enjoyed it. The service was great also, extremely friendly. We had let the owner know we never had turkish food, and he was very informative in explaing all the different foods and things to try.

Listen people, if you want to try turkish food for the first time.. GO HERE!!
author: Nezam M.

description: Service was very good. The food was good. I wouldn't say it's what you get in Istanbul, but it's very close. I would say the food in Istanbul always seemed so fresh. I didn't get that feeling here.They were a little skimpy on some things and the only real downside is the price- the food is good but it (along with overall experience) does not warrant these types of prices. I guess you have to shell out for overpriced food to get authentic Turkish food in SF (sigh).
author: Piper W.

description:
My experience at Tuba was excellent.

My parents were in town and had requested Mediterranean food, so I picked this spot - good reviews and in a cute location. I was pleasantly surprised that, instead of being a zoo like some Mission restaurants, it was quiet and mellow. It felt like we had found a fantastic secret!

Great food! All things you'd expect from a Mediterranean spot - there were these zucchini fritter items that were positively divine, and the flatbread that came before our meal was irresistible! We took our server's advice and tried a Turkish wine. It was quite good - maybe not what I want every day but a really nice pairing for the food. Nice to try something new. I had lamb on a bed of eggplant melted with mozzarella (don't ask me the official name). The eggplant shocked me - it was so unctuous and creamy. My Mom's dish also used eggplant as a base. I honestly have never seen the ingredient used so artfully before. Well priced for quality food in SF. 

The service was superb. Everyone who helped us was kind and, always a good sign, actually Turkish. The owner started chatting with my Dad and told us he and his wife had recently taken over the restaurant, maybe 2 months ago, although they had helped found it and have been involved since it opened. He told me she knew over 25 different eggplant dishes! They're working on creating a more seasonal, rotating menu. I'm looking forward to seeing what they have in store!
author: Amber C.

description: I almost tried all Turkish restaurants in the city but all of them kind of disappointed me except this place. The service was great, the dishes were very well seasoned and the desert very sweet as Turkish desserts should be. From start to the end no disappointments. Highly recommended and we will be back for sure! Recommendations: köfte, manti , Kebab and their signature desert.
author: Dr. Cordula K.

description:
Thanks to Groupon I now know about this lovely Turkish restaurant. I've been a happy vegan at other Turkish restaurants, especially in NY, so I'm thrilled to find a good local one.

I ordered the lentil soup, dolmas, and hummus. My partner ordered the stuffed falafel. The Turkish bread is wonderful -- kind of like really good focaccia but better. Softer.

The lentil soup looked different than I expected -- thicker. The taste was quite nice except it had a kick to it. I'm a bit sensitive to hotter spices (peppers) so my partner finished it and loved it.

The dolmas were superb -- more olive oil then the tangy lemon or whatever is used in other dolmas. There were a few pine nuts and maybe cornichons...they were simply delicious, okay?

Now...I am a hummus connoisseur. I ate hummus multiple times every day I was in Israel and there are subtleties involved. This hummus was creamy, tasty, and definitely lacked that heavy lemony taste that many hummuses (and just what the hell is the plural for hummus?) -- for me -- ruin the experience.

By the way, my partner loved the falafel -- stuffed with cheese -- as it was nice and moist. So often falafel is dry. I didn't try them 'cause I'm the happy vegan, remember?
author: Leslie K.

description:
I came upon this restaurant when searching for a good place for a group in the Mission.  Our friend was visiting from Amsterdam, and we had a large group of folks who love food, wine and friends.  We were not disappointed in my choice.  Tuba is in fact, one of the THE best restaurants I have eaten at in San Francisco.  The food is fantastic, flavorful and delicious and delightful.  The wait staff and owner are all incredibly helpful and friendly.  They know their food, they listen to their guests and they exceed expections.  The wine list is extensive.  There is something for everyone and all at a good price.  We had a mix of meat and various vegetarian dishes.  But, first they welcome you with plates of bread with olives, feta cheese and sundried tomato spread.  This is a complimentary and delightful surprise.  We were a large group.  We stood in the restaurant, walked around and chatted with one another as though we were in our own living room at home.  
We started with a plethora of hot and cold appetizers.  Among our favorites were a zucchini pancake with dill, hand fried feta and spiced ground sirloin in bulgar shells.  We had much more and all were equally delicious.  Our entrees, shared family style included the BEST babaganoush I have ever eaten, fresh, creamy and flavorful.  We also enjoyed mixed kabobs, vegetarian mousakka and so much more!  
As it turns our, our friend from Amsterdam is now dating a Turkish woman.  This was the perfect selection. 
I will return to Tuba again and again.  I am so happy we found this amazing restaurant.  I live in San Mateo, but it is worth the drive.
author: Erin S.

description: My review is about service and food together.  The food is good, solid 3 stars. It is a good neighborhood restaurant.  It is small: i would suggest parties for not more than 6 people for 2 reasons: 1) the place is small and cannot be comfortably set-up for larger parties; 2) they do not have experience of serving large parties: the food takes a long time, and the service is not very efficient (again, it is lack of experience of serving larger parties, not the lack of trying). However, it is a very friendly place and they do their best to accommodate.  It is not cheap, but not too expensive. The portions are fair. Really good Turkish coffee.
author: MS S.

description: The food was mmmmmmmm...... so good! Every bite was a little piece of heaven! The best (Adana) kabab I've had.... also just amazing lamb chops... Lamb chops that literally melt in your mouth. The fact that they marinate their lamb chops for three days comes across in how they taste. The beef Icli Kofte appetizer was probably worth another trip - just fabulous. All in all fantastic food. The service was so so - we didn't feel welcomed when we walked in with reservations - they were more concerned about making sure they checked off the reservation than greet/welcome us in. The waitress seemed a little pushy, but the food made up for the service. Would go again for the food!
author: Anwar H.

description: Every single bit here was delicious : the house bread, beef kefte appetizers, lamb chops, adna kabob entrees. Sadly we did n't have space for dessert !
author: Jisha A.

description:
So when I decided to do a date night with my wife I searched on Yelp for places near the movie theater and near her work in the Mission. After seeing the reviews of Tuba and being intrigued by the menu I made reservations. From the time we arrived until the time we left our experience was great! Our server and the entire staff was incredibly friendly. Her suggestions for Turkish wines were great and we enjoyed the 3 varieties that we tried. 

The food was great! We started off with the Mucver, which is pan fried zucchini patties with fresh dill. We then ordered 2 entries, the Beyti and the Adana Kebab. The Beyti (adana wrapped in lavash bread served with tomato sauce and yogurt) is somewhat like a pasta dish and was super rich!! The Adana Kebab (spicy ground sirloin and lamb) was perfectly prepared and paired with grilled vegetable and rice. Both entries left us very satisfied.

As we ordered Turkish coffee we noticed a familiar face. As it turned out it was the owner, who we knew from Park Gyro (@ 9th and Irving). He stopped and talked to us for awhile and let us know about how he took the place over and how basically everyone who worked their was Turkish and that the chef recently arrived from Turkey. He ordered us a dessert on the house and thanked us for our patronage. The dessert, which was the Künefe (two layers of kadayif  filled with sweet cheese, baked to perfection and served with homemade syrup and pistachio nuts) was a great end to an awesome meal.

Overall our entire experience was great and memorable and we will definitely be back again!
author: Dean B.

description: Great foods, the lamb chops were amazing!  Service was great as well.
author: Meiko S.

description:
Great place, great food! Absolutely everything was superb, from the wait staff to the artful presentation of the food to the delicious creme brule and Turkish coffee afterwards.  I had the salmon with spinach sauce and the shrimp and cucumber yogurt as appetizers;  others had the lamb and prawns as main dishes.  

Took the pater familias here for Father's  Day and even he was impressed!
author: Lisa G.

description: Great food! Highly recommend içli köfte (meatball apetizer). They also serve a great apetizer plate by default. If it's your first time get the apetizer sampler too and find your apetizer from there.
author: Cihan H.

description:
I've been here several times for dinner. I strongly recommend the hummus as an appetizer. The lamb kabob is my standard main. Delicious, high-quality Mediterranean food.

The ambience is dark and a bit intimate.

One time I came with an enormous group and they accommodated us well.
author: Max H.

description:
I had dinner at Tuba last night with some friends and we all loved it.

Excellent service, nice and cozy atmosphere, but most importantly, amazing food.

I've been on an eggplant kick lately so I had the Hünkar Beendi (Puréed eggplant with mozzarella cheese topped with lamb cubes). Succulent!

Great place for both groups and dates. Highly recommended!
author: Teiki K.

description: The food is fantastic and the servers are extremely friendly! Perfect for a date. A little limited for vegetarians. Only 3 main dishes available but they're all great. Cold mezzes are mostly veg and fantastic.
author: Radhika A.

description:
Tuba Tuba Tuba Tuba...

That's all I've been thinking about...

Geez golly this place was rad. The food came in very large portions and it is just like the real stuff...with real ingredients...and actual real people that care about what you want to order and stuff.

Food came quick and drinks were always full...

Yep...I'll come back
author: Indy N.

description: Had a great experience at Tuba! All the food had wonderful flavor, and the service was really good. The waiter had a really positive vibe and a big smile the whole time--he seemed happy to be there (it makes a difference). The restaurant was busy and had a certain energy, but it was not filled to the hilt accompanied by loud conversations. All in all it was a great experience and I would recommend Tuba without any trouble.
author: Vivek N.

description: Great food. We got the hummus, lentil soup, chicken kebabs and salmon. Service was a little haphazard, but it was the server's first day, so was completely understandable. The owners seemed very nice and we got a free dessert (kanafeh -- amazing!) for the service issues.
author: Janelle F.

description: First time here but will definitely be back. Dolmas were the best we've had.  We shared a delicious fish special and another appetizer, everything was wonderful, especially the service.
author: Ottis M.

description:
I had a really, really great time at Tuba and definitely would come back! The service was SO nice (the owner waited on us) and the food is fantastic and you can't beat the price for the quality that you got. I learned that the owner brought his family recipes straight out of Turkey. Yum!

First, the endless bread is great. Fresh and baked and soft, I still think about it

The menu is pretty diverse. We got the sigara boregi (fillo dough stuffed with potatoes), and falafel. The sigara actually reminded me of Chinese spring rolls. Both were flavorful.

For dinner, we got adana kebab (skewered spicy ground beef), and someone else got the karides tava (shrimp sauteed with wine) which came on a skewer. Everything was authentic and tasty and the side veggies were portioned just right. I only wish we could have eaten more or left room for dessert.

Next time!
author: Shang S.

description: On a whim, my brother and I decided to "try Turkish" food because neither of us had ever had it before. We were not disappointed at any point. The service was superb, the food was some of (if not the best) I've had since moving to SF in August. I got the kfte and my brother had a lamb special.  The food from start to finish was I unbelievably good and the they took care of us with suggestions and care all night. I can't wait to go back!
author: Kevin J.

description:
What a shit show.

Arrived at 8pm on a Friday night- we expected to have to wait. We put our name down and were told it would be a 45 minute wait. We went across the street and grabbed some beers. At 8:50 we came back- no table. At 9:10 I went in to have a chat with the person running the show about the fact that at this point, we had been waiting for more than an hour and nearly half an hour longer than we had been told the wait would be. Instead of any kind of concern or apology, I got a lecture about how they can't ask their guests to leave (there was a table of four that had finished their dessert half an hour previously). Finally, at 9:30 we gave up and went elsewhere. I wouldn't be so upset if it hadn't been for the horrible behavior of the host. Take your money to someplace that appreciates your business.
author: OnlyatBrandei S.

description: The karniyarik is delicious here, but everything else (beyti, mercimek corbasi) was just ok.  In my opinion, A La Turca on Geary was better.
author: Ivy S.

description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere - felt like a warmth of a family. Would come back and bring friends.
author: Lior A.

description: My husband is from Turkey and I've traveled there a good number of times myself, so I feel pretty confident in saying that this is some awesome Turkish food! The owner/manager/servers are all Turkish so they've tried and know all of the food really well and make honest comparisons to Tuba's food and the stuff in Turkey. I've been here a few times already and I will definitely be going again!
author: Hannah W.

description: I just had the pleasure of dining at Tuba.  From the wonderful appetizers and salads to the delicious entrees, I have to say it was a very satisfying experience.  We started out with the classic Falafel with Hummus, my go-to dish in any middle-east restaurant.  The falafel came out as disks rather than balls, presented nicely around an island of hummus.  The bread that comes with it was not your standard pita halves.  It was clearly made on site and was more delicate and flavorful than standard pita.  We also ordered the cold meza,  Turk Salatasi, a health salad, which is a mixture of cucumbers, tomatoes and onion with lemon juice and a bit of Olive Oil.  I thought the splash of lettuce greens was a nice touch.  Finally, we ordered the signature dish Hünkar Beğendi, which is pureed eggplant with mozzarella cheese and chunks of lamb floated on top.  Since it was eggplant, I was expecting something along the lines of a baba ganoush but it was far better.  The flavor was more complex but subtle.  The lamb was perfectly prepared, well cooked but tender.  Finally, the baklava for dessert was a great classic way to end the meal.  Try the Turkish tea to see the fun of the presentation.  All in all a great meal.
author: Michael C.

description:
Tuba Restaurant helped me to throw a great retirement party for my friend. The food was delicious ( as it was the night I ate there with some friends to try it out). They circulated appetizers as  we stood and visited-- dolmas and a fritter of potato and cheese were yummy. The dessert of shredded fillo dough and honey and a cheese stands out as well as their baklava.

Marel, the chef, met with me beforehand to make sure all the details of the food, the timing, and the physical layout of the restaurant would maximize the graciousness and fun of our affair. Her son Berk was there to help serve and fill in; Ismael, a  warm very  skilled waiter made sure that I could have fun at the party rather than get involved with the service. Both waiters were able to skillfully maneuver platters and drinks around our happy crowd before we sat down for the main meal. They felt like hosts and family by the end  of the party.  The main courses included a vegetarian  eggplant option with rice and carrots that was excellent.

Tuba opened their restaurant for us to have this private party during a time they normally are closed. I really appreciated their flexibility and their desire to accommodate our needs. They worked within my budget; some other places I had called would have charged me that amount simply for the use of the room before the cost of food and drinks was included! 

This party was an all-around success and I would recommend Tuba for dining out with one friend or for a large private party-- for the quality of the cooking, the gracious service, and reasonable prices.

Thank you Tuba!
author: Jane B.

description:
So we went there without having reservations (oops! and on a Friday!), but the owner, Ali, was magically able to find us an amazing table anyways! 

The wine selection was pretty large, and the waitress suggested Turkish wines that my friends really enjoyed. The food was simply excellent. It was different from some of my other Mediterranean experiences, and I mean that in a good way - I'm not normally the biggest fan of Mediterranean food. I ordered the sauteed chicken, which was perfectly cooked, and juicy and served with an amazing tomato-based sauce. We even got desserts - they have a chocolate chip creme brulee that we all loved. 

The service was quick and helpful and very friendly. They made very good recommendations. 

The atmosphere was cozy - there were many bigger tables for groups of friends, but there were also many couples there on date night. We left feeling warm and happy and quite full!
author: Megan H.

description:
We ate here for the second time last night, and I decided to write a review because I want these folks to succeed. This space has been the death of a number of restaurants in the time I've lived nearby so I'm hoping Tuba can make a go of it. It's delicious and the people are lovely.

We started off with the hot appetizer platter for the table. All of it was delicious. The things that really stood out were the crab cake and the Mücver which is a shredded zucchini patty with cheese. Delicious flavor and texture. We also liked the Sigara Boreği which are little cheesy egg roll like things made of deep fried filo.

The absolute gem of a main course though has to be the little meat dumplings called Manti. OMG. Delicious. Perfectly toothy texture, with a lovely amount of a tomato based meat sauce with yogurt. I could eat platefuls of this stuff. SO good. The menu says it takes an extra 20 minutes but it's SO worth it. 

Really nice service and very friendly. Highly recommend this place.
author: Mike F.

description:
After reading all the great reviews on Yelp we decided to try Tuba.  It was great on every level---ambiance, service, food, wine list and reasonable prices.
We had read the recommend of the dish Pide, so asked for it when we didn't see it on the menu and the waitress said she would ask the chef if he would make it.  He did and it was wonderful!!!  Like a Turkish pizza on thin crust.  The chef came out to see if we liked the dish and we raved and he said he will always make it if he has the extra dough.
Everything we ate was great, and the Turkish wine was a great complement.  We will be back so we can try more dishes. Would be fun with a big group.  And it is reasonably priced!
author: Maggie D.

description: We were wanting an authentic dinner, something unique and out of the box. We stumbled upon Tuba via open table. We couldn't have been happier!! Easily one of the best dinner we have had in a long time. Every dish we had was made with love. The service was fantastic! The manager Ishmael was working the room, chatted with everyone and was incredibly pivotal in maintaining the positive energy in the restaurant. The desserts are to die for!!! You'll leave with a muffin top, so be prepared to workout hard the next day.
author: Bobbi H.

description:
We were hoping to go to another restaurant for which the wait was over two hours. Based on the yelp reviews and a taste for something different we chose this place, and it turned out to be a great find.

An older gentleman greeted us and asked if we had reservations. We didn't and he said there would a 30 minute wait, which we were okay with. We noticed a couple of empty tables and when he saw us looking he immediately apologized and said people had reserved them. No worries, but we appreciated the info. We were however seated shortly after since another party was 20 minutes late...a no show.
