description: Food is excellent.  Price is amazingly low.  Service was very good.  Music was pleasant and not over powering.  Non-hassle atmosphere.  Decor was relaxing, yet attractive.  Other than the usual parking problems on Guerraro, what is not to like about this place?
author: Howard H.

description: one of the best turkish restaurants in San Francisco! the waiters are so nice, and the food is just perfect!
author: Maram S.

description: Great food and really nice ambience. We had the stuffed falafel salad which is huge and delicious, then we couldn't finish our entrees so we took most of them home. All of that really well priced. Try it!
author: Kathi E.

description: Fun environment, good food, good price, great staff.  they were late getting us seated but made up for it with a free appetizer plate.
author: Stefanie W.

description: Went here on a Monday night, with a groupon in hand.  The restaurant was pretty busy, a good sign. The staff super was friendly. the food was delicious, one of the best salmon dishes i've had in a long time.  the portions are big, we brought half of the main entrees home with us.  I'm so glad groupon introduced this place to me, i would have never found it on my own. But i'll sure be returning, next time I'll leave room desert!
author: Mag G.

description: Service was amazing to start.  Never felt rushed.  Setting was relaxed and cozy.  On top of that, you know its a good spot when the people eating around you are happy and excited.  Food reminded me of Turkey, all the flavors, all the dishes.  Dumplings were excellent.  Have the Ezme with bread.  Damn it was good!  I feel like I missed out since I had all but one recommended dish, which was the first dessert on the menu.  That just means I have to go back...
author: andy l.

description:
make reservations, or you gotta wait at least an hour.

we tried their appetizer sampler, they are ok 

their grill meats are hella delicious.

great Turkish coffee
author: E L.

description: Went back with a friend recently and the service and food were quite good.  We will return again.  I'll also mention that the owner or mananger contacted me after my intial post to explain what was going on that night.  Though we had to agree to disagree, he was very polite and offered to make it up to us.  I don't like it when people (user, not him) use Yelp as a blackmail tool to get free stuff so I kindly declined, and said we'd return on our own, which we did.
author: Peter C.

description: Not sure where these people with the high ratings dined. Certainly not the Tuba we went to. While the staff, especially the host, was excellent, the food was ordinary, inauthentic and dull. Come on folks, have a little more discerning palate. I like to support the neighborhood haunts as much as the next guy, but if the food is not up to par, I just can't step up. Hope to see adjustments made. Good luck Tuba.
author: Steven F.

description:
Tuba has the potential to be great.  The service was good, although they had a huge party to tend to so the waitstaff was not as attentive as I'd have hoped.  However, the owner kept checking in with us to make sure everything was alright, and that was nice.  We ordered the crispy falafel, the beyti and the mixed grill.  The crispy falafel was good but slightly on the salty side.  The beyti was pretty good although the sirloin was a little on the dry side.  And the mixed grill was well...mixed.  We asked for the meat to be cooked medium.  The lamb was fantastic.  It was cooked perfectly.  However, the chicken and the kebab were overcooked.  The chicken was dry and the kebab was even dryer--to the point where it crumbled in your mouth and you had to drink something to get it down.  If not for the dryness, this dish would have been very good.  The meats were all spiced perfectly.
I would definitely go back as I'm sure they are still working out some of the kinks.
author: Las Y.

description: Even though we didn't get bread during dinner, I'm still giving this place 5 stars because I'd love to go back.  I went to Tuba with 6 other people and everyone enjoyed the food.  For starters, we ordered the typical dolmas and falafels, which were pretty good.  As for entrees, we all kind of sampled each other's dish.  There were absolutely no complaints!  Some of the dishes ordered were: Adana kebab (3 people got this and they all loved it), Musakka (reminded me of a lasagna except with no pasta), and a dumpling dish stuffed with beef (or maybe it was lamb).  Even though the dumplings were good, I would recommend ordering an entree that comes with rice.  I don't know how they make their rice, but it is REALLY good.  For dessert, we shared the Kunefe and Pyramid Noisette Chocolate.  Both DELICIOUS!  Our waitress was also very attentive (although the restaurant wasn't extremely busy on the Sunday night that we went).  Bottom line: If you're looking for a new restaurant to try in the Mission, I'd definitely recommend going here!
author: Jennifer S.
